reviews.name: Robyn Carter
reviews.text: The food is delicious. The service was pleasant and helpful. The music was good. Great people watching. All in all a wonderful experience.

reviews.name: Brooke bretschger
reviews.text: Whether you go to the restaurant OR the bakery you can pretty much close your eyes and point to anything on the menu without being disappointed. Also, highly recommend the cucumber salad!

reviews.name: chills uwa
reviews.text: very good customer service slow with the orders very good food natural and fresh food. Here in the local area please try this restaurant also have a bakery across the street diagonally from that restaurant is very delicious to so if you're in the local area please try those restaurants you going to like the experience

reviews.name: Phil Probert
reviews.text: I have a new favorite restaurant in East Williamsburg. Very creative cocktails and delicious food packed with immense flavors. The pork buns, scallion pancakes, flys, and big chicken bun were all presented well and are highly recommended. If you enjoy Taiwanese food or Asian fusion and you haven’t been to Win Son, add it to your bucket list. It’s a gem to say the least!

reviews.name: Miaoye Que
reviews.text: Came here for brunch with my friend and it’s an AMAZING experience!!!! The food is authentic, generous in portion and leaves you wanting more. Even though it’s popular, it’s not crowded or noisy - perfect for weekend morning family time/hanging out. The hype is real, check Win Son out!!

reviews.name: Jody Cox
reviews.text: I order the Chilean sea bass every time I'm here. It's cooked to perfection served with noodles and green beans. It's a favorite amongst all my friends. Often our entire table has ordered the same dish! Tiny restaurant with great food and service. The staff is excellent. Worth the wait if you didn't plan ahead and make a reservation.

reviews.name: Angela H
reviews.text: I came here on a Saturday during brunch to grab a quick bite to eat. The waitstaff was pleasant, quick to take my order, and attentive.  The food came out promptly, was hot, and tasted good.  The scallion pancakes we're on point. The lu rou fan was interesting with the sunny side up eggs but the sauce was too sweet and clashed with the savory side of the dish.  Overall, it was decent Taiwanese food but don't go there expecting Flushing Taiwanese food standards or prices either...my check was $22.00 for these two dishes.

reviews.name: Jesse Chao
reviews.text:
Don't come here if you are looking for 100% authentic Taiwanese food. That being said, Win Son serves amazing tasting Taiwanese fusion food that takes classic Taiwanese dishes and adds a modern spin. The Lu-rou fan was amazing with the egg cooked perfectly, and the Taiwanese fried chicken and waffles are to die for. 

Definitely try to come as early as possible as there's usually a line at prime hours.

reviews.name: Carole Hines
reviews.text: Childhood memories stayed in tact after returning to this amazing place 20+ years after moving away. I can't say better things about this incredibly delicious establishment. Every amazing thing I told my husband about I was able to finally show him, and nothing had changed. Can't wait to come back again and smell that familiar chowder smell

reviews.name: damon peters
reviews.text: Certainly a four star, definitely not a five, but that’s not a knock.  It’s well done with nice food and drink and not as pricey as one would expect for location.  Highly recommend for couples or two couples, or trouples, families may be out of place.  Enjoyed the meal quite a bit.  Locals do eat here as well.

reviews.name: Michael Richtberg
reviews.text: Nice place to get a casual bite to eat with a domestic US food menu. Multiple levels provides a lot of seating. Location would allow a private company outing or party event.

reviews.name: Tom Moncho
reviews.text: Good food in a great location.

reviews.name: vincent dufief
reviews.text: Dishonest and unfriendly : they charge same price for take away than at the restaurant ! Moreover I have asked for pasta for kids with just butter and they charge me the price of « vodka pasta » (with no sauce and no vodka!). When I told the manager it’s unfair , they responded me in a very arrogant and unpleasant manner that they charge take away same price as it is the price for the ingredients and there are the same ingredients! Excepted that in my case there were not the ingredients they charged ! It is an abuse and you should definitely avoid this place.

reviews.name: Анна Атаманова
reviews.text: Very cute place, always a lot of people (a good sign), very nice to seat outside, drink some wine and eat their fabulous pasta, which actually tastes like italy. Better to reserve a table at least an hour in advance  (especially if you want to seat outside).

reviews.name: Sara Rehart
reviews.text: Calamari is amazing, but I was slightly disappointed my bolognese sauce tasted more like tomato sauce. And service was veryyyy slow for a monday night. But we sat outside and the ambience was very nice.

reviews.name: Stephania Roy
reviews.text: Cute lunch spot in Meatpacking for a quick lunch. Food came out a little fast as we still were eating our salad when the mains came out. The ravioli with porcini mushroom was to die for. The penne arrabiata was very spicy and a little over cooked but the sauce was good. Would recommend this place for a quick easy lunch.

reviews.name: Arbel Vigodny
reviews.text: Very much enjoyed the lunch special! The thali was  great with a variety of tasty dishes. This would be a great place for a vegetarian diner.

reviews.name: Clara Cambon-Thiebaud
reviews.text: I used to enjoy this place but the waitress is rude. Sometimes her brash behavior amuses us with my husband, but today I've decided I have had enough. I was having lunch alone and she walked up to me and asked me to leave because she was waiting to seat another customer... I counted and there were more than 20 empty seats in the restaurant, which I pointed out. I am always vigilant to not overstay in a crowded place, and this was far from being the case. She said it was a busy time: it was actually 2:20pm, the very end of the lunch service. As I was dining alone, I had eaten much faster than the tables seated left and right, I just wanted to finish 2 pages of my book chapter. As I got up to leave reluctantly, her colleague sat the "waiting customer" at one of the many free tables, with no problem. She didn't apologize. I used to come here often enough but I will think twice now, her rudeness ruined my lunch break.

reviews.name: Jidesh
reviews.text: Awesome quality of food compared to other locations. Love the food. It's crowded but is clean and good service.

reviews.name: Heena Ahmed
reviews.text: As an Indian, I highly recommend this place. They don’t mess with authentic Indian taste for anybody! It’s great value for money. South Indian food does not get better than this!!! ❤️🙏❤️

reviews.name: Nisha Panicker
reviews.text: Hands down the best, most authentic Indian food in the US. If you want to taste real Indian cuisine, you need to go here!

reviews.name: Sabarinath Venugopalan
reviews.text: Went with Swedish and Indian friends to showcase South Indian food.  Clean place, fast service and good food.  Big portions.  Good coffee.

reviews.name: Dinesh's Flavours
reviews.text:
Every time I miss home food I love to go to Saravanaa Bhavan. This is one of the best south Indian restaurants. There taste across the globe is amazing.

Highly suggest this place.

reviews.name: Nandini Agarwal
reviews.text: The best place to go if you are craving for South Indian food. It is usually busy here so be patient to wait for 5-10 min to be seated. I am taking 1 star off from the rating because when I checked with the server if I can get a refill for sambar he said yes but he never bought it. I had to finish my Dosa anyway then. Else the food is great here you should definately try.

reviews.name: David Vega
reviews.text: One of my favorite vegan spots in the whole city. The food is outstanding every time, and the staff is very customer friendly. Five stars for Eat By Chloe 💪🏽💯

reviews.name: Kelly Richie
reviews.text: I absolutely love this location. Michael is the BEST. So kind, attentive, quick, and knows both me and my dog by name. The best service I’ve received from a “chain” hands down. And the food is delicious too, of course! Even have dog treats for Franklin!

reviews.name: Joy M
reviews.text: Slow service but friendly and nice. Excellent food. The blue smoothie is excellent and the chicken fingers are the best vegan version around. How do they get the tempeh like that? Everything on the menu is good.

reviews.name: Scarlett Taylor
reviews.text: I love the mac, love the sweets, love the brunch items. I can rarely get a seat, but the space is gorgeous. The service is consistently ruder than any other location, so I've cut back. I'm so happy to have vegan food in the area, though.

reviews.name: Kristina A
reviews.text: Amazing food, service and staff!! Highly recommend!

reviews.name: David Hong
reviews.text: This place is incredible! The food is delicious and has just enough variety. They have a good atmosphere as well (clean, different types of chairs, bathroom). I really enjoyed the burger combo. My only complaint is that portion sizes are small.

reviews.name: Swapnila Mundra
reviews.text: A great place for vegetarians and vegans

reviews.name: Kathryn Cervantes
reviews.text: Vibrant vegan fast casual dining and bakery. Diverse menu with substitute options making dietary accommodations effortless. Delicious on top of that! Would definitely go back.

title: Red Rooster
address: 310 Malcolm X Blvd, New York, NY 10027, United States

reviews.name: Talal Thabet
reviews.text: Loved this place. Loved the music, the crowd...Food was impeccable. Service was decent. Ambiance was energetic and just perfect for a night out. Expect to have a hard time getting a table. Food may take a while but it’s worth it.

reviews.name: Natalia Agredo
reviews.text:
You don’t need encouragement to come to Red Rooster - I bet it’s already on your list. This quintessential Harlem restaurant lives up to the hype in both ambience and food quality and you need to come here ASAP.
Make a reservation, it gets very crowded. Split a pitcher (or two) of the Garvey Punch. Get the chicken and waffles. Have the best dinner you’ve ever had.

reviews.name: Lucas Villalobos Gonzalez
reviews.text: Had a great experience at red rooster this past weekend. The service was excellent, great tasting soul food. Marcus Samuelson didn’t disappoint with this eatery which bring the culture of Harlem and food together with this restaurant. Went there for brunch, had the corn bread as a starter, the French toast was amazing also. I would definitely consider coming here if you are in Harlem.

reviews.name: Gregory Mullings
reviews.text: Great experience from start to finish. Our hostess Ebony  was great. Our waitress Annalise was attentive, friendly and had excellent suggestions. The food was beyond good. Thankfully we had a large group so I got to sample a lot of the starters, each one better than the other. I will definitely be returning.

reviews.name: Marie Curley
reviews.text: Excellent restaurant! Service is great! The cook Eddie is awesome! Very classy restaurant! Would love 2 go back! I recommend people 2 go there! We will b going back again!

reviews.name: Carol Ann Dixon
reviews.text: I ate at Red Rooster in Harlem during a visit in February 2020 and had a great meal. I chose the ribs, with coleslaw and extra fries, and also had an excellent classic cocktail (Negroni). The service was swift and friendly, and the meal was reasonably priced. Dining at the bar isn't all that comfortable, so I'd advise that you book ahead and reserve a table for a more relaxed ambiance.

reviews.name: S A
reviews.text: one of the best meals of my life.  We didn't make it to Red Rooster the last time we were in the city, so we made it a priority this time.  It did not disappoint.  Staff is great and there are lots of them.  Its loud and lively, so if you're looking for calm and quiet, this isn't the place for you.  Unreal how good the food is.

reviews.name: Clarence Johnson
reviews.text: Just a tad pricey but the entire experience... Wow. Visited on a Sunday for brunch... The live jazz was amazing... Sat at the bar... The best spot for the music and the bar staff was top notch...a must visit if you go to Harlem

reviews.name: Andre Ricarte
reviews.text:
Great service. You enter and are seated right away. They give you a piece of paper with a checklist of their menu. Their placemats are menus with pictures of their food, and when you're ready, you check what you want and how many. 

Typically, the orders come pretty quick. We were out of luck though, we wanted to try their lotus sticky rice, but they were out.

reviews.name: Trung Quan
reviews.text: If I had the option for ZERO star I would select that. I ordered 7 dishes and all 7 were extremely disappointing for dim sum dishes. Please do not be fooled by the rating. I do not know who ate and rated before but you may need your taste bud checked.

reviews.name: Joseph Moore
reviews.text:
Really enjoyed my meal here.  I placed our name on the waitlist on the way over, which meant we only had to wait about 5 minutes before being seated. Highly recommended strategy.

I loved their take on the baked pork buns (rather than steamed).  My wife preferred the texture of steamed ones.

Everything we had was good, and I appreciated that the menu was small enough not to be overwhelming.

reviews.name: Marcie Wachtel
reviews.text:
Delicious of course! The Hong Kong location is preferred, but this location is still amazing! We ordered 9 dishes and spent about 61 USD, so it's a great place to explore different dishes and flavors and not have to take out a second mortgage. They had a high chair and fast service which was perfect for eating with a toddler. No place for a stroller, but when folded it fit well in the back. Downside was the rolls we got - they were bland and felt like we were only eating the wrapping. The dumplings were on point and if you can, choose everything with ginger in the description!! So good!! Of course the pork buns are mandatory, so get them!
We waited 40 minutes, but the cool part is that they send a text when it's almost your turn, so you don't have to cram into the entryway.

reviews.name: Erika W
reviews.text: I decided to check it out after hearing that the Tim Ho Wan in Tokyo can easily have over an hour wait. This place is definitely not that--I barely had to wait and will not wait hours for--but it does have decent dim sum which you can choose and order by checking off your choices on the paper menu they give you at the table.

reviews.name: sermad buni
reviews.text:
The wait was over an hour and we signed up to the online waitlist. Came when our table was ready and wait about 15 minutes longer to be seated.

The dumplings were just fine. Around $6 for 4.

If the food was exceptional I would recommend it but I can’t.

reviews.name: V
reviews.text: This is my top 2 dim sum restaurant in the US and the best one in NYC. The food is always super good and fast. Wait time is not too long, it's worth it. They have the best taro dessert, BBQ pork bun, and daikon cake. I always get these orders whenever I go here.

reviews.name: CeeCee Peng
reviews.text:
A very nice dim sum place. Be there at 10am to avoid the long lines. They only seat the full groups. So, tell your friends don’t be late :) 
As a Cantonese, I think the food here is above average but not like unbelievable great, hahah! 
Though the environment is comfortable and the staff is friendly.
Recommended!

reviews.name: Jonathan Acevedo
reviews.text: Food was amazing

reviews.name: Manveer Gill
reviews.text: Goat Chinese place.

reviews.name: Daniel Pino
reviews.text:
Family style portions

Beef chow fon - very good
Salt & pepper squid - good

reviews.name: Daniel Pino
reviews.text:
Family style portions

Beef chow fon - very good
Salt & pepper squid - good

reviews.name: Jonathan Acevedo
reviews.text: Food was amazing

reviews.name: Manveer Gill
reviews.text: Goat Chinese place.

title: Stout NYC ~ Grand Central
address: 60 E 41st St, New York, NY 10017, United States

reviews.name: Daniel Piraino
reviews.text:
Really enjoyed Stout 👍🏼👍🏼Just a short walk from Grand Central & a great place to relax while waiting for your train 🚞 
Beer 🍺 selection was nice as they had my favorite on tap -Left Hand Milk Stout👍🏼
Food was definitely good as my wife and I tried the Salmon Burger along with the grilled chicken sandwich- We also did the Brussel Sprouts (extra delicious) and the french fry’s got a 2 thumbs up from the wife - will be back 💥💥💥👍🏼👍🏼🍺🍺

reviews.name: Ben Young
reviews.text: Really enjoyed my time here. It’s a great Packers bar in the heart of Manhattan. Claire, my bartender from Ireland, was great. Good food, too.

reviews.name: Greg Webster
reviews.text: For being so close to grand central it has decent prices, a friendly staff, and walking in around 12:30 on a Thursday was no problem getting a seat. Tried the McKenzies Black Cherry cider and was pleasantly surprised. Nice spot to pop into when taking a break from walking through the city

reviews.name: Daniel Pothier
reviews.text: Great service at the bar. Mario was very friendly. Good prices and good food. Can't wait to come back for a Green Bay Packers game!

reviews.name: Masahide Kanayama
reviews.text: This is only place to charge $3 for a cup of ice. It is stealing and so dishonest. I never come here again. I will tell all my friends for this con artist type of scam here in Grand Central area. It is not written on the menu of this $3 ice charges.  If you want to be charged for $3 for few more cubes of ice please go to this crazy dishonest business.  Manger replied and he made an excuse now, instead of ice cube charges he said, now he said gave me extra portion. Such a lie and con artist.

reviews.name: Andre Johnson-Brown
reviews.text: Solid bar. Good drink selection. Crowded in the immediate after work hours, but it opens up a bit after 8. The shrimp is phenomenal. Much better than you'd expect

reviews.name: Maverick Pal
reviews.text:
A great place to just have a beer and enjoy time with friends. It’s spacious and has a good variety of drinks.

It’s also easily accessible from Grand Central, as it’s literally a block down. Central location and good everything all-around!

reviews.name: Grace Kwok
reviews.text: They didnt have happy hour.. perhaps because it was too close to grand central?

title: Hotel Chantelle
address: 92 Ludlow St, New York, NY 10002, United States

reviews.name: Helen Zhao
reviews.text: Yummy food and huge portions for most dishes. Music is way too loud but it’s a social scene. Beautiful interior design, feels like a greenhouse. Great place to have dinner with a group of friends

reviews.name: Anna Dejesus
reviews.text: Loved this place. The food, the music and the crowd were great. Our waiter was amazing. We got complimentary drinks and food. I loved everything on the menu. Wish they had stronger drinks.

reviews.name: Brittanie Anne
reviews.text: THIS PLACE IS AMAZING! From the waiter (Evert; love love love him), to our food, to the atmosphere, to the music and especially to the drinks. Very good for dates or birthdays. We had a friend recommend to us and we’re so happy we took her suggestion!

reviews.name: John Vlahos
reviews.text: $40 minimum consumption on busy nights. 3 floors with different music and different space layout. The top has table and food, the middle one has a more traditional bar feel, and the basement has a club vibe to it. Drinks are normal price for the area but the speakers are cheap and you can feel it. There are better option in the area.

reviews.name: Diane V
reviews.text: Sunday rooftop brunch. Tried their Impossible burger which was convincing of meat. All the other dishes were quite good too. Cheap drinks. The noise level was too much. Go with good friends.

reviews.name: Darshan Shetty
reviews.text:
The vibe, drinks and the live music was really nice and I would probably go back for that. The food and service does not match that. We waited for a while for the food to come to our table and when it was finally there it was lukewarm. We got the chicken and waffles and the eggs Benedict with avocado. The waffle was crispy and chicken was barely warm and it seemed like it was sitting in the kitchen for a while. They forgot the maple syrup and we had to ask for it. I didn't bother telling the waiter about the chicken being damp and cold since I didn't want yo wait another half hr for the food to come back to the table. The eggs Benedict was good but again, it was barely warm.

We got the flourless chocolate cake which was really nice but the sad part was that when it came to the table it seemed that the ice cream had melted on the plate (check out the picture attached). It was a nice desert but when you know that it was just sitting in the kitchen for a while it kills it for you.
 
It is a nice brunch place but don't expect much from the service.

reviews.name: Uma Kanth
reviews.text: Under no circumstances ever come here. I had the worst experience I’ve ever had at this establishment. When I tried to get my friend to help me pay for our drinks, management grabbed my upper arm, twisted, and screamed in my face. I was in tears. Then when my friends and I questioned the person who grabbed and twisted my arm, the management staff in question screamed in our faces and told me I had imagined it and that I deserved it anyway. Further, one of our friends was told he had to pay 40 dollars to come in. The rest of our friend group wasn’t asked to pay anything. He was dressed the same as we were in terms of fulfilling the dress code. When he said he couldn’t afford it, he was turned away. He was the only minority. Take that as you will. This bar ruined my night and left me feeling awful, but I hope this review helps you make the decision to go somewhere, anywhere else.

reviews.name: Eric Jordan Nussbaum
reviews.text: Food was great. Atmosphere was lively. Service was horrible. It felt as of the waitress forgot about us. Then apologized... sent out a dessert (that my wife was allergic to) Never offered us any dessert menus or after dinner drinks.  Instead told us the kitchen was closed, and dropped a bill. And even charged us for the dessert we did not order. Which was her apology for ignoring us 👎👎👎

reviews.name: Adelicia Moses
reviews.text: Simple decor, chandeliers, awesome menu, sweets and candy for sale. Good food. The goblet drinks for 2 are amazing, poured over ice so it smokes. I had black Angus filet grilled perfectly mashed potatoes and string beans. Delicious.

reviews.name: José Moreira
reviews.text:
At first glance it looks like the perfect place to celebrate your birthday. This is what this place is about...
But once you are there, celebrating, you feel like you are one more of the same. It's all very systematic, boring.
The food is not great. Some veggie options.

reviews.name: Kimberly Grandy
reviews.text:
A tightly packed space, but still worth the experience. I went for my mom's 50th birthday, and we purchased the Half Kong. They turn the lights down and sing happy birthday. Overall, I was satisfied, and my mom was pleased!

The drinks are expensive, but you are going for the experience. There were a lot of children present. If you decide to host a party, the drinks add up, so be prepared.

reviews.name: Derek Bacharach
reviews.text: A fun restaurant that's a dream for a teen or younger but a nightmare for a diabetic. Somehow they've squeezed a few pages of non-sugary foods like appetizers and entrees into their thick, spiral menus and offer fun foods to add to the dreamy dining experience to make you realize it wasn't just one big sugar high; instead it's the great service, the friendly wait-staff and birthday celebrations at almost every table throughout the evening with a ruckus and a birthday candle that's got some kick to it.  Fun, worth the trip from NJ for my daughter's birthday and recommended to walk off the meal at the nearby High Line.

reviews.name: Roseanna Biancardi
reviews.text: Went there last night. Did it have to work. Appetizers came out with not dishes to eat on.  Dinner did not look like there in the menu. Place was so dirty    Drinks for 36 .00.  Were horrible.   Sugar. Factory. Don’t bring kids.   They will be in sugar comers.

reviews.name: Tha Mai
reviews.text: Always on point. My friends and family from abroad love it when I bring them here.

reviews.name: Sanjay Dhar
reviews.text: Service was terrible. I don’t even know where to begin. For starters reservations don’t mean anything to them. My family and I checked in 15 minutes before our reservation and they said it will take another 25-30 minutes. 45 minutes go by and I’m seeing that they’re taking people out of order. I had to speak to the manager to get us seated which happened in the next 10 minutes or so. It took about 30 minutes for us to get our waters after we were seated. The food took another hour and only a potion of our dessert orders came out. We ended up canceling the remaining desserts. I walked up to the kiosk to settle my check and leave. I have no plans of going back. Staff is not friendly and don’t understand the basics of hospitality.

reviews.name: Diane Castle
reviews.text: I’ve been wanting to try this place for a very long time.  I’m beyond grateful for the experience.  Food was fun and good.  Staff was busy but made every effort to accommodate us.  Loved the smiles it brought to my families face and for that it was worth the wait.

title: City Winery
address: 155 Varick St, New York, NY 10013, United States

reviews.name: Bryan Glover
reviews.text: Good food and wine while watching Toad the Wet Sprocket.  Was a memorable evening.

reviews.name: Pilar Belhumeur
reviews.text: Fantastic place for live music and events. I have seen so many great artists here. Great service as well! Thank you Lamar for such friendly and great service. You are the true spirit of hospitality. Highly recommend City Winery!

reviews.name: Benjamin Spear
reviews.text: A fantastic venue, the only reason I'm giving them 4 stars instead of 5 is because the bus staff and waiters keeps taking our waters off of our tables while we're dancing. We came for a wedding, and were up there dancing and sweating our butts off, and then duck back to our tables for a sip of something cool, and all of our glasses are gone. This happened several times in a row. They also took our desserts before we were done.

reviews.name: Artëm Кazantsev
reviews.text: Awesome 👍 place for wine and music!

reviews.name: Kiariladyboss
reviews.text:
Very cool and Huuuuge place.
I was expecting a little more from the selection of wine since i walked inside a Winery.
They have a very big event space, a restaurant, a lounge and a loft.
I just had a glass of Chardonnay which was ok, haven’t tried food.

reviews.name: Brian G
reviews.text: Awesome place to see a show!

reviews.name: Ed Chubin
reviews.text: Great place for music. Nice stage.

reviews.name: Paul Steil
reviews.text:
5 stars for events.
I have only been here for events no concerts.
The staff have been on point.

reviews.name: May Hou
reviews.text: Great place for brunch. The brick chicken and oysters are good. The menu has limited items but they make their food well. I find it interesting that they try to infuse a bit of Japanese taste into their American items. Prices are a bit high though. Service is good. I wish the restaurant was located nearer to a subway stop though.

reviews.name: Dimitrios D
reviews.text:
Marlow & Sons is a delicious American restaurant.  

The raw oysters were amazing.  They were pre-flavored with some lemon (and perhaps other stuff) and needed no additional sauces.  They were also perfectly shucked and slid right off of the shells.  The scallops were also insanely tasty, and pleasantly spicy.  The cabbage pancake with bacon, and also the pork katsu, both done in a Japanese style, were excellent, too.  

I’m not sure how often the menu changes, but I’d recommend any of the above if they should be serving them again. 

Recommended!

reviews.name: Stephanie Hill
reviews.text: There's a sense of familiarity to Marlow & Sons - the kind of place you would dream of spending any Friday night. Whether it's sharing a plate of their celebrated brick chicken with a date, or enjoying a cocktail and conversation at the bar, this romantic setting is ideal for just about any occasion. The farm fresh menu changes every week, but one staple item of the last 12 years is their chicken liver pate on sour dough. It's the most decadent, beautiful, perfectly concocted whipped goodness you could ever imagine. And oh so generously slathered onto the toasted bread. It's a must try.

reviews.name: Sir Kensington
reviews.text: We ordered the butter beans and regretted it. How many beans can you put in a single entree? Too many!! thank you

reviews.name: Stefan Rest
reviews.text: Great spot to enjoy a beautiful June morning coffee and breakfast. Loved the outside seating.

reviews.name: Laure M
reviews.text: Very good place for brunch, served until 4pm. It's very low-key but we always had a good time. Service is fast and the quality is very good.

reviews.name: Katheryn Lorey
reviews.text: I can't rave enough about this place. Put it this way, I'm not big on sea food and I lived there fish soup, it was so delicious. Their food is great. It's not pretentious. Love the front are of the place, it throws you off in the best of ways, then you walk in to the dining area and it's like you walked in to secret area that no one knows about. Highly recommend it.

reviews.name: Sam Luczynski
reviews.text: Great Oysters, lovely wine. The service was great and the look very cool. Hands down the best, juicy crispy skinned roast chicken I've ever had!

reviews.name: Millie Taylor-Savage
reviews.text:
My friend suggested this place to us and I am so glad she did, it's amazing! The atmosphere is light and cheerful, the staff are friendly and polite. We didn't have to queue too long for a table and were seated quickly, our server was brilliant and checked up on us throughout our meal. The food is stunning (expensive but totally worth the price), the talent is unreal and the MC will never fail to make you laugh.

Would definitely recommend to others searching for a wonderful experience and meal!

reviews.name: Summer Pyle
reviews.text: This place was so much fun. We did have to wait 1 hour but it was worth it. I believe we waited due to a huge party. But once we were seated the fun began. The whole experience was amazing. Food was amazing! Well be going back next time I'm in New York.

reviews.name: Savannah Medford
reviews.text: Absolutely a must see when in NYC! Fun confetti filled musical environment with good food and amazing milkshakes. Definitely have a little cash to throw in their bucket they pass around which helps serving pay for singing and acting lessons. Definitely will be back!

reviews.name: Lindsay Farrell
reviews.text: We waited way too long to get into this place (almost 2 hours!!) But that was our own fault for going on a holiday weekend during school break. Wait was worth it in the end anyway! Really fun atmosphere, had a blast singing and cheering on the wait staff as they performed their hearts out. Very happy to hear that lots of them move on to Broadway shows, because that's truly where they belong.

reviews.name: Christine Keenan
reviews.text:
Lots of fun with the singing staff, very engaging. The food was ok and generous portions but it was quite pricey - burger w/ fries ($24), sandwich ($21) and Kids meal was ($16) fries and 4 pieces of mozzarella sticks (add $4.50 for the lemonade). A 20% tip is automatically added. The total with tax came to $84.

All In all a bit pricey but you should go for the experience at least once.

reviews.name: Katherine Elizabeth
reviews.text: What a great place to eat! The performers were wonderful. It was a little loud for my liking but I had earplugs so it was fine. I had the homer burger with the donut bun. What a surprisingly great burger. I totally suggest it to anyone wanting to try something different but yummy.

reviews.name: Frank Smith
reviews.text:
My family and I had the chance to visit Ellen's Stardust Diner while on Vacation in NYC over spring break during 2019.  At first, we were a bit weary because of the line of people wrapped around the building day and night, but we bit the bullet and went for it. I am grateful we did because we absolutely loved this place. The atmosphere and entertainment were fantastic, and my kids, who were 8 & 9 at the time, went nuts with excitement. 

In summary, this is a must-visit when traveling to NYC with kids. Great entertainment, decent food, and decent food prices for NYC anyway.

reviews.name: Frank N
reviews.text: Surprisingly good time. We sat on the second floor on the rail and enjoyed the performances by the singers while we are out lunch. It's a bit pricey for what you are getting BUT the music makes it all worth while. Go and enjoy!

reviews.name: Randall Stempler
reviews.text:
A great place, depending on what you are looking for.  Just had a wonderful meal here, but it was not the food that made it special.  The food was fairly average (and had some issues along the way), but all in all I had an excellent experience.

First, weather permitting, one has a choice between eating outside or inside.  As it was cool outside, the bar and dining area was covered by a tent, and the sound was loud to say the least.  Inside the building, as perhaps befitting a restaurant at a church, it was almost silence.  Also, there is a soaring ceiling.  The atmosphere is not elegant, but a solemn refinement.  

The rolls to start out the meal were soft, tasty and slightly warm. 

For the main courses, we had the good short ribs (which could have used some more sauce), some good crab cakes, and a fairly good, but not extraordinary burger.  I prefer my burger without any extra sauces, but just fried onions.  They nicely were able to accommodate me. I specifically asked for a plain burger with onions and without cheese. Well it came with cheese. Sent it back and it came medium when I wanted it rare to medium rare.  Sent it back again and it was medium rare in parts and medium in others. On the other hand the french fries were fabulous.  They were very moist and with skins.  The way I like them. Delicious.   Anyway, they were very nice and did not charge us for the burger.  Not only that but they brought us all a lovely dessert wine with our dessert.  That is superb service!  Not only that they were so friendly and apologetic.  

For dessert I wanted the cheesecake, but they were out of it.  I had to "settle" for the Italian cookie plate, which was actually very good.  

All in all, a great evening and I look forward to going back (although will have to think twice about the burger. Note, they also have an Impossible Burger, which I might try if I had a friend to split the regular and the Impossible with and who wanted both rare to medium rare with just onions.

reviews.name: Sandra Gislason
reviews.text: Beautiful restaurant& rreaallyy good food

reviews.name: Ian James
reviews.text:
My family went to Inside Park at St. Bart's for Thanksgiving Dinner. We were so glad we did!

The wait staff was perfectly attentive and the food was delicious. It was a great way to enjoy Thanksgiving dinner. The portions were overly generous, so we ended up with many leftovers for the next day (or more if we had wished). They were also playing Christmas music, so my kids' hearts filled with holiday joy when we walked into the dining room. My kiddos also liked having mocktails with dinner.

In addition to a great Thanksgiving meal, Inside Park at St. Bart's has an expansive wine list. My wife and I had a Chinon with dinner that was excellent!

I would definitely try Inside Park at St. Bart's for Thanksgiving again. I would also go back to try dining outside when the weather is warmer. No matter what, it seems like Inside Park at St. Bart's is a great place to dine/ enjoy drinks anytime of year.

reviews.name: Borja de Altolaguirre
reviews.text: Classic afterwork. Cannot miss it if you work in Midtown

reviews.name: Brayden Mora
reviews.text: Enjoyed sitting outside on a beautiful summer evening. The place was crowded but the overall ambiance was inviting and it didn’t feel congested. Impossible burger with a few beers in the company of some office colleagues made this an evening to remember. Heard the restaurant does some charity work with a food kitchen nearby which made it an extra special evening.

reviews.name: Locknath Singh
reviews.text: It was an honor & a privilege being here for our annual Holiday Party. Our firm has grown during the last 12 months and a large place had to be chosen for such a wonderful occasion. My employers choose this place for this year’s holiday party & I think that was a perfect choice. There’s a large area to dance. The staff is friendly. Food was tasty & delicious. Near to public transportation.

reviews.name: Ronald Archer
reviews.text: Had a corporate even the best ever attended and have been to many over the last 30+ years.

reviews.name: Pooja Desai
reviews.text: Great salads - average options for vegetarians but the ambience makes up for it. Coffee machine wasn't working that day

reviews.name: Matt zebroski
reviews.text: It feels kind of strange to say this after living in NYC for 20 years but this is probably the best pizza I've ever had. Better than any pizza literally anywhere in the US or any other country for that matter. I'm not sure how they do it. And I've been to dozens of pizza places in NYC including all the legends. It's just amazing. The decor is really nice. The cocktails are good. Service is solid. Gratuity is included. Prices are fine. My wife, my two friends and I were totally knocked out. Well done.

reviews.name: Gary M
reviews.text: Ops was on my pizzas to try list. Finally got the chance to go here tonight. Probably not best nights to pick (friday). There was an hour wait, but they were very accommodating especially with our 5 year old son with us. So lets get to the food!! We ordered the margherita with onions & the square pizza minus the olives, added the onions. So i like the sour dough crust. It is light airy & doesn't feel so heavy. But it can be a lot for people that are not fans of sour dough. The sauce was just ok for me. I've had much better tasting sauce. Cheese was fresh & in good amount. I liked the crust on the square pizza more. It was nice & crispy on the edges. But I dont think it's worth almost double the price of the margherita. Drinks are good. The tip included in the prices is definitely  a nice addition. The service was great btw. The decor is nice & chill & not overly hipsterish (sorry BK I represent Queens!!). Overall good experience. I would definitely recommend people to go there if they are into sour dough.

reviews.name: Gail Ward
reviews.text: If you are looking for snack or a place to grab a quick bit. I would definitely come here. Also, they have drinks and beers so if you need an afternoon drink, this is the place to go. But we stopped in after walking around the area. The empanadas are so good. They have meat ones and veggie ones. You cannot have an excuse to not stop in. So next time you are in the area and walking around the mission district, definitely stop in.

reviews.name: Leah Fleegle
reviews.text: Such a cozy spot! The grandma pizza is delicious. For wine they ask your preferences and then bring over a few bottles for you try and select. It was a great experience.

reviews.name: Thomas Baken
reviews.text: cozy spot with friendly staff and great pizza. sourdough is unique and tasty. definitely recommend the square pie.

reviews.name: Duy Tran
reviews.text:
One of the best pizza spots in NYC. The sourdough crust is so unique and good. The great service and the interior is really nice too. 

Highly recommend coming here if you're a pizza fan.

reviews.name: A
reviews.text: Good pizza! Nicely decorated & clean. Great service. Our square pizza was sourdough. Be aware of that, it was good just not advertised on menu.

reviews.name: Muzamil Saleem
reviews.text: Wonderful flavors compositions that are confident, yet elegant. The dough canvas is almost perfect. Excellent service. Top 3 in the city, in my opinion. Possibly first.

title: Russ & Daughters
address: 179 E Houston St, New York, NY 10002

reviews.name: E Bear
reviews.text:
I’ve been to the store in NYC and have also ordered it for delivery for my parents who no longer live in the northeast. It was crowded when I was there and the staff was efficient and friendly. There is a lot to see in a small space. 

There was nowhere to eat inside as it’s for take out so we walked to Whole Foods to eat our bagel sandwiches upstairs. Unfortunately I didn’t love the smoked salmon but was glad there is still a thriving NY Jewish deli.

The order my parents received via Fedex was received in excellent condition, arrived the day it was supposed to and was packed well. They loved the whitefish salad but it was very salty. Same with the smoked salmon but even more salty which I didn’t think was possible. Personally I don’t think it should be that salty as it ruins the flavor and is overwhelming. I prefer smoked salmon to be more buttery, mild and not as hard. I prefer my whitefish to not taste like a salt shaker. Just way too much sodium to enjoy. 

The chopped liver was good and similar to the one I make at home with a hard boiled egg as it was more natural tasting with less salt than the whitefish and lox. 

My parents liked the bagels that were delivered.

reviews.name: Anastasia B
reviews.text: Honestly I don’t get what the hype is about we stood in line for two bagels one with tuna salad and one with the lox and the fix ins.$28 for two tiny stale bagels. They are so hard and stale I don’t understand why people gush about them

reviews.name: cecilia chu
reviews.text: Pretty good, but long wait and I feel like it's more because of the salmon / lox as opposed to the actual bagel. Good experience though, would go once and during a weekday -- preferably morning so you're not waiting 40  minutes +.

reviews.name: Jacqueline Lee
reviews.text:
I recommend an Everything Bagel (toasted) with Nova Smoked Salmon, Scallion Cream Cheese, and toppings of Tomato, Onions, and Capers. It’s the best lox bagel I have had in New York—I crave it back home. While the bagel itself is just average, the delicious salmon, cream cheese, and toppings make up for it big time! The only reason I am giving Russ & Daughters four stars instead of five is because their bagel sandwiches are pricey, and toppings are 50 cents extra each. Definitely still a place you should try *at least* once while in NY though! 

I went at around 4:20pm on a Thursday, and there was no wait.

reviews.name: Pamela H.
reviews.text: Had a great sesame bagel with vegetable cream cheese.  Sampled some egg salad and tuna salad, which were very tasty.  Went back the same day for a pretzel bagel and potato latke, which were delicious.  The location is small, but very clean and bright.   No area to sit inside, but a couple of benches outside.  Very busy because it's extremely popular. Everything tasted good and fresh.

reviews.name: Matthew Chen
reviews.text: Russ and Daughter makes some of the best bagels in the entire world. They are freshly made everyday and the cream cheese is on point. I ordered a salmon lox bagel and it was the best I’ve ever had. They make their own smoked salmon and other items. If you’re in the area it is worth the wait.

reviews.name: April H
reviews.text: We love coming to this location as the size of the bagels are insane and so good. They have so many choices too of other items.

reviews.name: Mark Vince
reviews.text: Best bagels and experience in  New York. Please don’t complain about the line. It comes with the territory.

reviews.name: Family Van Do
reviews.text:
It’s a bit tough for me because I’m Vietnamese. I would not call this authentic at all. I’ve been here a few times. I always forget the review. Finally remembered. Unfortunately it was the same feeling I had before: somewhat disappointed but somewhat content that it’s just good food. 

Food: it’s more chinese and pan asian than Vietnamese. In traditional Vietnam, we don’t eat things like green curry, that’s Thai, nor the thick story fry with fried tofu, that’s chinese. 

Service: great service! They’re lovely people who were kind, patient, friendly. They stayed open for us to finish the dinner. 

Atmosphere: it’s an old place that’s been in NYC over a decade. Inside it’s very “asian” and “tropical” themed. It’s casual, fun, colorful. Some of it is very western too. 

I wouldn’t make this a favorite not anywhere on my list. It’s just a restaurant that will blend in with all of grand street.

reviews.name: Andres Spinel
reviews.text: Fantastic Pho at a reasonable price. The beef pho, fish soup and shrimp salad were all incredibly tasty.

reviews.name: Haley Coller
reviews.text:
Awesome experience: cheap, good and so fast! P.s. The mango smoothie was bomb! 
P.s.s. Cheapest meal I’ve had in NYC!

reviews.name: Lego Frogo
reviews.text:
The food in this place is amazing; Loved every bite/ spoonful. The price was very decent especially for the portion size. Customer service was awesome and all servers were very friendly and nice.

The restaurant itself is pretty spacious and very nicely lit up and decorated. The restroom was clean. 

I personally recommend the number 1 dish in the noodle section. I also highly recommend you try the pork chop/ rice/ crab cake combo. Will definetly visit again and again and will recommend to family/ friends.

reviews.name: Hai Ngo
reviews.text: Solid for the price. Nothing to write home about. I got the marinated beef cubes (Bò lúc lắc). Lots of food. Taste was okay. Probably won't be ordering it again though.

reviews.name: Marco Palmero
reviews.text: Service was great! Food was good value considering the serving size. Food was relatively standard - had the pho and the pork chop variety dish.

reviews.name: Law Tem
reviews.text: Very nice restaurant pho is excellent! Spring roll not so good... Very bland and rubbery... It is overall a fine restaurant.

reviews.name: ANDREW CHMIEL
reviews.text:
Large portions for the price!
The soup stayed hot the entire meal
Good fresh veggies on the side
Fast service ... their english was pretty good 
Place looked and felt clean

reviews.name: Steven Fuller
reviews.text: Good service. The food is pretty good too. I've been told if to find a good Korean restaurant look for a place full of Koreans. This was the place. I wasn't disappointed.

reviews.name: Prasad Jape
reviews.text:
Cold weather calls for Korean Tofu Soup. I have tried all BCD Tofu House places in nearby area NJ & NY. This place has the best amongst all BCD Tofu House places. They are also in the heart of Korea Town which also make them special. Pictures of Menu and food are provided for reference. 

They also have vegetarian Tofu Soups. Banchans are also little different from place to place. We liked them here too. We also ordered vegetarian Dumplings. Food was delicious. 

Staff is very friendly and accommodating. Recommend this place if you are in neighborhood.

reviews.name: Gerald Lee
reviews.text: Really good Korean food here. The seafood pancake, spicy pork belly and tofu soup are delicious. The space is really crowded most of the time and you cannot make reservations so the only way is to queue patiently. Definitely worth the wait though.

reviews.name: Olivia C
reviews.text: Yummy Korean food!! Food tastes really good and service was quick. Came here around 7.30pm on a Thursday night and only waited around 10 minutes. Also complimentary side dishes. Would recommend!

reviews.name: Claire Zhang
reviews.text: Great place with quick service! Really Authentic Korean dishes, tofu soup is famous here. Recommend combo meal if you want to try few things at same time.

reviews.name: mato
reviews.text:
Delicious food worth queuing for.
Very cool looking interior.

reviews.name: Ilir Haxhaj
reviews.text: By far this is really the best tofu spot in this area! Could be even in the city. Whats great is that they are always consistent. Service is just as good if not better! Definitely worth the try if your in the area.

reviews.name: Rob Trench
reviews.text: Not sure when this place got crazy busy but you can not beat the apps they keep filling or the food. Prices are a little high but even one will cry and say that's Manhattan. The waiters are great and don't forget about you even when it is busy.

reviews.name: Cristy Moya
reviews.text: Food was good. Seemed like hurried service. Expensive .  Overall okay.

reviews.name: Garrison Pease
reviews.text: We went to Pio Pio due to good recommendations from others, and knowing we'd get some great chicken! The chicken was AWESOMELY seasoned, and the fried rice dish was excellent also. The customer service was very good too. We highly recommend!

reviews.name: Priestly Canty
reviews.text: This was my first time trying Peruvian food. I was very impressed. I had the Matador Combo. At first, I was about to order another selection from the menu, but our waiter told us the Matodor combo is enough food for two. She was definately telling the truth. It was more than enough for two, and the price was very reasonable. All the food was AMAZING! The Sangria was okay. I think it would taste better with a mix of fruit in it. Google gave me directions to the location closest to me. Pio Pio 3 is very small inside; a bit tight. Very intimate I would say. Since they have 9 locations in all, I would prefer to try another location that is not so tight. Overall, I had no complaints. I enjoyed myself, and the food was AMAZING!

reviews.name: Marilyn Markham
reviews.text: The chicken is really very good and the salad on the side with avocado is just right. Oh and everything came super fast.

reviews.name: Meg Smith
reviews.text: Pio Pio is a neighborhood favorite. Chicken is delicious: perfectly roasted and seasoned. Their spicy green sauce is creamier than others' — and absolutely amazing. Rice and beans are simple yet flavorful and the avocado salad is a nice light balance to the meal. Fries with hot dogs is exactly what it sounds like an absurdly addicting. Space is small, service is friendly and efficient.

reviews.name: Jose M.
reviews.text: The food is not as good as the one in Hell's Kitchen.  The menu is also limited.  I ordered Arroz Chaufa with shrimp but they forget the shrimp.  At the end I tried to make small talk with the guy there (he had a laptop with him and I assumed he had a manger position.  That was a mistake.  He was very rude and made it seem like he didn't understand my Spanish when I speak fluent Spanish).  It was Sunday night February 23rd.

reviews.name: Sazzie Zer
reviews.text: I love Pio Pio chicken always. Their food is very consistently great and comforting. However, the SERVICE was not so good. The restaurant was empty and they would not let us bring the stroller in there. I know it is a small restaurant but no one was there in morning and why would you turn the customers away! You need new set of staff!

reviews.name: Ingrid De La Rosa
reviews.text: Food was soooo Delicious!... the sangria was the best!

reviews.name: josephine figueroa
reviews.text:
Food is delish!
I absolutely love the warm bowls full of delicious and healthy options. Staff is very friendly too.

reviews.name: Natalie Suriel
reviews.text: I enjoyed the broccoli the first two times but not the last. Consistency could be better on how food taste. They called burnt charred here which is funny only “charred” thing to taste really burnt is the sweet potato. Side orders are extremely small! Only fits about 4 pieces small of broccoli.

reviews.name: Andrew Yang Music
reviews.text: Very good food, albeit slightly pricey (just over $12 for a bowl)

reviews.name: Tom Danger
reviews.text: Food is full of flavor, portions are plentiful and the service is fast a friendly. Healthy food options at a reasonable price. No wonder there is a line outside the door on a regular basis.

reviews.name: Michael Lin
reviews.text: A great selection of healthy options that taste delicious. Dig Inn offers reasonable sized portions of high quality for a justified price. Would highly recommend the kitchen sink cookies and the Ginger Lemonade 👌

reviews.name: Sarah Kleinman
reviews.text: It’s another Chipotle concept—choose your base (greens, brown rice, or farrow), sides, and protein—but with much smaller portions and very salty flavor profiles. I had the green bowl with roasted cauliflower, kale ragout, and salmon. Sriracha dressing on the side. Grabbed a kitchen sink cookie because I couldn’t resist. For $16, I could have had a sit down meal elsewhere. Left much to be desired.

reviews.name: Clifford Morgan
reviews.text: Very good healthy food at a reasonable price.

reviews.name: Tiziano Santoro
reviews.text: Great tasting healthy food, and at a reasonable price. The meatballs were quite tasty and accompanied with a nice tomato sauce; Brussels sprouts were well seasoned and good tasting. The ginger and mint lemonade was very nice too and went well with the rest of the food.

reviews.name: Minyoung Lee
reviews.text: I can say that IHOP buttermilk pancake is my best pancake in the world. I agree it could be different depending on branch I go, but this place didn‘t get me down. It was great! Staffs are friendly and nice but they need more staffs. Sometimes you gotta wait a bit until they get you.

reviews.name: jelvis ferreira
reviews.text:
First time ever going, I can't believe I've never been! The employees were all super courteous and attentive!

Nothing beats having breakfast for lunch, especially the value that comes with it, got the "2x2x2" usually any breakfast combo comes with unlimited pancakes, so I topped up my pancakes about 4 times, you'd expect to be paying atleast like $15 - $20 for breakfast anywhere, but that wasn't the case at all! My total ended up being 5.43 before tip! This made my visit not only shocking but so worth it! I'm definitely coming here again.

reviews.name: Shubham Bharti
reviews.text:
I was here with my friend and the place is so cool.
The food served was so good even the staffs working here were so polite,also helped us to get some of the cool stuff they had.The best part was it was one of my friends dream to be here and my group made this possible for him.
If you are here nearby please have a visit and try the breakfast and this will definitely be a good start of the day.

reviews.name: Izaak Salazar
reviews.text: This IHOP is definitely worth a visit. One of my favorite things about all IHOP's is that they have many options to choose from. The service here was awesome as usual. The food was good and plentiful. I will be returning.

reviews.name: Vanssa Padilla
reviews.text: Staff was very rude, gave me the wrong change and when I asked for my correct change she got angry and said “oh my god”. She also had an attitude with me while giving my order and got my order wrong. Very unhappy with my experience today.

reviews.name: David Rodriguez
reviews.text: Excellent service. Even with a large crowd waiting before me I was seated fairly quickly. Staff is extremely friendly and the food is wonderful.

reviews.name: Eda Seviniş
reviews.text: Great variety of pancakes and omelettes. you can also make your own combos, and see the calories you get from what you eat. Fair pricing.

reviews.name: Andrea Rowe
reviews.text:
I Love pancakes!! IHOP pancakes are always always delicious! my favorite is the cinnamon flavored pancake.
I also highly recommend their strawberry Lemonade.
Great Job team IHOP!

reviews.name: Joe George
reviews.text: Nice summery cocktails, and a mix of Mexican options that hit the spot. Plus the tres leches was phenomenal!

reviews.name: Anna Galper
reviews.text: Really good food! Not cheap, but worth it. Frozen Margaritas are the best!!!!

reviews.name: Yulia Shekeladze
reviews.text: The one time i saw the waitress after i got a table was when she took my order. Still waiting for my vegan tacos - it’s been 45 mins now😂 She just asked the table next to me if they want a dessert, and response was “we still haven’t got our food”😂

reviews.name: Nathan Ramey
reviews.text: Comfortable ambience, friendly mindful staff, lots of flavorful foods. Chicken Mole was rich with flavor. The fish special was delicious. The blood orange margarita drink special was quite tasty. And, the after dinner cappuccinos hit the spot. If you like foods with lots of different flavors you will not be disappointed.

reviews.name: Dana Borrero
reviews.text: LOVE this restaurant. Incredible takes on traditional dishes, it’s no wonder they win awards. It’s a lovely date-night or special occasion restaurant. Also great for when anyone is visiting.

reviews.name: Saba Khan
reviews.text: This place has some of the best Mexican food I have eaten. My friend who lives in NYC especially made this reservation because she was excited to introduce me to this place. The food was extremely tasty and the non alcoholic cocktail I ordered was extremely refreshing. If you are an NYC local or just visiting I recommend checking this place out.

reviews.name: Kevin Lovingood
reviews.text: We were early for our reservation but the hostess seated us very quickly after we arrived. They're very nice and the waiter was professional and made services quick. The restaurant is classy but not pompous as some Michelin restaurants can be. The favorite dish of the night was the mole de piaxtla with ample rich chocolate mole sauce. Then, the pastor tacos was delicious as it was simple - I feel it's hard to go wrong with pastor tacos. Don't forget the margaritas here, with strong flavor for tequila lovers, and rum based cocktails for rum lovers. Highly recommend with advanced reservations for a date night/small group.

reviews.name: Alex Serebrov
reviews.text:
I have to admit, I don't like Mexican food, it is just not my cup of tea... But! This place is an exceptional!  It is straight up delicious!  I didn't know what to expect,  but the experience was above any optimistic expectations. All four of my friends unanimously proclaimed this place having is one of the best Mexican food they ever had. The place is rather small and very busy, so prior reservation is highly recommended. 
P.S. Tres leches sponge cake is out of this world!

reviews.name: Malinda Galvan
reviews.text: We had reservations at a different restaurant for 5 people at 5:30 pm. That restaurant said they couldn't accommodate us. Even with a reservation! Walked down the street, walked into Sardi's and they seated us. A party of 5 with no reservations. Food was amazing and service was exceptional. Very highly recommend this restaurant.

reviews.name: Chan Huang
reviews.text:
Iconic bar to visit when you're in NYC, it really has the classic feel and you almost feel like you're thrown into a time machine in a good way.

The bartender on the night we went on the second floor was amazing, professional and really feels authentic. He was able to handle a large crowd with speed and accuracy, our drinks we mixed wonderfully watching him dance through the drinks was a sight to behold!

The place is a bit quiet and without music at the time which felt a bit weird for a bar, but does have its advantages.

I give them 8/10!

reviews.name: Kate MacDougall
reviews.text: Had dessert and coffee here on Friday night at about 8 pm. The desserts, cheese and cheesecake, were good, the atmosphere was elegant and the service was mediocre. We liked that they left a pot of coffee on the table so we could help ourselves. Water refills were slow.

reviews.name: B Inthavong
reviews.text: Didn't live to is hype. I didn't find any of the dishes I had to be that great. Service was fast and kind though! Can be really busy so reserve before hand.

reviews.name: Steve Wellmann
reviews.text: Came in after the theatre rush. Place is a bit dated. Service was very good. Found the menu a bit limited, food was okay but nothing special. The history and famous  caricatures make it worth a visit

reviews.name: Mark Karan
reviews.text: Meal was good, but not really special.  The asparagus soup was very good, but could use a little more seasoning. Had scallop risotto - scallops well cooked, but the risotto was a little underdone.  The meatballs and pasta was just OK.  Price reasonable for NYC and the "Sardi's" name, but we expected more.

reviews.name: Shay Seaborne, CPTSD
reviews.text: the whole experience was splendid! My friend insisted that we go after a show and I was so happy that we did. He ordered the steak tartare which the chef made right in front of us. It was superb! We had the creme brulee for dessert and it was perfectly done. Sardi's is such an icon you just have to go when you're in the area.

reviews.name: Jamie Lott
reviews.text: We care a Sunday matinee and walked across the street to enjoy a lovely meal at Sardi's.  The service was amazing and the food even more so.   We ordered from the Pris Fixe menu and enjoyed a fabulous meal complete with appetizers and dessert for a very reasonable price.  I had steak which was cooked exactly as I ordered and my daughter had the salmon which she said was fabulous.   I had the tiramisu which was rich and full of robust flavors.   Some of the best I've ever tasted.  I highly recommend this restaurant for dining before or after a Broadway show

reviews.name: Andrea Oakes
reviews.text: I LOVED it! Never been to a kosher restaurant before. The food was so tasty 😋. The meats were tender, appetizers were great. Staff seems a little... unhappy. No one here smiles at all, like at all. That was kind of a turn off and it's usually due to poor management not the staffs fault. Otherwise the food was great and I will give it another try but I'll definitely ask my waiter if he's okay.

reviews.name: shelly mimon
reviews.text: Food and service was really good, order a few  appetizers and desserts.

reviews.name: shaina faerman
reviews.text:
We we're a party of 8 and the food was really good (a little pricey but worth it)
Excellent service.
Great location. Clean and nice place.
Best to make a reservation but even if u don't have one they will try to find u a tabel.
We we're very pleased!

reviews.name: Colt Murphy
reviews.text: I admire this restaurant very much. there is a great spirit. The cuisine is tasty. the service is efficient and the waiters are polite. The pay is decent. greatly recommend.

reviews.name: Jacob Mack
reviews.text: Service and staff were excellent. Food was top of the line. Walked out with more than enough

reviews.name: Andrew Fader
reviews.text: Portions were small and expensive. Brisket egg roll was pretty good. Popcorn chicken was actually some kind of sweet and sour chicken with actual popcorn on it. Pastrami wasn't great. Decor was high end and service was solid but if you don't keep kosher, no reason to eat here. Even if you do there are likely better options.

reviews.name: Marli Dinovitzer
reviews.text: Went here about a year ago and the food was fantastic! We ordered the meat tacos I believe and a big steak. Excellent service, great atmosphere, quiet too and a great place to take anybody out!

reviews.name: simcha lev
reviews.text:
I will say that I've been there more that a dozen times, 
Pros
• The food is great 
• Location is perfect, right off Times Square & with easy to find parking
• Prices are great 
• Portions are big
• Cocktails are great & simply huge
Cons
• Service is simply horrible. Some of the experiences I've had...
Waiter run after me for a tip
Not get a menu
Waiter won't write down correct order 
• Menu hasn't been changed in forever 
• Place needs an decor upgrade ASAP

reviews.name: S H
reviews.text: Spent a weekend in NY with children and after a day of walking in the cold, we were hungry and looking for a kid friendly place for a bite to eat. We decided Planet Hollywood would be fun for the kids.  Found the atmosphere to be too noisy, especially the music. The kids weren't overly interested in any of the decor.   The menu could of had more variety, a bit disappointing to me.  Nothing really to rave home about here.

reviews.name: Lucas Melotik
reviews.text: The overall restaurant okay. The food wasn't bad, just don't think it was worth nearly what it cost. There's some cool stuff to look at, but judging it just as a restaurant, I'd say there plenty of other places nearby that will give you higher quality food for the same price.

reviews.name: Paula Luna
reviews.text: Very nice people working there. The food was really good. The atmosphere was fun and there was a lot of movie memorabilia to look at. We ordered two kids meals and the portions were very large. The fajitas were great! This is the first place that I ever ate grilled green beans on a fajita, but it was really good!!

reviews.name: Roxann Bobo
reviews.text: The Bar Room is so so so beautiful and the people there make you feel right at home, no matter what you’re there for. Including one of the employees, Anna, who goes above and beyond to make sure you’re perking up with a good smile and laugh. Drinks, meals and good company- oh my. If it seems too good to be true, it’s because the rumors are true- go to this bar always. I know I am.

reviews.name: Dan Busby
reviews.text:
It’s my first time in New York as I surprised my girlfriend for her 21st, we went to planet Hollywood for dinner the place was well presented. We had a warm welcome when we arrived! We was served by TJ who was outstanding on recommending food and knowledge about New York! The food was amazing! Very affordable prices! Would highly recommend this place! And the service we revived! Will definitely go there on our next visit 

P.S good job to everyone there! I know it’s not always nicest place to work as customers moaning all the time and people not giving positive vibes about place, where planet Hollywood needs recognition!

-Happy customer

reviews.name: Damaris R
reviews.text: For my first time experience I would say it wasn't  a good one. Now here's why. Our server approached our table with one question that stood out to us during our entire dinner experience where are you guys from? From here, NYC, we told him but now we question if that response made our entire dinner experience the way it was. Our order was taken and was out within a few minutes except for my son's order. So we then tried to catch the servers attention but he did not  have any eye contact with us at all we had to wave him down for him to come to our table.  He then went  back and forth telling us we never placed my son's order to begin with showing me his notepad. As a server the customer is always right. Do not go back and forth just admit that someone was wrong and the right thing to do is get the order out as quickly as possible.  Our water at the table was never refilled as we had to ask the server himself for more water, something we should not have to do it should already be done. Overall experience one star.

reviews.name: Jeff B
reviews.text: Tired. Unfortunate how far they’ve let this fun concept fall. The movie clip montages are gone. The music doesn’t relate to the movies. The props are weak and the overall environment leaves much to be desired. Food was fine.

reviews.name: Andy T
reviews.text: Good burgers and simple fare. Very good service and atmosphere. Just off the main avenue so not as crowded.

reviews.name: Ira Strassberg
reviews.text: Not bad for the pandemic. Better plastic should be considered

reviews.name: Virginia Means
reviews.text: Awesome customer service. Our families favorite restaurant so far. We love the food so much.

reviews.name: Aishling Hughes
reviews.text:
Came here for $5 dollar taco Tuesday and was not disappointed! Large, tasty and good quality tacos! The chicken fajita was probably my favorite. 

The restaurant has a large open space and nice bar area also.

reviews.name: Katrina
reviews.text: I absolutely love the place. It’s easy to park of The Weekends

reviews.name: J Wilson
reviews.text: The drinks are good and strong lol! The restaurant accommodates you fairly. I wanted hawaii and pineapple mixed. Wallah no questions asked waiter came back. The food was scrumptious too. You will be sitting for hours between food and drink. The food is that good

reviews.name: indah nuria Savitri
reviews.text:
Love the nachos and tacos they serve here! The guacamole is also fresh, with some organic corn chips you will love :). I usually order Taquitos and nachos, with a lot of cheese.

Try the signature drinks. They have a lot of variety and we can do the virgin as well for those who don’t drink alcohol.

The place is not big big but comfy enough for lunches and dinner. Love the hanging bison over the bar :)

reviews.name: Jackson A.
reviews.text:
Very Inconsistent, sometimes I’ve been here and it’s great other times it’s mediocre. I wish they had better quality pulled chicken, it’s kinda 
chicken-y so I would recommend foods that aren’t pulled like, like the fajitas which are great here and are good quality. Guacamole and salsa is pretty good here and are fresh. Many toppings here as well are fresh and taste good like the lettuce, onion, tomato, and cheese.

reviews.name: Sal
reviews.text: Excellent prices for the location. The food is excellent. Seating is a little tight but it’s what you would expect for being in Manhattan. Drinks are very strong!

reviews.name: Rose Martinez
reviews.text:
Excellent! One of my favorite fast food places here. I'm sooooo happy see it opened in New York City. The chicken was very juicy and not too dry. I wish they could open more locations though.
P.S they give you a free pie for the next order you place with your previous receipt

reviews.name: Alfs Girl
reviews.text: This is a nice location - the workers, the physical location, the food... I was delighted to see that they were swimming in charging stations. Most places in NY are too stingy to have outlets available to customers - even in this day and age. They even have free WiFi!

reviews.name: Katie Boudreau
reviews.text:
The line to order can take a while to get through, but the food comes out pretty fast. 

Not a ton of seating, but you can usually grab a table if you’re a party of one or two. 

Curly fries are the best!

reviews.name: Kale N
reviews.text: Not bad. I had the Buffalo chicken sandwich, curly fries and chocolate shake. Everything was good but the chocolate shake was a bit much however.

reviews.name: Yalontya Simmons
reviews.text: I love the food at this place. Also I love how fast the service is here. A bit pricey but so worth the money!

reviews.name: Deborah Griffin
reviews.text: No matter what you get, quality that had a kid with flavor literally combined into the meal you order. The place is so clean and the staff are nice and friendly!

reviews.name: David Ryan
reviews.text: I love the roast beef and curly fries, but this visit was awful. Fast food shouldn't take 15 minutes to receive from the time an order is placed. Yes, this happened to me and there were only 2 other people waiting for there order ahead of me. After 10 minutes 3 additional employees magically appeared and orders started getting processed. I really hope I can update my review and make it better at a future date.

reviews.name: Termaine Chizikani
reviews.text: Liked the crispy spiced fries but the sizes are so small on everything. The location has portals to charge and after 3pm promo. Small and tight sitting area but l had a peaceful meal

reviews.name: Brent Yang
reviews.text: Very neat and accessible restaurant. They offer big portions and for reasonable rates. We liked the meals very much and the staff members were very attentive and explanatory. Highly recommended.

reviews.name: David Wood
reviews.text: This place is extraordinary and broad, the meals was delicious and the rates were very inexpensive. fast, efficient service and very personal staff. I recommend this place.

reviews.name: aaron spangler
reviews.text: The staff was very friendly and helped explain what each item was, and what they recommend to pair each with. Ordered the B combo. Everything was VERY good. So much food, seemed like it never stopped coming. Ate until I was uncomfortable. Would definitely go back if I lived in town.

reviews.name: Ryan Wilhelm
reviews.text: Wonderful experience with fantastic food!  The menu can be overwhelming but is easily explained by the wait staff for first timers.  Many great treats with every dish we had.  Fun atmosphere and also looked like a great lunch menu.  I really enjoyed the  Seafood Noodle Bowl.

reviews.name: Dario Kalmus
reviews.text:
We ordered a combo, an extra pork order and an appetizer for 4.
They kept bringing more and more food to the table! Lot of sides which were all amazing, especially the tofu soup (I’m saying this not being a tofu lover). We ate A LOT! And we ate great!
The waitress cooks in front of you in the fire in the center of the table, and seeing her do it was very entertaining, since she was extremely efficient.

We spent about 50 per person not including drinks.

reviews.name: Kiran Shivaraj
reviews.text: This is an authentic Korean BBQ place. From the outside it looks small. But as you enter you realize there are 3 levels. It's at a very convinient location at Korea Town. It has a very nice ambience. The tables fitted with grill, the meat being grilled in front of you is so amazing. The staff are very sweet and friendly. The service is quite fast, the food tastes ok.. I guess you should have the palate for Korean food.

reviews.name: R Reed
reviews.text: I simply like their dishes. I always get fantastic customer service there. The place is always clean and the workers are always super nice. I highly recommend this place.

reviews.name: Olga Kovaleva
reviews.text: Ordered a takeout bibimbap. Can't say much about the ambience or the staff, but I found the food rather plain and flavorless. The beef was hard to chew.

reviews.name: Nick Kazolias
reviews.text: Made a reservation here to celebrate our anniversary. Looking at their website you see fine Indian cuisine, a nice full bar, beers on tap! A half hour before our reservation I got a text message that says BYOB, we do not serve alcohol. It is false advertisement to say the least. I called them and they said they moved and they don’t have a liquor license. The only thing he could say was I’m sorry. They definitely need to update their website, so disappointed

reviews.name: Eloise Ross
reviews.text: Delicious  Curry. They had the best curry in New York  and everybody loved it.  The staff are also so nice and friendly! I love it!

reviews.name: Dominik C
reviews.text: Fantastic food, friendly employees, constantly  awesome vibes. They charge fair prices and the food quality is fantastic. Highly recommended.

reviews.name: Leah Slaten
reviews.text: We went here to attempt the notorious Phaal Curry Challenge, which claims to be the spiciest dish in New York City (and perhaps the world!). We also ordered Paneer Tikka, which was served on a sizzling skillet and tasted delicious. The Phaal Curry lives up to its hype! While at the restaurant, we did watch someone successfully complete the challenge. We were not masochistic enough to force ourselves through the misery of the challenge. I made it through about a third of the dish, with the help of a fair amount of raita, naan, and rice. This may mute the pain in your mouth, but be warned that there is nothing that will tame the burn as the curry reaches your digestive tract. I was feeling a strong gag reflex coming on as I reached the limits of my endurance. I suffered enough overnight that I’m glad I stopped when I did.

reviews.name: Kai Huang
reviews.text: Came here to check out the spiciest curry challenge. It truly was indeed so hot that we couldn’t even really make a dent to it. But the chicken tikka masala was really good! And so was the service!

reviews.name: Agnes Hanashiro
reviews.text: Great value per money for the lunch menu including curry options, rice, freshly baked naan, lentil and vegetable. It was tasty, moderate in chilli and a big portion size. Only mango lassi was too artificially flavoured and sweet. Restrooms and ambience are clean and offers a good service.

reviews.name: Shetal Maharaj
reviews.text: The Phaal curry lives up to its name!!! CRAZY hot! The other food is good though, worth checking out. Unique spicy experience.

reviews.name: Family Fan
reviews.text: The food portions were good and the flavors were great. Nice friendly service. Happy with the place and will likely come back again.

reviews.name: Divyen Gajjar
reviews.text: This place is awesome with one of the best ambience that one can have for a nice little time with family or friends. Great drinks with awesome services. We had Brian to assist us who had really nice knowledge of drinks and food and helped us get the best drinks and food. His service was above par. Always with a smile on his face and a really friendly guy. A nice place to spend an evening at.

reviews.name: Jessica
reviews.text: Best views, great food, best wine with great service

reviews.name: Rodrigo Bravo
reviews.text:
NYC has so many spots to choose that you can get lost in the myriad of options. The scene here is packed with sights, drinks, fads, and so forth. City Vineyard is definitely part of this but 

City Vineyard is situated on Pier 26 which was convenient as it was next to the Downtown Boathouse Club which sponsors free kayaking in the summer / fall. 

Drinks were on the menu this evening; the variety is similar to any other bar. The Strawberry Forever and Mango Spritz started the evening. Although super popular, the mango drink was OK. I definitely favored the fruity strawberry drink. The Long Cool Flower was also bitter and not as satiating but fortunately the Band on the Rum was delicious. 

Rooftop access begins at 400 and offers beautiful views of the Hudson and a towering view of One World Trade. The upstairs bar only offers wines and beers. It gets packed as the evening progresses.

Tip: No Happy Hour and drinks range from 10 to 20 bucks. If you're looking for an inexpensive experience you need to head somewhere else.

reviews.name: Adam M
reviews.text: Always a great time especially on a beautiful day, evening and night. Gets quite packed up top but atmosphere is diverse typically everyone and anyone coming for afterwork rink with friends. Great place. Laid back for most part

reviews.name: Elizabeth D
reviews.text: Nice place, but I wish they weren't using disposable plastic containers for outdoor dining. It's wasteful and unnecessary. I've been to several other restaurants in the past couple of weeks and none of them were using disposable for outdoor dining.

reviews.name: Bethany Keefer
reviews.text: They have an amazing brunch. The charcuterie board and burger was phenomenal. Our server Lucas was very attentive and kept the wine flowing! Highly recommend and would definitely come back again. You also cannot beat the awesome view of the river!

reviews.name: Kenny Straub
reviews.text: We sat at the bar at City Vineyard and had Will K. as our bartender. Bar service and drinks were fantastic, but the customer service was remarkable.
