As first-timers, Will walked us through the menu and gave us great recommendations. The food and drinks were both delicious and his hospitality was very much appreciated. We will definitely be back and would recommend this place to anyone who is considering it.

reviews.name: A Thomas
reviews.text: Had a great time at City Vineyard. The  Managers were specially  accommodating as we where running a little late for our reservation. We a lovely quite dinner out in the patio overlooking the beautiful New Jersey Skyline. Lucas was our sever and was very professional and knowledgeable. Will return to check out their rooftop.

title: STK Downtown
address: 26 Little W 12th St, New York, NY 10014, United States

reviews.name: Tiffany Collins
reviews.text: The place was beautiful! Giving 3 stars because my steak was very tough. I got the Delmonico dry aged cooked medium.

reviews.name: Tina Baldwin
reviews.text: The atmosphere was nice. It took 3 hours to get our food because the server forget to put it in. We finally got our food that we ordered well done steak which was bloody. The server saw us picking all around it and took it back and they put it back on the grill twice. It was valentine's day night I understand it was busy.  However we spent 255 for food we didn't enjoy.  The music was amazing and I was with my fiance so we didn't complain. The photo is after the second time they re cooked it.

reviews.name: Pete L
reviews.text: Delicious al fresco Brunch was enjoyed on the rooftop with a very helpful and courteous staff.

reviews.name: Bernard Hicks
reviews.text: Total party vibe, music extremely loud, at one point the lights went out and staff ran around with light batons. Not my preference for a restaurant, but may suit others. Main issue was that we had a reservation for 9pm, showed up at 8:50pm and waited until 10pm to be seated. They said several times you'll be seated "soon", "right away", "10 minutes or so". I only stayed because I was invited by someone else. On the plus side the wait staff were efficient and the food was very good.

reviews.name: Rachel Kurter
reviews.text: Service was great but I've had better steaks elsewhere. The atmosphere on the roof top was not as appealing as expected.

reviews.name: Daniel Ryan
reviews.text: We visited The Lodge at STK Rooftop on Saturday. We had reservations at 7:30, arrived about 12 minutes late and were immediately seated and greeted by our waiter. The service was impressive and our every need was met. I would 100% recommend anyone thinking about visiting make a reservation and enjoy the food!!

reviews.name: A Boo
reviews.text: I love this place the vibe is sexy romantic at night and low key chill just as they open. The blue cheese butter that they serve with the complimentary bread is amazinggggggg, I wish i could purchase it. I usually get the cowgirl ribeye paired with the mash potatoes that i smother with the blue cheese butter and the sweet corn pudding and it’s fantastic. You really can’t go wrong. The ribeye is flavorful, mash potatoes are a good creamy texture - paired with the sweet corn pudding this gives the right touch of sweetness in contrast with the savory meat and blue cheese butter. My go to steak place with blue cheese butter. The service is also really good. I’ve never had an issue and i enjoy this place.

reviews.name: Peggy Kuhlman
reviews.text: We went at a very crowded time. They refused to seat us because our entire party was not present, and then 30 min later finally sat us at a table that had been open the whole time.  This is not how I would treat guests if I wanted them to return. I loved the party vibe and atmosphere but the service was not excellent.  They comped us for a diet Coke and gave us a free dessert.  The food was excellent but they seemed like they had enough business and didn't need ours.

reviews.name: Scottie B
reviews.text: Dope little surfer bar paying tribute to one of the best 90s action movies of all time. Good food and drinks. Gets packed but there’s an upstairs area for more seating.

reviews.name: Jurgen Hein
reviews.text: Refreshing beer and good service great spot for a drink

reviews.name: carl tabor
reviews.text: Hmmm. What to say about this divey after work bar? No great beer selection. Food was the standard fried American fare you’d expect. I love the theme. Point Break the 1990 movie. But I wish it was in one of the TVs. They have at least 2 floors open here. Note: This was a bad choice to meet my pregnant wife at before a concert.

reviews.name: William Gambardella
reviews.text: Go see Whitney and Nina. Cold beer and great food.

reviews.name: Guillermo Melendrez
reviews.text: Excellent service! All you want to drink and good foo.

reviews.name: Alejandro Malagon
reviews.text: Nice lunch spot in the Midtown area, close to Times Square and Rockefeller Center. The food is okay but fairly priced for sit-down food in Manhattan. I had the bacon cheeseburger and it looks like they changed their menu from the last time I was there. The burger was okay, could have been better.

reviews.name: Charlotte Steneld Svanström
reviews.text: Cool place, genuine atmosphere & nice staff! Food pretty much ok but the place it self makes a 4-star rating.

reviews.name: Jeramia Dupre
reviews.text: Awesome little bar! Bartender was super cool. Definitely found my NYC hang out spot!

reviews.name: Joshua Zapata
reviews.text:
The food is good. I cannot complain about the food at all. I’m general, this is a nice place. It’s very photogenic and Instagram worthy. 

A con is that this is another fancy restaurant that serves a little bit of food for an expensive price. My mom paid $22 for a piece of lasagna that was finished in about 5 bites. 

My sister had spaghetti and meat sauce that was the same portion of the “chef boy are D” spaghetti for about $20 now the worst part.... the waiter recommended me a chicken cutlet and did not tell me the price. I said yes to it. And the price for a chicken cutlet was $38!!! That is way too overpriced. 

The food was good don’t get me wrong, but the prices are crazy. I understand that it is classy place but wow. Prices are too much. 

Overall I enjoyed my time here. Service was good

reviews.name: nyree bass
reviews.text: Great place to dine and have brunch

reviews.name: Family Fan
reviews.text: Good food and attentive service. The prices are a bit high on a few of the plates but overall the quality was good. Pizza was not bad, arugula salad was average, and the home made pasta with Truffles were pretty good. The ziti and spaghetti are fairly standard with good sauces. The scene though is terrific and a nice place to just people watch.

reviews.name: Bill Shoemaker
reviews.text: Good Italian restaurant with decent service. Food service was satisfactory.

reviews.name: Dan Klamm
reviews.text: Great pizza and pasta dishes, consistent service, lively atmosphere for dinner/drinks.

reviews.name: Amanda Walker
reviews.text: A very electric and tasty Tuscan eatery on the UWS. Though the restaurant’s two floors are narrow and the noise level is very high, the food is excellent. The menu is extensive, concentrating mostly on homemade pastas and pizzas, though there are the standard meat and fish dishes. It has a fire pizza oven which turns out tasty pies. I had the farfalle and shrimp in a light lemon cream sauce which was excellent. The others had spaghetti squash and salad which were also very good. The starter white pizza with mushrooms was exceptional. The service was very efficient and we were treated royally by the owner! Prices are moderate by NYC standards. Highly recommended.

reviews.name: Adlin Rivera
reviews.text: Good Italian food, but a bit loud.

reviews.name: West island Traveler
reviews.text: Well situated with friendly service the seating was comfortable and the menu was varied.  We enjoyed some appetizers including fried calamari tomatoes with buffalo mozzarella and basil both where delicious as well as the pasta carbonara had just the right amount if sauce and was perfectly cooked there was a wide variety of pizzas to choose from and our were delicious.  Would definitely go back to this location again!

reviews.name: olies chen
reviews.text: The pizza is thin and crisp, very delicious, and the waiter has a good attitude,I'll go again.🤗🍕🍔

reviews.name: Jussi Uosukainen
reviews.text: Nice neighborhood Italian, with outside seating available.

reviews.name: Philip Brazina
reviews.text: Tasty food but a little pricey.  Using the crave app made it worthwhile.  Burger itself was cooked awesome, but the bun was a bit stale.

reviews.name: Sabeena Lalwani
reviews.text: I love the ambience here. Perfect for a nice dinner with excellent service. Yummy pizza! Been back 3 times already.

reviews.name: Anthony Ferguson
reviews.text: Absolutely love the food. The staff and the service

reviews.name: Harrison Kanarick
reviews.text: I had their serafina salad, calamari,  and the truffle pizza.  I was happy with everything and the service was nice.

reviews.name: Pretty Things
reviews.text: Favourite place, delicious food, and the best calamari and pizza in New York. Service was very friendly and nice.

reviews.name: M. Spassiani
reviews.text: Great solid pastas. Antipasti also has a good selection.

title: Sarabeth's
address: 40 Central Park S, New York, NY 10019

reviews.name: Mallory Everhart
reviews.text: I booked dinner here through Seated when my family in law was in town. This location is much nicer than other Sarabeth's in the city. The menu was great for a serving many people with different appetites. The food was great as was the service.

reviews.name: Evan Holland
reviews.text: It was really like any other restaurant. You could get it anywhere. They have good pancakes but otherwise, it's okay. There is usually a wait so reservations recommended but again, this place is just okay.

reviews.name: Edward Seidler
reviews.text: Well located over the road from Central Park. Excellent food. Good service. Reasonable prices for a NYC restaurant. Good burgers, fries and salmon

reviews.name: AMeditativeMoment with : Joyce Christ
reviews.text: I really wanted to like this place, but the food (dinner) was surprisingly very good (except for this one dish that was mind blowingly amazing, which is the reason this review is 5 stars). I will return for their brunch menu soon, since that's where they supposedly shine.

reviews.name: Elizabeth Warber
reviews.text: Vintage NYC! The lemon ricotta pancakes are a must. Everything is delicious. Make sure to get some toast so you can have the raspberry jam! Beyond compare!

reviews.name: Amanda Walker
reviews.text: Got a recommendation to have breakfast is Sarabeth's from a friend & so glad they told us about this place. Located right beside Central Park, the restaurant has a lovely layout & there is a great atmosphere. We did have to queue but not for too long & It was worth the wait. They have a huge variety to carter for any dietary needs with a hotel style service. Would definitely go back

reviews.name: James LaFond
reviews.text: Used to be a great spot. Not sure what happened but no longer impressed. Tourists scene mid grade food although service is very good.

reviews.name: Peter DeLuca
reviews.text:
I’ve eaten many times at The Sarabeth‘s on the upper East side and thought I would try the location at Central Park South for a Sunday brunch with my wife and children. 
It was an awful experience! When the server came over to the table, we told him we were ready to order and he tried to push 
Alcoholic drinks, and a basket of breakfast muffins. Then we each ordered quite a bit of food and he immediately asked us if we wanted to add sausage, bacon, home fries, and the list went on and on. We politely said no, so he turns to my 14 year old son and asks “ How about some orange juice”? He said sure. ($12 a glass)
The food was OK but we felt like tourists being completely pressured and it ruined the meal. 
Ironically when we asked for the check, he turns to my son and says “how about some more orange juice”. I just laughed to myself. 
I’m guessing because it’s near all the hotels on Central Park South that perhaps the staff is instructed to pressure the tourists. In addition the restaurant wasn’t very clean.
Never again.

title: Miramar
address: 21 South End Ave, New York, NY 10280

reviews.name: Giovani Mathews
reviews.text: Extraordinary environment and super friendly service. The meals were fresh and yummy. Will surely recommend this place to friends and family. Reasonable prices and large meals. Good job.

reviews.name: Katy Linda
reviews.text: When we arrived, the hostess seemed less than thrilled to see us. The theme continued with our server. The food was cooked well, the scallops, calamari, shrimp, and salmon were moist and not rubbery. The flavor left a lot to be desired. The rice was flavorless, the seasoning was barely there. Once I added some salt it was better. The AC was broken, we were seated by a fan. I would not recommend wasting your time here.

reviews.name: victoria kolbe
reviews.text: Beautiful views, hidden gem, we shared the diver scallops, mussels, pear salad and calamari between 3 folks which were all perfectly cooked with nice wine and wonderful service. It's a small restaurant with lovely bar.  Has outdoor seating but too chilly tonight. We loved it.

reviews.name: Ahmed Hesham
reviews.text: Absolutely hideous. Raw Scallops, terrible pasta, dreadful shrimps. When I complained they didn’t really care. No wonder why the place is empty. Be very careful before going...

reviews.name: Ronald and Ellen Guggenheim
reviews.text: good food, great location and view

reviews.name: Michael Galvin
reviews.text: Friendly and attentive service.  My wife and I had dinner there on a Sunday evening about an hour before closing and we were the only customers there.  The emptiness gave us a bit of an uncomfortable feeling but the staff made us feel welcome.  We started with an appetizer seafood sampler and probably should have stopped there.  This dish was huge (see photo) and more than we needed.  Everything was prepared well.  Not outstanding but not bad either.  I would probably rate them with 3.5 stars if that was an option.

reviews.name: Gerard Gardner
reviews.text:
Best bolognese sauce ever terrific!
Bread with every meal!
Great staff, terrific views of the Statue of Liberty. Eat inside or outside on the water.

reviews.name: Melanie Tam
reviews.text:
Came in for a holiday team lunch with a 12:30 reservation for 9 people. The place was pretty empty. We started off with a few apps - calamari and some burrata. Both were good - no complaints there. For my entree, I went with the Mixed Grill Kebab (skewers of chicken, beef and kofta grilled with peppers, mushrooms and onions, served with rice). The chicken looked like it was going to be dry, but it was perfectly cooked. The beef was cooked to a medium rare (perfect for me). The kofta was a bit undercooked, which I didn't notice until I ate a few pieces. But I didn't get sick from it, so that's a good sign. They give a lot of meat, and a good amount of rice. It doesn't come with a salad like the menu said, but it's definitely enough food anyway.

I wouldn't mind coming back to try some of their other dishes. Maybe in the spring or summertime, once their outdoor seating is available - since it's right by the water.

reviews.name: Eric Lloyd
reviews.text: Great atmosphere for hanging out with friends or by yourself.  You get to watch sports while you enjoy the food and chat with some of the servers and bartenders.  What more can you ask for.

reviews.name: Barbara Alzate
reviews.text: Went to Hooters in Manhattan by pen station and the service was great but the food was not worth the price. Wings were gross and flavorless. Very unhappy

reviews.name: Marina Rangel
reviews.text: The best buffalo wings you are gonna ever eat in USA. A must have ro go. Although it is a very cool place to go to watch sports and hangout with friends. I strongly recommend.

reviews.name: Sayan Ghosh
reviews.text: You know why you've come to Hooters. Nothing to hide here. This downtown Manhattan one is no exception. Decent service even during peak times. And of course lovely hospitality!

reviews.name: Craig b
reviews.text: Disappointed.. Had to sit at the bar no option to sit anywhere else.... The place had no atmosphere.. The girl behind the bar was not friendly and had a bit of an attitude.. Clearly she was having a bad day or not enjoying the job... Food was nice I had a salad.... Would I go again? No! Would i recommend? No!!. If you go you will be very disappointed

reviews.name: Joel Hoekstra
reviews.text: This place is the worst. Service is terrible. They don’t refill drinks, most of our order was wrong, and what was right tasted bland and room temperature. Prices here are way to high for the quality of food and service. Wait times for food is ridiculous. Do not recommend this place. We were also in a group of 10 and asked for separate checks, yet we were brought a single one. Terrible experience

reviews.name: Nigel Buck
reviews.text: Used to be a lot of fun but today was miserable. Also, one of two urinals blocked and full of piss. The fire alarm, see picture, looks a little broken. Shame as we have had a lit of here fun over the years

reviews.name: Colleen Meehan
reviews.text: Slow service but great service and food. I was a little disappointed that I bought a couple shirts and when I wore one yesterday I found the stitches on the sleeve coming undone.  For $35 , that was disappointing

title: sweetgreen
address: 1164 Broadway, New York, NY 10001, United States

reviews.name: Laura Schoenmakers
reviews.text: Always a perfect lunch at sweetgreen. So in love with the ginger sesame dressing!

reviews.name: Brett Pollack
reviews.text: Try to avoid going at lunch. The line wraps around the block. But the salads here are (for some reason) way better than any other salad shop. It might be the dressing. Or the ambience. But one thing's for sure: their harvest bowl is a staple in my diet.

reviews.name: Vibha Panchal
reviews.text:
I have visited sweet green today! Their quality and quantity is awesome. My experience with the staff is good, specially Eric made my salad!!
I would highly recommend this place to everyone!!
Enjoy the healthy meal.

reviews.name: Gabe T
reviews.text: My go to Salad spot, the overall salad itself isn’t super spectacular, it is better than most salads you will get in the area but for a price of course. It’s my go to - mainly for the ease of their app pick up service and their ingredients have always been the freshest I have had in the salad game.

reviews.name: Tiffany Lew
reviews.text: Lines super long at lunch but worth the wait. I love making a customized bowl!

reviews.name: Marisa Harris
reviews.text: This locationis CLOSED due to Covid.

reviews.name: Mitko Blazeski
reviews.text: It's always good but the big crowds starts earlier and earlier.

reviews.name: Theresa Tran
reviews.text: Great, fresh salads. Went here about 2pm and there was a long wait but the portion and taste made it worth it! Salads range from $10-$13.

openingHours.hours: Hide open hours for the week

reviews.name: Alexander Wood
reviews.text: Can't "beet" this place for a truly healthy lunch choices

reviews.name: Josh Roberts
reviews.text: So yummmy and filling! Try the jackfruit bowl. Highly recommend. Then take it to the park and enjoy your scrumptious meal in the sunshine.

reviews.name: Jin Chan
reviews.text: So satisfied! Braised pork with turmeric tahini, charred sweet potato (my favorite), slaw and brown rice.

reviews.name: Simon Landman
reviews.text: Poke bowls for days. Another example of the healthy bowl craze in NYC and beyond. This chain of restaurants is pretty consistent and pretty good. It’s targeted at the vegan and gluten free population, and is a better as a lunch option. Food is fresh and reliable. The taste is good but my dining partner wasn’t happy with the selection - she was hoping more for sandwiches as well. The poke bowl is pretty good; portions are fair/moderate size. Price is NYC average - looking at about 12-17 USD a bowl. There are multiple “little beets” all over Manhattan. Good for a quick bite but don’t expect a table cloth experience.

reviews.name: Gary J
reviews.text:
Will be a regular herfor the crisp salads, salmon seared nicely and sweet potatoes. good quality and portions 

must try the roasted kale 
grilled avacado
turmeric almonds
I enjoyed it all!

reviews.name: Hannah Schwoerer
reviews.text: Jimmy is the best employee there! He is so welcoming and accommodating!! Check it out and ask for Jimmy!

reviews.name: Irina
reviews.text: Lovely, vegan-friendly, customized, healthy, savoury and delicious

reviews.name: Anastasiya 113
reviews.text: Really good! Broccoli, beet hummus,quinoa and beet radicchio 👍🏼

title: Bodega Negra
address: 355 W 16th St, New York, NY 10011, United States

openingHours.hours: Hide open hours for the week

reviews.name: Henny White
reviews.text:
Ambiance is on a million!
Staff was friendly, helpful and accommodating. We requested the mirrored booth. Overall, great attentive service.
4-stars because their dishes are pricey- so I ordered two appetizers which were small portions but flavorful. The spicy rim drinks were poppin' too

reviews.name: Arthur
reviews.text: Amazing food. Great service. Went for my graduation dinner and our waiter "john" was amazing and went above and beyond. Truly a great first experience. Definitely will come here again for another big occasion

reviews.name: Linnette Cruz
reviews.text: I truly loved my experience here. We were here celebrating an important event and I had a minor so they seated us immediately. The food was delicious- appetizers, drinks, and dessert. It was a lounge vibe but very chill. 😍

reviews.name: Luis H
reviews.text:
The short review: 100% recommended, won’t regret it at all.

There are so many great things about this place. I visit this restaurant during the restaurant week, starting with a happy hour margarita at the bar, very decent considering the price of it.

As soon as I got to my table, the ambience was so immersive surrounded by the dimmed lights and barrels on the walls. But the true experience came with the food.

Coming from a Latino culture, the dishes were mastered to almost perfection. Real Mexican blue corn flautas and queso fundido with chorizo we’re amazing, but the chicken tacos were the star of the show. For dessert, the tres leches cake was stunning and presentation can’t be better.

I will definitely come back to try the other options in the menu, and as I said, you won’t regret to spend a great date here with a club fresh atmosphere.

reviews.name: antoinette cabo
reviews.text: AMAZING. The ambiance, staff, food and drinks were over the top. We celebrated our 13 wedding anniversary and Lawernce our server took good care of us. He was the best and Neil too. I'm definitely looking forward to going back.

reviews.name: Carmelo Maisonet
reviews.text: Food was great! The tacos were delicious. The drinks were very good. The desserts were amazing as well. We went for my birthday. This made my special day great

reviews.name: S
reviews.text: Friday night really good music. This place has Excellent service! Upon Arrival wait time for a table was short and the food came quick. However I have to give this place 4 stars because although the food is good its overpriced and the menu doesnt have much variety. The Drinks are also good.

reviews.name: Anthony Chacon
reviews.text: I loved the service here. It was a very nice hangout type of place and has some great food items. The prices and a bit higher but it's still a great place to go. I went for my father and step mother's anniversary and we enjoyed it very much.

title: Murals on 54
address: 63 W 54th St, New York, NY 10019, United States

reviews.name: Ruth Rapoport
reviews.text:
(Translated by Google) Good coffee, at the Warwick Hotel, NEW York, I preferred it. Recommendable breakfasts, very good atmosphere and service.

(Original)
Buen café, en el hotel Warwick, NEW York, mí preferido. Recomendables desayunos,muy buen ambiente y servicio.

reviews.name: Mona Schanche
reviews.text:
(Translated by Google) Good breakfast.

(Original)
Bra frokost.

reviews.name: Edward Rothman
reviews.text:
(Translated by Google) Very average hotel

(Original)
Very average hotel faire

title: Topaz Thai Authentic
address: 127 W 56th St, New York, NY 10019, United States

reviews.name: Engrid Brooker
reviews.text: Food , Drinks and service were exceptional. A quaint little place. True thai cuisine

reviews.name: Lawrence Jahn
reviews.text: Absolutely delicious Thai food and amazing service and I lived in Bangkok for 18 months.

reviews.name: Laura Vidal
reviews.text: Great food and service! Very tasty food. I went with a group of 5 people, we all got different dishes and they were all amazing! The food was so nicely decorated and delicious.

reviews.name: Mahima Srivastava
reviews.text: Excellent Thai restaurant in Midtown West. Food is flavorful and portions are big. They do not take online reservations but you can call and book a table. I have been here many times. My favorite are red curry, green curry, drunken noodle, pineapple fried rice, curry puff, green mango salad, coconut sticky rice with fresh mango when in season. Service is quick and place is always packed.

reviews.name: Shatner Pierre
reviews.text: Great food I went to the one on the left for lunch.  Two separate locations however side by side.

reviews.name: Vidhi K M
reviews.text: A good Thai restaurant in midtown Manhattan. The food is tasty and reasonably priced. Would recommend this restaurant if your looking for a quick bite. Also good for vegetarians.

reviews.name: Matthew Perry
reviews.text: I often take my friends to this restaurant with my warmest recommendations. I  go to this restaurant often. I get very good feedback from my friends. The the food there is yummy and the team is very friendly and cooperative. always when we visit this place we have a pleasant evening.  I recommend this place with pleasure.

reviews.name: Chinmayee Prabhu Dessai
reviews.text: The ambience is really good and feels so comfortable in the midst of a busy city. The food is so tasty. I had the Thai Basil Fried Rice, it was so simple yet so tasty. The staff was very friendly. I would love to eat here again!

title: Wagamama
address: 605 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10158, United States

reviews.name: Osman Dağgezen
reviews.text: Wagamama is a good restaurant where you can taste delicious asian food. It also has a very nice atmosphere.

reviews.name: Aayush Karnavat
reviews.text:
Great food. Pleasant and attentive service! We will be frequenting often!!  The veggie bao buns are great along with the avant garden and the noodles. 

First place ever I've been to with veggie steamed bao buns!!

reviews.name: Helen Feinstein
reviews.text: Great food and drinks. Wonderful attentive service

reviews.name: abdalla elhelow
reviews.text: Excellent place, always eat in wagamama around the world, every time I eat the ramen chicken or beef noodle

reviews.name: Urvish Doshi
reviews.text:
The food (flavor) was really really good, Customer service was amaze!! Interior theme was modern and music was good too. We enjoyed, definitely recommending this place for Japanese, Chienese or korean food. Overall experience it was awesome! 
✅✅✅

reviews.name: Spencer Marks
reviews.text: A must for the best Italian delicacies.  Order a special sandwich at the deli custom made with grilled peppers.  Also, have a glass of wine across the aisle from the deli and sit at a nearby table.  Yummy!

reviews.name: Ayesha Khan
reviews.text:
An interesting place - great for a business lunch. Get the fried cauliflower in the chilly oil sauce - hands down the best starter in their menu. I made a mistake and ordered their avant- garden vegan bowl - with a fake egg and it was a downer. The ingredients just didn’t come together. Separately all fine but not a good combination- very bland. 

Also got a mocktail which was fine. This place was not halal. Fine service.

reviews.name: Daniel Madera
reviews.text: Good food. Decent prices for the area. Ok service.

reviews.name: Shawnae Brodkin
reviews.text: So the menu here is huge! I got the California Benedict and it was really good! The toast it came on was a little cold but the avocado and eggs were hot. As for the atmosphere, this place is crazy busy and kind of cramped. So if you are an anxious person, find another breakfast joint! We literally had a waitress ask us to leave because other guests were waiting, mind you-we had not been sitting at our 2 person table for long but we were waiting for our check so that we COULD leave. It's also a bit pricey for a diner style breakfast (everything was about $17 or more).

reviews.name: Roxana-Larisa Ciobotaru
reviews.text: Fish and chips looked scary but tried them and they tasted as they looked. Pretty burnt also and don’t wanna know what the batter was made out of. Fries did not taste like anything. Would not recommend.

reviews.name: James McGehee
reviews.text: It is a great place with great food, and great service. But, it draws a lot of people to a very small space. Very cramped. But reasonable prices for great food.

reviews.name: Lee Cattermole
reviews.text: The welcoming was warm and friendly. The service was very attentive and the food was very nice. I had eggs benedict, my partner had a vegetable omelette. We enjoyed our breakfast there, we would go back without hesitation.

reviews.name: Marcelo F de Abreu
reviews.text:
Simple diner with huge menu offering unpretentious yet tasty food — several USA-ian classics from hot dogs to New Yorker pastrami, all coming in good sized portions. 

Friendly service, cozy atmosphere. With several regular locals at the tables being called by their names by staff, it gives a good homely feeling.

One time we were there, a gentleman regular paid for two ladies, also regulars, sitting at another table, but did not stay to receive their thanks. Another time, ... Yes this is the kind of place for listening to stories, from other customers, from staff — another reason as good as their food to keep coming back!

reviews.name: Charles Kwok
reviews.text: First time in New York and this was the first breakfast joint I went to. We were on a bit of a rush as our tour was about an hour or so later. Once we walked in we were friendly greeted by our server Erma. The place was packed and everyone were super busy. Erma made sure we were taken care of. She did her best and was constantly smiling and making friendly conversation which was very nice and respectable as i could tell English is not her first language. The food and portions were great. I would definitely still go back just because of how well Erma treated us.

reviews.name: Anthony Makridis
reviews.text: The waitress was fun. The food was fresh and breakfast was simple and delicious. Nothing fancy here, just good, simple things and great staff to start your day. Coffee was fresh and the OJ too. The location is a little small and there is not a lot of space so don't bring your work bag. Just come eat and head out.

reviews.name: David Torr
reviews.text: The food here is amazing. The service from staff is second to none. We were in New York for 4 days and frequented Astro every morning. Cant wait to revisit next year

title: Cafe Centro
address: MetLife Building, 200 Park Avenue The, New York, NY 10166, United States

reviews.name: Cody Caldwell
reviews.text: I love this restaurant a lot. there is a nice air. The meals are great. the service is efficient and the crew is professional. The price is honest. very much recommend.

reviews.name: Jonathan Zisser
reviews.text: Delicious food and beautiful decor that blends the classic with the modern. A great place for a romantic dinner out.

reviews.name: Dorian Andersen
reviews.text: This restaurant offers awesome service as well as delightful menu. The best place in town. The food came out rapidly and the rates were fair. Will definitely recommend this restaurant.

reviews.name: Family Fan
reviews.text: Good lunch spot. Food options were decent and the presentation and ambience was good.   Nothing stood out in particular as excellent but rounded up from 3.5 stars.

reviews.name: Alan Klayman
reviews.text: Excellent for Breakfast.  Lunch/Dinner 4****.  Central location for a midtown breakfast meeting.  Food/Service exactly what you are expecting.

reviews.name: Tom Moncho
reviews.text: Good food, and nice outdoor area.

reviews.name: Brayden Mora
reviews.text: This is a big place with both an outdoor bar where the business types go to get drinks after work and that part gets loud. There's also an outdoor section for people wanting to properly eat a sit down meal, so it's great that it accommodates all types. Perfect location next to Grand Central. The food is delicious. I took advantage of their "french restaurant week," and it was delicious. I had salmon that literally melted as my entree. Very attentive service. I would definitely come here regularly whenever I'm in the City.

reviews.name: Jose Funk
reviews.text: They offer a great variety of delicious food. I enjoyed eating here. Employees are always kind, rates are affordable and the spot is always well organised.

reviews.name: Craig Cheng
reviews.text: Had afternoon tea at this restaurant overlooking Columbus Circle in the Time Warner building.   Despite all the negative reviews i had heard about, i had a wonderful experience.   We were seated with a beautiful window view.  The host and waitress were very friendly and attentive.   In addition, the tea set was creative and delicious.  The sandwiches were very tasty.   The sconces came with house made jam that was out of this world.  In the dessert plate, there were meringue hiding a yellow creamy yoke, giving a feeling of poached eggs.  The umbrella macarons were delicious and the blue bird cream puff was fantastic.

reviews.name: Atche Portillo
reviews.text:
Enjoyed the food and drinks. We were served by one of the barmen and so I got to request a white negroni (because it was brunch). It was good! 

I got the chicken burger with truffle mayo, it was yummy! Tried pineapple carpaccio and I'm never gonna eat pineapple in a different way, there's no going back! For dessert, we had banana with caramel and served with Earl grey ice cream, the combo was perfect!

reviews.name: Amanda Walker
reviews.text: Great location, great view. Food was surprisingly good, better than expected. Service was a bit slower than we wanted, but worth the wait. If you want your tea before the food is ready, you need to let the wait person know. My biggest critique is that it is an expensive fixed price high tea, but worth it for a special occasion. Loved everything about this place. The interior designer did a fab job. Wonderful views of Columbus Circle. Delicious food.

reviews.name: Christine Alemany
reviews.text: Great spot for business meetings over coffee.  The atmosphere is formal and relaxed at the same time. The coffee is great, and they have wonderful pastries too much on.  It's a bit on the pricey side so I took off a star. I've been planning on getting gin and tonics for happy hour. Otherwise, I love Bluebird London.

reviews.name: Elsa C
reviews.text:
We came here Monday for afternoon tea.
I made a reservation in advance to get the window seats. 
The restaurant is quit big, and busy for Monday afternoon.  
They got 3 choose for afternoon tea.
1. Pink tea $50/ person
2. Pink G tea $60 / person (with gin-based cocktail)
3. Pink bubble tea $70/ person (with champagne)

We decide to go with Pink G tea, which included traditional high tea with a cocktails.

From the bottom, they have 4 different flavor sandwich. 
-coronation chicken, apricot and raisins
-smoked salmon and copper crepe fraiche
-truffle egg and spinach
-cucumber, cream cheese, dill and chives

For the scones
One fruit, and one plain
Serve with strawberry jam, Hudson valley clotted cream

And cakes on the top
-strawberry Victoria sponge
-grapefruit tart
- hibiscus rose macaron
-raspberry rose jelly 

We got extra fries on the side.
Everything taste amazing, plus the view.
We couldn't finish the top sweet section, we we had that to go. 
The serves was great, the waiter keep adding hot water to our tea pot. And we were too happy to chill and stay there pretty late, but they didn't ask us to leave. 

I saw other people's lunch looks tasty as well, will come back to try it!

reviews.name: lingchao kong
reviews.text: The view is amazing but the food is just fine. I ordered avocado toast. The bread is too hard to chew.

reviews.name: Kuo Fung
reviews.text: Great location and food to match. Also top notch service from all the staff

reviews.name: Awadh AlKetheri
reviews.text: A classy restaurant with amazing seating area and Colorful. In love with their sticky toffee pudding, must try and highly recommended. Also the cheesecake is very nice, you can feel the cheese.

reviews.name: Alice HG
reviews.text: So very nice service staff and my food was delicious.

reviews.name: Miguel Crawford
reviews.text: We like a lot to go out. Last night we  visited this superb restaurant which friends told us about. We spent a delightful time there with delicious meal and a nice stuff and a talented  chef. We put this venue in our list  and we will definitely go again soon. We highly recommend.

reviews.name: CS F
reviews.text: Big rain outside so I ended up here, location, seating, ambient are all good except the food. The fish tissue was melting. This was the first and only time I didn’t finish my sushi ever. If you like sushi, there are many other great sushi places in NYC...but probably not this one

reviews.name: Jamie Chen
reviews.text: We went to eat at Haru as we were craving sushi. We were seated right away on a Friday night. The sushi was tasty. We had the sumo sushi dinner, eel cucumber and eel avocado handroll, mackerel sashimi, and a salmon teriyaki dinner with taro chips. One thing we all agreed that we didn't like was the pork buns. The pork skin was crispy but the meat was overcooked. It was dry and it had too much hoisin sauce. Also, as a cook myself, I would recommend a difference in texture. I would prepare a slice of tender pork belly in order to pair it with the granny smith apple slice. If i were to keep the pork belly crispy, I would recommend some greens or cilantro and julienned cucumbers, perhaps a light flavor mayo. Anyhow, I would go back for the sushi. :)

reviews.name: Anthony Chow
reviews.text:
Haru offers middle-of-the-road Japanese food at a slight premium, given its proximity to Times Square and the sights.

The food is nothing to write home about, but certainly it was a comfortable enough dining experience. If you're craving Japanese in tourist town, I do recommend giving them a try.

reviews.name: Monserrat Andujar-Geacoman
reviews.text: The food was fast, fresh and I could have had double of everything we ate.  I stopped myself from a Food baby and thought I’d just save it for the next trip.  Nice job Haru staff.

reviews.name: PolEak ZincMelodic
reviews.text: A very nice american-japanese restaurant. Waiters and waitresses are very friendly and helpful. Overall the food is great, but some one the selection can be a bit too salty than they should be.

reviews.name: Victoria
reviews.text: The lobster roll was AMAZING!  Stopped in between Broadway shows. Service was quick and friendly. We sat at the bar.

reviews.name: Kevin Jones
reviews.text: We had our wedding reception on the rooftop terrace at Lattanzi in 2011, fantastic restaurant, service and food was incredible..we look forward to returning next year for our 10 year anniversary.

reviews.name: Alan Taylor
reviews.text: Great food and a busy restaurant with a real nice atmosphere - will definitely rank it as one of my favorites in NY

reviews.name: Lauren Aust
reviews.text: Whenever we're in NYC, we try to get over to Lattanzi. Love the romantic, cozy setting. The Chicken Parm and the Napoleon are incredible. We've never had bad service here and the staff is always attending.

reviews.name: James Clavijo
reviews.text: Good food, good service, and really nice ambiance.

reviews.name: Hanomag Shadowfeet
reviews.text: Not impressed in the least. Small portions. Overpriced. I know 20 pizzerias on long island that blow this place away.  The pasta primavera was ridiculous.. Six florets..a few measly pieces if zucchini.. Some bits of tomato. None of the dishes in our ten person party were anything to write home about. Place was packed. Dont know why. Save your money go elsewhere...

reviews.name: Theodore Graham
reviews.text: It has been awhile since my last visit. Still an enjoyable experience and the bucatini was to die for as always.

reviews.name: Tim Blasingim
reviews.text: Nice atmosphere and good food. $$$ out of 5.

reviews.name: Allison Dastrup
reviews.text: I had the ravioli. Amazing flavor.

reviews.name: John Marro
reviews.text: I celebrated my PhD today in this great place. happy to tell that we passed a magnificent evening and the venue was surely one of the reasons for that outstanding meeting. The stuff  collaborated in a sweet way, the cuisine was tasty and my buddies were so  happy. We shall definitely come back again for more events. Thank you very much.

reviews.name: Christopher Alexis
reviews.text: A comfortable atmosphere just blocks from Times Square and the theater district. The chicken with light cream sauce was delicious including the calamari dish. The waiter was friendly and attentive to our group.

reviews.name: Aditi Durga
reviews.text:
Very busy restaurant! It’s about a 10 min walk from
 The New Amsterdam Theatre and I’m happy I made a reservation in advance. The service started off great with the staff giving recommendations but as soon as dinner time hits and it’s packed, I waited 40 mins to order dessert. The food was good, but I was not impressed with the cheese bread or yucca fries and hotdogs. I would say that the flan and steak were delicious and I’d definitely go back to try other items on the menu.

reviews.name: Mariah E.G Cameron
reviews.text: Great service and amazing $5 happy hour menu with Margs, wines, and more! You will not go wrong!! I would like to shout out Mayra my bartender and waitress! She's so amazing and efficient.

reviews.name: K J
reviews.text: The food and drink was amazing. Our waiter Johnthan was very accommodating. Totally loved his service.

reviews.name: Lori Keith
reviews.text: Great food, good service.  Everything we had was delicious and freshly made. I tried the original caipirinha -- it was amazing and refreshing. We also had the cheese bread, collard greens and steaks. Everything was fantastic. Close to Times Square, easy to find.  Definitely worth eating here.

reviews.name: Don C
reviews.text: Delicious and authentic Brazilian food! The service was attentive and made sure we got out quick for our show!

reviews.name: J T.
reviews.text:
Wow!

I had a fancy Brazilian dish (black bean stew) and was delish. Loved the staff all very kind and attentive. 

Party all loved their dishes. All came out quick. 

Kids menu is boring in my opinion, all pasta..  have something Brazilian.. other than that it was great.

reviews.name: Rich H
reviews.text:
A dark, cozy atmosphere. Exposed brick walls and (fake) candle lit tables. Everything is very inviting and friendly. Service is ok, nothing spectacular. We came for a lunch on a Saturday and it was not crowded at all. Food was tasty, I ordered the fillet mignon that was a little over cooked for what I ordered (medium rare). Overall not the best nor the worst experience.

Edit after meal: I understand adding a gratuity to a bill of a party of 8. I don't agree with it being 20%, especially if the service was lack luster.  For this a 3rd star will be removed.

reviews.name: Karina Flores
reviews.text: This is a great spot for dancing, and some drinks that are not margaritas because their margaritas are not the best, not flavor, watered down, too much mix. I would not recommend anyone to go here for food, the food was super bland, no seasoning, and not flavorful at all. We had the enchiladas and it tasted very bad. Also had the "fried" Ice cream that was NOT at all fried, just covered in the cornflakes not fried and it tasted bad also just regular icecream, false advertising. I paid for the 3 course meal and I would not recommend it. But the whole atmosphere is great, music was good, the staff is very nice, attentive, and courteous ! Pre-game before coming here and eat for sure before coming here.

reviews.name: Robert Tedder
reviews.text: Good food but their hours are unreliable. We've shown up twice during open hours and they told us they were still closed. Today's excuse, the cashier didn't show up. Last time, they didn't realize they should be open. Frustrating to say the least.

reviews.name: Jelena Pejic
reviews.text:
Went there for dinner and salsa on a Friday night. The food was pretty good, the service was phenomenal. However, the music upstairs (where is supposed to be Latin mix of salsa, bachata music and other) was so loud it hurt to be on the dance floor. Also the choice of music wasn’t good for dancing and there were only few people on the dance floor. It was also impossible to talk, due to loud music. 

I recommend it for food, but not for salsa.

reviews.name: Keely V Villamizar
reviews.text: They have good music and salsa nights, thought I wouldn't go there to get neither food nor well drinks. Either go for whiskey or tequila, besides their humongous size of food portions are unnecessary I would rather say quality over quantity, if you are paying the prices for the dinner at least it could be a bit better or maybe that was just my experience. Drinks and music it's a better idea than dine in. Overall, not too bad not good enough either. Hopefully when I come back service will be better(I hope so).

reviews.name: Sulabh Mehta
reviews.text: The live Mariachi band and the rustic decor adds to the charm of great Mexican food. Guacamole and the nachos are a must try and food overall was good. There is also a Salsa dance club upstairs that you can get into by showing your dinner receipt.

reviews.name: Stephanie A.
reviews.text: The food and service are both very good. They also have salsa dance classes and bar with DJ on the other floor which is cool.

reviews.name: Dillon Kelly
reviews.text: This is a great place. It has great food and great drinks. It is quiet and there is always space at the bar. There is live music on the lower floor and the general ambiance is great for it's location.

title: Russian Samovar Restaurant and Piano Bar
address: 256 W 52nd St, New York, NY 10019, United States

reviews.name: Heather McCann
reviews.text: This is an amazing place to visit after catching a show – or a taping of the Late Show with Stephen Colbert! Great music, food, and service at this piano bar. Our server, Moon, did such a fantastic job taking care of us. Loved the delicious selection of infused Russian vodkas…try Plum!! Also, if you’re going to treat yourself to Russian caviar, do it here. We will most definitely come back on our next visit.

reviews.name: Jody Thrash
reviews.text: Good food, good service. The pianist showed up about halfway through our dinner and was a nice touch to the atmosphere. I had the salmon belini appetizer, a Moscow mule, and chicken Kiev and it was all super delicious.

reviews.name: Glen Weldon
reviews.text: I got the 3 pirozhok (potato &mushroom, potato & onion, and beef) all were amazing. Their I had two of their signature drinks with their infused vodka,  both were stiff and had great flavor. The live music was good too. I'll be back.

reviews.name: Boris Alergant
reviews.text: It was absolutely fantastic. I've been coming here for over 20 years and had stopped because things had gone down hill. I came here for the first time in 3 years and was pleasantly surprised by both the exceptionally delicious food, the personalized service. It's great to see the legendary place really come into its own!

reviews.name: Maricar Atienza
reviews.text:
fair service,average selection in menu,
when asked why there was dark colored floater in the regular glass of water,
waitress quickly said," that's lemon".
to my surprise! noone orders a glass of plain water and receives one with lemon added without one requesting for it.

reviews.name: Maries Mirsky
reviews.text: Recommended stop before or after a Broadway show. We decided to stop here before seeing Wicked. The Russian decor, the Russian service, and live music transported you to a Russian speak easy. The flavored vodka is a must try, we had mango and cucumber, both delightful and refreshing. Then we ordered a beer and white russian, delish! We only had appetizers since we were in a hurry, but made the right choice. We started off with two hot piroshki, one filled with with potato and mushroom and one filled with potato and onion, both exquisite. The warm flaky crust and soft potato center was a great compliment to a cold night. Three smoked fish platter served with warm blini with a dollop of sour cream when rolled up is the best combination of sweet and salty. The service was friendly and helpful. Prices were as expected for midtown Manhattan.

reviews.name: kahve bean
reviews.text: The Russian Samovar is by far one of the coolest and unforgettable places in NYC. We stopped in Last minute for a birthday with no reservations and they were beyond gracious to us. The wait staff, the host, the singers and dancers were all phenomenal. They treated us like true rock stars and made us feel so special. This place is a true gem. Thank you guys for the amazing evening. We will be back! Oh the food was also incredible!

reviews.name: Celia Evans
reviews.text: Great service, amazingly delicious закуски! Which is what I had. Nice selection of vodkas. Really nice people and music. My favorite was the TV playing old Russian cartoons all night long!

reviews.name: Hannah Kim
reviews.text: Excellent steak, bacon, and sides! I suggest making a reservation as spots fill up quickly.

reviews.name: Rebecca Schultz
reviews.text: Finest place to have some food when in a hurry. Their service is fast, rates are convenient, great vibes. I highly recommend this place

reviews.name: Matt Josephson
reviews.text: Truth be told, I'm no fan of Peter Luger steaks. I think they're over-hyped, overrated, and resting on their laurels. That said, the burgers are devine. They're hearty, juicy, ½ pound patties of pure joy. I mean, they're pure beef, but they bring joy. You know what I mean!

reviews.name: jay jo
reviews.text: I recently went with a few of my friends- we ate outside which I actually liked - the food was amazing! I am happy they were back open

reviews.name: Dana Hilton
reviews.text: We came to this restaurant for dinner. This restaurant was recommended to us by a friend.  Well, it was very nice. The crew were extremely nice and we had a great feeling. The meal was tasty. We loved this restaurant a lot and we will definitely return to this restaurant. We recommend this place to all.

reviews.name: Trump 2020
reviews.text: I was just passing by. But I do know that they have the most fabulous steak of all time. The old lady went to many different poultries and bought from the absolute best part of the animal that produces the perfect steak.

reviews.name: Ajinkya Rao
reviews.text:
Excellent service. The wait staff was warm and very friendly. The drinks were on point. The steaks themselves were very good. I've had better steaks in Texas, but these were the best I'd ever had outside of Texas. The creamed spinach, however, was by far the best I've ever had! Also, the onion rings were phenomenal.

Reminder: Bring cash or your debit card. They do not accept credit cards.

reviews.name: Anastacia Alex
reviews.text: I had an amazing lunch today! The food was ready for pick up in 30 minutes after I submitted my order. Everything was very delicious and nicely packed.

title: Benihana
address: 47 W 56th St, New York, NY 10019, United States

reviews.name: Shay Jackson
reviews.text: I go every year twice a year. My birthday on April and my son birthday in May. Can’t get enough of this place. The food is amazing. Get more than what you pay for. The chefs are awesome and hilarious. Service is always top notch. They listen to your orders and take allergies very serious.

reviews.name: Stephen Payor
reviews.text: On behalf of everyone in the laboratory at Lenox Hill Hospital, thank you! Your donation was extremely appreciated. Not only was the food delicious but it allowed us to refuel as we continue the fight against Covid-19. The gesture reminds us we are all in this together and the delivery allows us to get fed and back to the lab in less time.

reviews.name: Makeda M
reviews.text: Very unprofessional! I called to make a reservation for a birthday party for a large group. I was instructed to fill out the form online for parties larger than 10 people. I was informed I would be notified within 24 hours upon submission. I called the following day to find out how things were going. A very nice hostess informed me that the manager was busy at the moment but would contact me in a few hours. She was nice enough to give me information about the reservation process for large groups. She even took down my name and my number and said he would get back to me! However, with all that be said, I never received a response to my request and it is now going on the 3rd day! Sad because I actually came here for Mother’s Day several years ago. Unfortunate that they treat customers this way!

reviews.name: Spooky Skeleton Spooky
reviews.text:
So disappointed! I’ve been going to Benihana’s for years now the food is great! But literately my last four times there have been a disaster! This restaurant has sadly gone down hill and here’s why, IT’S SO COLD! 
This restaurant really needs to invest in a better heating system. It hasn’t been an enjoyable experience at all, I was there last night for Valentine’s Day and I was freezing, I had two drinks and that did not help! I don’t want to go back to this restaurant again! By the time you get all your food on the plate the food is so cold! Not to mention that the staff at the front of the restaurant that are hosting are really disorganized. When I walked in the restaurant yesterday everyone there looked upset, people with reservations were waiting a long time because the restaurant overbooked for the day. I’m hoping this is helpful insight to the people responsible of the success of the restaurant!

reviews.name: Elisabeth Hediger
reviews.text: Came on New Years Day and the place was bustling! Even though they were super busy, every staff member was friendly and accommodating to our group of 6. The Hibachi experience was fun and tasty thanks to our amazing chef who put on a fantastic show while cooking our food to perfection! Excited to go back!

reviews.name: David Ollivierre
reviews.text: Just ate and I'm stuffed. Chef's are entertaining. Food is well-seasoned. However!Is this the premiere Japanese steakhouse in NYC? 🤔 To be continued...

reviews.name: Dee
reviews.text: Had a wonderful time. Very crowded on weekends and a bit of a wait. You’re better off making a reservation. Great entertainment and delicious food

reviews.name: Rose Sant
reviews.text: We were served by Gillian yesterday night January 5. He is amazing, gave us good recommendation and took the time to be sure that we had a wonderful experience. The chef was amazing and was the food. Because of them both we will recommend the place 100%. Everyone looked happy to work there.

title: Black Tap
address: 136 W 55th St, New York, NY 10019, United States

reviews.name: Ashley G
reviews.text: Food was good, but we waited over 20 minutes to be seated and the restaurant wasn't even half full. Staff was friendly but speed of service was super sloe considering how not busy they were. Cool place though and prices weren't too bad.

reviews.name: Geovana Gaitan
reviews.text: Go with time, most likely you will have to wait in line. But is worth your time! The food is amazing, their burgers are tender and juicy! And the flavors match perfectly!! What I was most amazed with was their shakes!!! Wow!! Amazing!

reviews.name: C. Muñoz
reviews.text: We loved everything about this place! Both the Carolina and Texas burgers were perfectly cooked and delicious! Great local beers as well. Excellent service! We're definitely coming back for dessert!

reviews.name: BriannaTropicana
reviews.text: Visited yesterday with friends. Expect to wait on line before being seated. Other than that, amazing service! Waiter gave supreme service and was patient with my group as we divided our bill. The place has a cool 90s ambiance to it and has really nice old school music. Food was great; the portion sizes were delightful! Definitely a place to visit at least one time in your life!

reviews.name: Nathan Dolbir
reviews.text: The burger was DELICIOUS and the shake was AWESOME. The environment is super laid back and the servers were very welcoming. No complaints (other than I couldn't finish the shake!). Black Tap is quite the experience.

reviews.name: Eve
reviews.text: 12/29/19. . . It's a nice place once you get in.  Be prepared  to wait on line.  No reservations.  The staff was pleasant and friendly. Food was yummy. My family and I enjoyed our meals.  Fun atmosphere,  great music.  Definitely,  will go back again👍🏾👍🏾👍🏾

reviews.name: Courtney Bradford Pike
reviews.text: The food was delicious! Enjoyed the atmosphere, the music and the bartenders. Service was fairly quick and friendly.  The salad with the veggie burger was delicious and filling. The fried pickles were good too.

reviews.name: Jennifer Clemow
reviews.text: This was a very good restaurant! We enjoyed the food, and especially the milkshakes. The waiters were friendly, but the food took a little while to get to our table. However, we thought that it was overall a very nice place. Might as well stop here, and get a milkshake too!

title: Santina
address: 820 Washington St, New York, NY 10014, United States

reviews.name: Mikaela E
reviews.text: One of my favorite places during winter. Because it feels like stepping into a mediterranean restaurant in the summer! Staff is very helpful, drinks are amazing and so are the sharing plates! It’s usually packed during the weekends so make a reservation in advance if you are planning to go here.

reviews.name: G I
reviews.text: Beautiful interior bellow High Line. Excellent stuff. Nice dishes.

reviews.name: Keren M
reviews.text: I honestly loved everything except of the prices. This place is really good but not out of the ordinary good, this is why I think that the price tag doesn't fit the value you get, but this is only my personal opinion. I had the chickpeas pancakes with the egg salad and a side of bacon, everything was yummy and fresh.

reviews.name: Jen Livetoeatnyc
reviews.text: Beautiful interior and gluten free options!

reviews.name: Stephen Raczka
reviews.text: Very unique cuisine. Flavors not normally thought to be Italian yet eclectic and delicious. I could never have experienced this cuisine anyplace else. Service is the quickest I've ever seen even at a very busy time of day.

reviews.name: OFFICIALMINAMUSIC
reviews.text: the stars are for the venue and vibe, it’s a fun place with friendly staff, but I would not return for the food. It’s diner food at an upscale price.

reviews.name: Vigor
reviews.text: The food is delicious and you should try. I give it a four because there's not many options but if you do go try the lemonade its excellent!

reviews.name: Stan Gendlin
reviews.text: By far one of the best breakfasts I’ve ever had in nyc. Food was so full of amazing flavors and their two house made sauces the salsa verde and Smokey tomato were unbelievably delicious. I coated my entire meal with them. We are definitely coming back as there is so much more to try, great location next to the Whitney Museum! You must try it here!

title: Jongro BBQ
address: 22 W 32nd St fl 2, New York, NY 10001, United States

reviews.name: Albert Ciolek
reviews.text: Best Korean BBQ that I've had! The food was great, drinks were dangerously good, and service was good.

reviews.name: James Mason
reviews.text: Believe the hype!  Jongro is that good.  The Kimchi soup is amazing!  The BBQ is succulent and delicious.  The dipping sauces are the best I've had.  Beeline to Jongro and get you some!   Truly excellent.

reviews.name: Micah Wall
reviews.text: Certainly a place worth visiting, the food is fantastic and well prepared, the cost is reasonable and it is constantly well kept there. 5 stars.

reviews.name: Allison Nielsen
reviews.text:
Probably the best quick meal I've ever had. Use the Yelp waitlist to breeze through and get seated without having to wait at the restaurant. 

We got the steak and the pork and were so impressed by how quickly everything came out -- but what was more impressive was that this food was actually high quality. Normally you don't see that very often in most restaurants.

Definitely want to come back here! Great for a group.

reviews.name: Jared Jones
reviews.text:
A hidden gem in an otherwise nondescript building. Located on the 2nd floor, elevator opens directly to the restaurant - as soon as you get your first glimpse you know it's gonna be great.

Attentive staff, great atmosphere, and delicious food. By far the best part of the experience is the BBQ - many meats offered and all truly amazing. It's fun to watch your meal cooked to perfection before you.

Ask for a booth by the window for a great view of the street below.

reviews.name: The AlphonZeus
reviews.text:
My food was fine (picture included with chicken over rice) and the atmosphere was pretty, but the service was unfortunately questionable. My friend ordered soontofu/spicy tofu soup but asked if it could be made less spicy. The waitress replied that they could. When two orders were brought out, my friend asked which one is the less spicy one, and the waitress pointed it out. 

The first red flag is that both looked red, when normally, they looked orange. After a few minutes of eating, my friend noticed that it was spicy and then tried the other bowl. Again, it was around the same level of spice. So when they called over one of the managers, he said that they do not deviate from the original cooking. So there was a mishap and misrepresentation there. 

The managing waiter tried to remedy it by making it less spicy, where he managed to make the soup look more orange using an egg. It was a nice effort, but the whole thing could have been avoided if the waitress was more upfront with what they could or could not do with the food. 

Would have been a 2 stars, but the attempt to remedy brought it up to 3.

reviews.name: Sachin Shrestha
reviews.text: I was happy with the food. It tasted good and portions are big. I was not so much fan of the ambiance as it felt too mechanical like it was a factory. But regardless I would hive 5 star for food.

reviews.name: Zamantha de Gula
reviews.text: Wait times can go over an hour if you're going for dinner on a Friday night, but it's definitely worth it. If you can, go for lunch on a weekday, there's almost always no wait and the staff and atmosphere feel less hectic. I always take visiting friends and family here if I get the chance to!

title: Natsumi
address: 226 W 50th St, New York, NY 10019, United States

reviews.name: A Rollins
reviews.text: Very clean and accessible restaurant. They offer large meals and for economical rates. We liked the meals very much and the staff members were super welcoming and chatty. Highly recommended.

reviews.name: O Nabs
reviews.text: Generic quality. I had the omakase, it was underwhelming, sushi rice was very hard and chewy. Great drinks and desserts, and the best sushi was the scallop, not included in the omakase. For the price I would rather go to a place with better quality of sushi

reviews.name: Shahida Choudary
reviews.text: Amazing sushi! Oysters were perfect and I'm not much of an oyster person, but these were very well done. The salmon was like butter and the Toro was divine. Definitely going back.

reviews.name: Michael Birdsall
reviews.text: I regularly come purchasing some food here. I enjoy the swift customer service and well cooked dishes. I recommend this place.

reviews.name: Randy Sumner
reviews.text: Terrific bargain so close to Times Square. We sat at the sushi bar and thoroughly enjoyed the creativity and plating. The asparagus appetizer was amazing!

reviews.name: Brandi Linné
reviews.text:
Food was good, service was excellent. Our reservation was for 6:45 and they managed to sneak us in at 6 and we were out by 6:45.

Our server, Tony, was very attentive.

reviews.name: Edward D
reviews.text: I adore this restaurant! They prepare good meals, their menu is decent, The cook in that place is a professional, I love a lot tasting all their food. The food is always good, the service towards the customers  is good. I  go often to this place and I not even once was unsatisfied. I recommend it to all.

reviews.name: Mittikset on The Road
reviews.text: Nice place and good sushi, imaginative rolls and also nice non-sushi fusion Asian like dumplings and fried calamari. Try the sushi roll with gold leaves! Reasonably priced and good variety of dishes. Service was a bit slow but otherwise ok experience.

reviews.name: Bill Prindle
reviews.text: Came here with my Italian American in-laws who grew up eating excellent Italian food. I'd made the reservation and would have borne the blame for a bad meal — but I had nothing to worry about. All seven of us had different meals and all were excellent. Very good food as described in other reviews, great wine list, comfortable space, and attentive service. Looking forward to returning!

reviews.name: Katy Breuer
reviews.text: We had a small business dinner with 7 people and it was perfect! Food and service were amazing!  We had a large seating area so we could talk easily without being overheard.  I’d highly recommend this restaurant.

reviews.name: Michael Feinstein
reviews.text: Dined here on a Saturday night with three other couples. Had a big round table near the bar. Quiet enough to converse.  Decent wine list. Robert Mondavi Napa Cab was pretty good.  I didn't care for the octopus salad.  But I did like the branzino which was delicious.  Service was very professional. Nice place. Kinda old school Italian.

reviews.name: Elaine Cohen
reviews.text: Great.  Food great. Staff great we love it

reviews.name: Susan Elliott
reviews.text: Wonderful food, excellent menu, beautiful atmosphere and great service.

reviews.name: Aidan Hall
reviews.text: To say that Amata is a great restaurant and experience, is beyond an understatement. They are incredibly friendly, pay close attention to any allergies that your party may have and the food is truly out of this world. From the calamari and meatball starters to the cheesecake at the end, Amata is truly a fantastic family experience that you need to try for yourself

reviews.name: Chris Christofilakes
reviews.text: Both my brother and I are NYC born (and raise) of Italian descent, this restaurant is a pinnacle of classic NY Italian food. We really liked this place, excellent hospitality and amazing food, great value.

reviews.name: Bill Hopkins
reviews.text:
We held a retirement party for 17 at Amata last week.   I worked with Chris, the owner, to book the private room and set up the menu...a very easy and stress free experience.  Chris was very helpful and flexible in accommodating our needs. He even managed a last minute cake request by bringing one in from a bakery near his home!
Food was great, venue was nice, service was fantastic, a perfect night for our group.
Highly recommend for any group outing,

title: Joe's Shanghai
address: 46 Bowery, New York, NY 10013, United States

reviews.name: Angela Ryan
reviews.text: You know what to expect, but honestly not great. My main gripe is that the dumpling skins are too thick (authentic XLB should have much thinner skin).  Drunken chicken also tasted like it wasn't fresh (was mushy)

reviews.name: Catherine Delacruz
reviews.text: We come here for the Xiao Long Bao and it is so yummy . This is the place to come sit and eat . Definitely not about the atmosphere or the service but I really don’t mind . I’m there for good food and good food only ❤️

reviews.name: Eva Busch
reviews.text: One of the rare NY touristy spots that delivers.  The soup dumplings are awesome and I’ve tried a lot all over the city.

reviews.name: Fatih Sahin
reviews.text: Sorry but cannot understand the hype about it! Stuff is not welcoming at all! We ordered fried shrimp rice and vegetable dumpling. Fried rice was definetly the most standard fried rice I ever got. NOTHING SPECIAL!! it was even no salt in it. I asked for salt and they just said “no salt” for takeout. ehmm okay.... ate maybe a quarter of the rice and throw the rest in the trash box... dumpling ehhh. Would not eat it again. Definetly MUCH BETTER ASIAN food around New York!

reviews.name: K K
reviews.text: Very poor service, we have 3 people and waiting for a very long time but still not getting table.  Even though they provide you the ticket and number but the host/restaurant worker did not follow their waiting queue and ONLY favor with certain TYPE or group of customer to provide table.  The queue system is not fair. We left the restaurant and find other much better service restaurant.  If restaurant or business the way how to treat their customer with bypass and favor, no matter how tasty the food is... it is not that important.. Everyone pay their money to purchase equal and fair service..... Beside I had this restaurant before and the food is only in average level and I won't miss too much at all.  But because of how they treat their customer, I guess I will never go back.....

reviews.name: Cube Hire
reviews.text: Outstanding food and service. Large serving size specially for what I paid. I was seated quickly, my order taken quickly And the food was delicious. The bathroom was clean.  I should’ve asked about the tea as it was excellent. This restaurant did not disappoint.

reviews.name: skiyana
reviews.text:
Oh. My. Lord. 
The service? Amazing.
The food? Amazing.
The freaking soup dumplings? AMAZING.
Please, for your own sake, COME HERE. Admittedly the wait is long, but it’s worth it. The food is fresh and delicious and the staff is amazing!

reviews.name: Michael Knabe
reviews.text:
Was skeptical of the new location after reading some reviews, but things are as good as ever at Joe’s. The new space is incredible and much more enjoyable to eat at with high ceilings and very well done decor.

Prices may have gone up a small amount but didn’t really notice. Portions are still decent and the soup dumplings are still incredible! Definitely worth it just for those.

Best of all they finally start you with a glass of water with hot tea by request (although the tea is served in a pint glass and impossible to pick up for a while).

title: Cafe Evergreen
address: 1367 1st Avenue, New York, NY 10021, United States

reviews.name: Madeleine Kattan
reviews.text: I have been coming here since I was a kid. They have lightning fast service and a super nice host. Also, best dumplings ever. It's hard to find good chicken dumplings at a dim sum place but they have them and they're amazing. Also super yummy scallion pancakes and soup dumplings!

reviews.name: Kaiden Adams
reviews.text: I go to this special place every couple of days since I like the ambiance that is characterizes this restaurant. The crew is awfuly friendly and skilfull. The service is deeply rapid. Not to mention, the food they prepare is excellent. I came often and I was always pleased. The cost is decent. I suggest this place to my friends and family.

reviews.name: Nefertiti Ross
reviews.text: I have been here several times and I absolutely LOVE their food. So flavorful and authentic! My only downfall is the lack of English some of the staff speak. I have no problem with other languages and cultures but sometimes it’s hard to be specific with my order when you can’t communicate with your waiter/tress. On another note... that’s not going to stop me from going back! The food is AMAZING!

reviews.name: Peter DeLuca
reviews.text:
Cafe Evergreen is the best Chinese restaurant on the upper east side. Very consistent and reliable. Monique who is the manager is a pleasure to deal with in person or on the phone. She handles take out orders with a friendly demeanor and always gets the order correct. 
Very accommodating management and also has added gluten free options. 5 stars for sure!

reviews.name: Carl Rosen
reviews.text: ONLY Chinese restaurant serving Peking Chicken & Peking Duck; (half or whole). Best steamed dumpling, Pork fried rice, & Special Prawns in NYC! Great food; no MSG, & Gluten free dishes. Love Chinese? Run, don't walk. Peking Chicken photo attached!

reviews.name: Babes 7566
reviews.text: Wasnt a fan of the food at. Everything tasted as if the oil used was old. But there fried rice on the other hand was good thats the only thing I actually ate from all the stuff I ordered.

reviews.name: Matt Jacobs
reviews.text: The wontons in the someone soup are made with shrimp and as someone with a shellfish allergy it should be something listed on the menu but unfortunately it was not mentioned. Thankfully I realized and was able to spit it out before I swallowed and avoided a hospital visit.

reviews.name: Michele Weston
reviews.text: One of the best UESide dim sum / Chinese up here! Yummy, delicious super soups as well!

title: Socarrat Paella Bar- Chelsea
address: 259 W 19th St, New York, NY 10011, United States

reviews.name: Kelsey D'Souza
reviews.text:
Squid ink paella was fantastic, good tartare, and they gave us homemade almond ice cream which was absolutely fantastic. Leisurely service and friendly waiters.

Edit: came back a second time with friends to try more paellas. Squid ink still best, but one with chicken and seafood was also great. We also got one which was kind of like hash browns instead of rice, not a huge fan but was still ok. Friends loved the croquettes, got two rounds. The octopus was great — one large piece cooked soft and tasty, with a center of mashed potato. Bacon wrapped figs were also yummy.

reviews.name: Niv Pai
reviews.text: Best paella in NYC!! Place is almost always packed so make a reservation before you go.

reviews.name: Bobby Douangkesone
reviews.text: This place is amazing. The food it great and the drinks are strong. The paella is fantastic. I'll be back here! The service is also in point.

reviews.name: stan yu
reviews.text: Friendly staff and great background music! We started off with two appetizers, shrimp and croquettes. Both are excellent starters. The croquettes were smooth and creamy inside. The paella is meant for two and it’s a big dish! We got the paella socarrat and it was loaded with seafood. Great crispy edges too.

reviews.name: Sonamchotiyankey Y
reviews.text: The bill was way off of our guesses but didn’t feel bad about paying the amount (ok, maybe a little!) since everything about the ambiance to the service to ofcourse the delicious food to our experience was a solid 5! This place definitely deserves it!

reviews.name: Michael Guzman
reviews.text: Paella is amazing. We had 3 different paella and just couldn't stop eating. 1 order can easily feed 4 people. Don't forget to order sangria. Deserts are good too, but small.

reviews.name: K E N N E C T E D
reviews.text:
Well established restaurant and bar.  This is the perfect place for a "date night".  Full of energy, but just shy of being loud.

Met some friends out and we ate at the bar.  They had the black paella and lots of drinks.  I arrived late so I just had the Calamares and a Strawberry Fields cocktail.  The staff was wonderful and super knowledgeable about more than just cocktails but the over history of the restaurant.

reviews.name: tyuiopp74
reviews.text: Great atmosphere. Their restroom was so clean and cozy. The food was not bad but a little bit expensive.

title: Balade
address: 208 1st Avenue, New York, NY 10009, United States

reviews.name: Yocheved Bat-Imedt
reviews.text:
Balade is one of My favorite places to eat. I have been going there for about 10 years. 

I am a Vegan. They have wonderful Lebanese vegan dishes and the dishes are authentically prepared. 

I have met the owner and know the staff by name. They always treat Me like a "Special Guest" or Family.

My Daughter who is a General Manager for a very large restaurant always gets an earful about Balade, because I am always bragging about the Restaurant and inviting Her to come by whenever She comes to New York.

Three years ago,  She surprised Me with a visit to New York City, where She planned a surprise Dinner party with all My Friends at Balade. This was such a Great Evening and Wonderful Birthday Celebration. Everyone enjoyed Themselves Sooooooo Much!

Balade-- What a GREAT RESTAURANT!!!

reviews.name: hope 212
reviews.text: I went there, and I like it for breakfast. The food was delicious,  😋 but the service was slow, and it’s pricey . Overall, I like it, and you should try it for breakfast 🍳

reviews.name: Anisha Dadia
reviews.text: Really great place. Good, accommodating service and excellent veg and non veg options. Portions are not huge so expect to be ordering multiple dishes.

reviews.name: Mohammed Alshamsi
reviews.text: Beautiful oriental restaurant, serving various Arabic dishes

reviews.name: Andrew Athanasiadis
reviews.text: Had the mixed meat platter and a manakeesh. Both were good in terms of taste but the platter was tiny for $30. Disappointing to say the least.

reviews.name: Bebe Andrukiewicz
reviews.text: Cozy atmosphere and some of the best food.

reviews.name: Kevin NYC
reviews.text: Ordered the $35 mixed grill via Uber Eats - portion was laughably miniscule, especially for the price.

reviews.name: shane nanji
reviews.text:
Food is delicious, the lamb is so rich and fresh as well as the chicken tawouk. I would definitely recommend this to anyone looking for some halal meat/chicken as it is a great filling option. 
We were staying in Times Square and got very tired of the food places around here so it was nice to find Balade which was something different and very clean and high quality food.

reviews.name: Karaoke Superstar
reviews.text: Friendly service, clean place and good portions. One of their dessert was described as 'smores with chocolate but it was just marshmallow with chocolate pudding, no graham crackers found. Fries were served at room temperature with some a little soggy, maybe I'm used to the fries being served hot or right after the frier.

reviews.name: JK Trader
reviews.text:
Traditional brunch place in NYC.
There are several different locations in NYC.

This upper west side location is cozy and less waiting time compare to others.

Most of Omellets are awesome and pancakes is okay.
But after happy meal, you gotta get a scary checks.

reviews.name: Devavrat K
reviews.text: The fluffy pancakes were REALLY fluffy and mildly sweet, which I like. Not overpowering the various elements on the dish. Maple syrup, fruits and butter were super fresh! Great for a Sunday brunch.

reviews.name: Diego Álvarez
reviews.text: Yami! I love eat there. And the cocktails are so so good.

reviews.name: Rafaela Mantelli
reviews.text:
