Over 50 min wait, even though was told the waiting time was 25min. Saw a party of two without reservation get seated before us.
Food service was fast and absolutely delicious. Had the lemon and ricotta pancakes, scrambled eggs with smoked salmon and side of fries. Perfect food, but YES it is pricey. We will maybe return.

reviews.name: Christine Rosenfeld
reviews.text:
ABSOLUTELY AMAZING! 
1st, service was friendly,  efficient and quick. Came in for brunch on New Years eve (mom's birthday) and our wonderful waiter Erick, gave her a free mimosa and cheesecake with candle. Now the food: classic Eggs Benedict was to die for.  Hollandaise sauce was light and perfectly balanced.  Goldie Lox; scrambled eggs with smoked salmon, were light and delicious.  And lastly the lemon ricotta pancakes were light and fluffy and perfect in every way.  We immediately made reservations for dinner... That's how impressed we are with this place! Loved it!

reviews.name: Joseph Molly Scroggins
reviews.text: Great atmosphere - very overpriced but oh well. Food is good, not great. Service is amazing. Space is loud and lively - call is casual high end.

reviews.name: The Original G
reviews.text:
Went last evening to Sarabeth's Kitchen based on reputation and past visits. Still after all these years it still does not disappoint. If you want relaxed environment and great comfort food this is your place.
The service very attentive sweet young waitress attended to us on this visit.
The desserts never disappoint. Jewel on the Upper West Side.

title: Legacy Records
address: 517 W 38th St, New York, NY 10018, United States

reviews.name: CN- Cyanide
reviews.text: Love the place, amazing food, very pricey but worth it, so make sure to come with a padded wallet.

reviews.name: Juan Miguel Gonzalez
reviews.text: Cool place and great food. The service is outstanding and they have a no tipping policy that I find interesting. No idea that there were places still trying this. Would most definitely go back.

reviews.name: Christine Yang
reviews.text: amazing service and even better food... get the fried chicken!

reviews.name: Carlo Fong Luy
reviews.text: Great dining experience! The ambiance was very nice - sharp and contemporary and not lacking in character. We went straight for the duck and ordered a pasta to share. Both were very good and especially enjoyed the combination of pistachio and sour cherries with the duck. Come for a special occasion especially for the duck which is $90 for 2-3 people.

reviews.name: Michael Johns
reviews.text:
I am not a huge fan of dimly lit places which is the only reason this place gets 4 stars. It is perfect for a date night out but still, not for me. The food however is fantastic with menu that changes often but they try to keep stable key dishes (chicken, fish, beef, etc). For starters, the group I was with wanted to share a few items. I had an oyster which was delicious, whipped ricotta served with a cracker (phenomenal) and prosciutto which was basic sliced meat. We also ordered the duck! That was some of the best duck I've ever tasted in.my.life! So tender and the consistency was like ahi tuna. Incredible.

For my meal I ordered the short rib. The short rib was so juicy and tender and a nice size chunk. When I first looked at the menu and photos, I wasnt to happy because I'm a "healthy" guy that likes to eat good size portions. If you play your cards right and order starters, the main dish size will not be an issue.

With dinner we also had wine. The wine list is pretty extensive so we asked for help choosing one and a gentleman who was very professional and took passion in his work (from what I could tell) asked us what we liked in our wine and he picked one for us. He picked perfectly to our palet.

Dessert was also great and we tried multiple items but the devil's food cake with chocolate ice cream was the winner by far. 

Enjoy!

reviews.name: George Junca
reviews.text: Great food and service and lively ambiance

reviews.name: Gerald Zecker
reviews.text: Great service and food but you're gonna pay for it. I felt a little betrayed when I saw they charged me 14 bucks for a 12oz tap beer. I'm no stranger to overpaying for drinks and meals in NYC, but that was a little ridiculous.

reviews.name: Marsha Newman
reviews.text: Very good Italian food and service. A fancy joint w nice decor too.

reviews.name: Jerry Masiello
reviews.text: I had the unique pleasure of attending the New York City Wine & Food Festival with my wife and daughter on October 12th.  Eat, drink and end hunger were the key ingredients and main theme.  The service, food and presentation were outstanding and the evening was totally awesome.  Tables of 10 were set throughout the facity and all the guests were foodies just like me and my family.  The food courses, paired with the appropriate wines, were fabulous and so unique.  I look forward to attending next year in support of "ending hunger" and enjoying a wonderful evening.   Part of the proceeds were donated to ending hunger.  The chefs were amazing and personable.  We had occasion to personally meet them and take photos with them.   Their food offerings were more than anyone can imagine and we thoroughly enjoyed the evening.

reviews.name: Headley Duncan
reviews.text: not a restaurant, not a place you simply eat and leave. Chefs Club is a temple the the upper echelon of culinary art. had the best meal of 2017 so far at a pri-fix dinner  for Eddie Huang.

reviews.name: Thibaut Fourment
reviews.text: Amazing experience with Sota Atsumi menu! Everything was perfect, especially the Pithiviers and the lobster sausage. Great service too thanks to our waiter, Aurelien! Definitely recommend this place!!

reviews.name: Keith Jackson
reviews.text: Good place for dinner with a variety of food. I liked the guest recipe/dish concept. Food was decent and the wine selection was great. Had a so so experience but upon notifying the manager she made it right without question. I'd go back.

reviews.name: John Yechan Chung
reviews.text: Took my wife for her birthday. It was her first birthday after our marriage so wanted to find somewhere special with great ambience. Reserved ahead of time to get the limited chef's table where you'll be seated close enough to see the chefs in action. As soon as we walked in, already enjoyed the atmosphere and the setup of the restaurant. It was a mix of fancy but also modern casual, loved it. Chef at this time was Paul Liebrandt. We both ordered the tasting menu, a bit pricey but worth the experience! After recommendation, my wife ordered the $24 cocktail called "The Marathon, nitro frozen drink". Loved it as we were invited over to the bar to see the making of the drink. I believe the drink is made using some sort of dry ice, pretty cool. Started off with Crab Doughnuts, very tasty. She then got her Kampachi, which I thought was coming out grilles but was actually sashimi. She absolutely loved it, only downside was that there was only 3 pieces haha. Also came out with some sort of soup with Caviar. I'm not a sea food person so I didn't like it but she loved it. I took the veal and hmm...I'm sure it's great, just not my style. Next, she got the Beautiful Cardinal Prawn, also 3 of them, very crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, delicious. I had the Sakura Pork and stuffed squid. Both were amazing, loved it. Dessert was the Avocado souffle and the Delice of Grand Gru Chocolate. All very interesting but tasty. Seemed like this Chef has his own mix and match with food because everything we had was different, interesting, and so so unique. Would recommend, make sure you check who's the chef that's there!

reviews.name: Jorge Tovar
reviews.text:
This is one of my favorite restaurants. I particularly love it when they have a visiting chef. This is when I typically tend to go. It will expose you to creative cuisines. The visiting chefs tend to do a mash up of cuisines and usually have a special dish reserved for their visit. 

A little pricey but definitely worth it. Some of the best food I have ever had. Check their website for their special events and make sure to follow their Instagram. 

I must admit that the last time I visited, the host asked us to leave our table because they had people waiting. I was really annoyed by this. Especially because this restaurant is supposed to be top class. This almost caused me to not want to come back. The food is too good and I will give them one more chance. 

You have been warned Chefs Club!

reviews.name: erika I
reviews.text:
This restaurant don’t reply my inquiry.
We can see a hospitality at the trivial things. It has a relationship with taste in my experiences. It’s no need to visit.

reviews.name: Daniel Kim
reviews.text: A lesson in indulgence. Rapid fire dining experience, food was good, but there was barely any breathing room between courses.

reviews.name: Eva Zhou
reviews.text: I ordered takeout yesterday, two orders for different members of my family. In one of the orders, we had specifically asked for no beef because of religious reasons. The man taking our order confirmed this and we delivered the meal to my aunt. She asked if there was beef and we told her no, that we confirmed it with the staff when placing the order in. This morning, my aunt sent me a picture to thank me for the food and I saw that there was beef in her meal. She didn't think it would be beef since we had confirmed this with her and thought it was other marinated meat and had eaten it. I really hope that after reading this review the staff of Cho Dang Gol will be more fastidious with their future orders & take restrictions seriously, religious or otherwise. Their carelessness violated my aunt's religious restriction but if this was a food allergy there might've been more grave consequences.

reviews.name: Woo Chun
reviews.text: dined outside, ordered makili(Korean drink), tasted like it gone really bad, the drink came open and not in its original bottle. really hated the experience here.

reviews.name: Cory Jameson
reviews.text: This spot offers wonderful service and delightful meals. The best spot in town. The meals served quick and the rates were fair. I recommend this place.

reviews.name: R Villegas
reviews.text: I come to this outstanding restaurant once a month  as I love the good mood that is unique to this place. The staff is awfuly loyal and well trained. The service is absolutely quick. Also, the food they cook is highly distinguished. I frequent many times and I was always satisfied. The pay is honest. I suggest this place to to everybody.

reviews.name: Priscilla Tai
reviews.text: Showed up at 5pm and waited about 10 minutes for a seat. The service was great, they didn't rush us to leave which lended for a great dining experience, and the food items were great comfort food. Would highly recommend!

reviews.name: Yahir Estrada
reviews.text: I sent my friends to this restaurant with my highest recommendations. I visit this restaurant often. This recommendation is always successful. The the food there is flavorable and the crew is attentive and cooperative. Every time  we eat in this place we enjoy a delightful evening.  I warmly recommend this restaurant.

reviews.name: Pat Ling
reviews.text: Great dinner here last night!   Authentic and delicious.  Definitely will come here again.  It has a great vibe and near Times Square.   Packed full by 6:15 pm.  Would have given a 5* but the waitress could have been friendlier or more helpful with suggestions.

reviews.name: James Cuffee
reviews.text: Awesome food, super nice employees, consistently  awesome character. They charge convenient prices and the food quality is very good. Fantastic work.

reviews.name: Jessica lea Butteriss
reviews.text: Excellent experience in Virgils. Exactly what you would expect from a BBQ house just off times square. Attentive and friendly staff. Big meals. Good range of local beers. Great relaxed atmosphere. Only the teeniest bit pricey for what the food is, although it’s in the heart of times square. Would recommend.

reviews.name: tom wolfe
reviews.text: boom!  great meal.  a little chainy.  My friends and I love it.

reviews.name: Ari K
reviews.text: I always stop by purchasing some food in here. I enjoy the efficient service and well cooked dishes. Highly recommended.

reviews.name: Ice Princess
reviews.text: Food and service were Great as always. They are really here for the customer! I love this place. I come every time I visit New York. My waitress Vanessa anticipated my every want which was so good. The atmosphere is always good. This place has never missed with me. Love it!

reviews.name: Natalie Hutchins
reviews.text: What a meal! We couldn't decide what to eat so we thought we'd get all of it. Chicken was very moist and juicy although I would say a tad lacking in flavour unless you got an extra charred bit. Pulled pork was super tasty and almost verged on sweet which was lovely. The rib is one of the best rib I've had and was a MASSIVE portion... But the brisket stole the show. Was juicy and had a great flavour to it. Two of us had trouble polishing it all off and could of taken some home. The Mac n Cheese was ok as was the biscuit. Drinks/cocktails are a tad on the pricey side but they do taste good. The service was top notch and has a great atmosphere. Would recommend if your coming to times Square it won't disappoint. Only reason it's got 4 out of 5 is those sides and I've had more amazing BBQ but around great place.

reviews.name: Olivia Hansen
reviews.text: This place has the tastiest, juiciest, most delicious ribs I've ever had. The  ribs do look burnt but that's just the rub they put on it. You can tell time and love goes into making these ribs! Glad I stopped here on my vacation! It was worth it.

reviews.name: TheHiddenKingdom
reviews.text: Seated right away, nice server and place. Prices were fair and I loved the hot towel.  Food was good for the most part, but I didn't care for the mac and cheese, and the gravy on my mashed potatoes was so gross. I know it's just gravy, but my gravy was almost solid and really cold. The cornbread was really good and I usually don't like cornbread.

reviews.name: Matthew Servis
reviews.text:
Clean facility, excellent service. Hot moist towel was presented to me at the end of the meal to clean up the BBQ face! The Brisket, with rice and beans were great! The corn bread had a nice delicate crunch on the outside, moist on the inside. 
Nice pour on the drinks, too!

reviews.name: Kimberly Peng
reviews.text: On paper, the dishes sound intriguing and exciting. Unfortunately, the delivery was mediocre. The bucatini was the most favorable dish, but not so great that I'd come back just to have it again.

reviews.name: Stacy Devino
reviews.text:
Great food at a reasonable price given the pedigree. 

The Endive salad was the best salad I have ever had and I have been craving it now! 

Standout was the Pork Chop even though the pastas were all done wonderfully.

reviews.name: Matan Dubnikov
reviews.text: Momofuku never ceases to amaze; this flagship especially! Comfortable ambience, incredibly friendly service, delicious italian inspired meals. Would highly recommend if ever down by W 22nd

reviews.name: Mercel Chambers
reviews.text: This place is better than fantastic. From the service, drinks, and best for last: the FOOD!  DO IT!!

reviews.name: Raluca Monet
reviews.text: Good but not blown away. I enjoyed the day special recommended by our server which did not disappoint. Everything else was good but not outstanding given I came in with pretty high expectations. This place is decorated in a minimalist style, so good for a work lunch, but I would not take a date here.

reviews.name: MP
reviews.text: Nice service and ambience.  Appetizers very good but the pasta pepper and cheese was no way as good as the typical true Italian version.

reviews.name: Pablo Trigo Mouriño
reviews.text: The pasta is good to okay without being impressive, the endive starter on the other hand is worth the visit on its own.

reviews.name: A Shen
reviews.text: A decent Italian-ish restaurant for dinner. The RED ENDIVE is refreshing and easy to share. My preferred main was the BUCATINI, better than the Tagliatelle, Hake, and Trout. The BURRATA is decent but some with no bread and a lot of fennel. The beer on tap was good as well, but only 3 options.

title: Max
address: 134 W Broadway, New York, NY 10013, United States

reviews.name: Jeff Miller
reviews.text: Max's family recipes continue to deliver through the years with excellent attention to detail and friendly service from his wonderful family.

reviews.name: Evan T
reviews.text: The best lasagna with bechemel and a little nutmeg

reviews.name: Kelley Smith
reviews.text:
Food was great! Got an eggplant app and two entries to split - lasagna and pollo al Limon, both were fantastic! We left so full!!!

Note to others - your party must be fully present to seat you, so my guest waited at the bar which was fine, but then when we wanted to be seated, the hostess assumed we were okay staying at the bar, which is fine, but I'd wished it wasn't presented as "do you just want to stay at the bar?" rather maybe, "we have a table ready for you unless you'd prefer the bar?" I felt obligated to stay at the bar. Then, when our meal was over, we asked that the Alcohal be put on a separate check than the food but the bar tender said it was our fault he couldn't do that because we didn't tell him earlier on in the night. Well, sorry sir, we didn't know we'd be eating at the bar when we arrived. Also, we were asked NUMEROUS times if we were done with our food, while we were still eating as though they were trying to clear our plates and rush us out.

Overall, great food, we left super full. But, I gave this place a 4 because of it's service.

reviews.name: Luigi J.
reviews.text: Great ambiance, best pizza ever, warm service.

reviews.name: John LaBarre
reviews.text: One of the best meals around (especially for the cost?)

reviews.name: Robert Neuhardt
reviews.text: Delicious food, gracious service

reviews.name: Erica Davis
reviews.text: Amazing food, really enjoyed. Sets a high standard.

reviews.name: Erinn Wheat
reviews.text: I really liked this place . Food was great . Friendly atmosphere . Staff were very pleasant . I ordered the burger was so big i never eat again . Amazing interior .

reviews.name: L Kennedy
reviews.text: This is a great burgers and fries place with excellent milkshakes.  Unfortunately, the rest of the menu is pretty weak.   Still a good standby if your looking for someplace quick.

reviews.name: Yori Raita
reviews.text:
Soho Park - Prince St. location.

I went to Soho Park for a Saturday brunch with my sister and mother at their Prince St. location.  There’s outside seating along the outside, as well as an area for patio seating. We arrived about 11am, and the place was empty –saved for a couple of diners. The inside ambiance is lovely and bright set against its industrial decor, soften with greenery throughout. 

The brunch menu is not overbearing with options, which is nice. Sometimes too many options on a menu can be bit fussy. My sister and I both got the Traditional American Breakfast, while our mother went for the Buttermilk Pancakes and a vanilla latte. Originally, she wanted the lumberjack but opt for the pancakes when they wanted to charged $7 dollars to substitute the Belgian waffle to pancakes. A bit asinine- I mean they both come from a batter. 

I had one issue with my dish when it came out; as I requested my eggs to be over easy it came out just about well done. They redid my eggs, though over easy, it still was over done on the edges. Their home fries were spot on.  Also my dish went back with two pieces of toast and returned with one. The bacon was nice and crispy but that too, I can tell was just a second away from being burnt. They must like cooking on just one level of heat- high heat!  My sister and mother had scrambled eggs; they were happy with it. Where Soho Park fell short with the eggs they made up for it with the buttermilk pancakes. Absolutely delicious!   

The customer service is lukewarm. As the morning transitioned to midday, more diners started to filter in. I will definitely return to dine here again, as it was a satisfying experience. Love the low key feels, the attractive price point of their dishes, and the straightforwardness of the menu.

reviews.name: T III
reviews.text: If u love burgers, and R in Soho, come here! What a great place! Didn’t realize it was counter service but they have a very attentive staff, outdoor seating and outstanding food. Fun, light, uplifting place to eat n drink. Outstanding burger!

reviews.name: Claire Harris
reviews.text: We were walking around Soho, and saw this place. We couldn’t help be attracted to the folding open doors, outdoor seating, and casual, inviting vibe. Well we went in and had a delicious lunch, along with great margaritas. Really nice pit stop in Soho!

reviews.name: Darnay Banks
reviews.text: Found this gem and we were so happy. Got a table immediately and food served very promptly. Our server was very sweet and attentive. Pretty environment and very good prices. Would gladly come back when we are in the area.

reviews.name: Lydia Bendall
reviews.text: Excellent service, cozy/romantic garden aesthetic, and delicious food. This place is worth trying. I found my eyes wandering a lot to check out all the design quirks around the room. Park bench banquettes, shiny car hub caps behind ivy on the brick walls, lights twinkling on the indoor trees. Will come back again.

reviews.name: Daniel Jordan
reviews.text: One of the most over priced burgers I've had.   It was ok, but not worth $11.81. If you want fries add another $6.00.  A soft drink? Another $4. As for the burger, it was very small and over cooked to the point of being exceptionally dry. Based on prices and the burger this place is 2 stars. However the atmosphere is nice. Open air and outdoor on nice days. A reasonable variety for a group.  Basically, if you're out for a day with friends and you want reasonable quality, good selection and good atmosphere, it's the best choice in the area. Just go in expecting to pay to much and get small portions.

reviews.name: Cari Dunne
reviews.text: The food was amazing, the prices were low, and the environment was beautiful. If you're looking for some great burgers, this is definitely the place to go to!

title: Rainbow Room
address: 30 Rockefeller Plaza, 65th Floor, New York, NY 10112, United States

reviews.name: Jane Liminik
reviews.text: Breathtaking....mouthwatering... memories for life!Top notch place for brunch with a view to die for...Eggs Benedict was mind blowing...A worthy life time experience ❤

reviews.name: Dianita de la cruz
reviews.text: Loved this place because you can enter for free and have almost the same views you would have from the top of the rock observatory. The drinks are kind of expensive but it is cheaper than to buy a ticket to enter the observatory. The only bad thing is that there are no chairs so you have to stand all night. If you want to seat and eat you should reserve a table that are around and close to the windows so you get a better view. Not sure if you have to pay for reservation though.

reviews.name: Rye M3
reviews.text: Wow, food here was weak at best and service was lousy. Ordered risotto, no grated cheese to go with it. Cheese finally comes and none for my partner. Didn't even offer us drinks! Dessert should have been interesting, but just tasted weird. (Called a banana split I believe). Of course the place is member only, so as a business you have access, but you really don't want to bring clients here.

reviews.name: Susan Zurick
reviews.text: Actually had drinks and appies at Bar 65. Very nice views of the city all around. Nice drinks, not so expensive but we skipped dinner altogether .

reviews.name: Justice AgainstWeintraub
reviews.text: Very nice venue. Wonderful views of the city and a relaxed vibe. I highly recommend this place! It can get quite packed so I recommend reserving a table in advance.

reviews.name: Alon Andrews
reviews.text: We highly recommend Rainbow Room! This place exceeded out expectations! Not only is the chapel pristine, but the attention and caring disposition from all the staff here made our special day EXTRAORDINARILY.  We were all grieving my mother's passing, they ensured that they acknowledged and included my parent's memory in the ceremony. We had family watching the wedding through the live feed, family that couldn't attend. Their prices are extremely affordable for the quality and attention to detail that you receive. More importantly, they will to anything and everything so that your wedding day is more than you expect. I am so glad we found this chapel, and I guarantee you will not find any other chapel that can come close to its beauty.  We wouldn't trust our wedding day to anyone else, memories that will last a lifetime.

reviews.name: Lick That Plate
reviews.text: We had the best burger ever! For 65$ 🍔: Clash of the Titans Burger Grilled Maine Lobster, Truffle Cheese, Cabernet-Braised Short Rib, Champagne Hollandaise, House-Cured Maple Bourbon Bacon, 8 oz.  Chef's Blend of Short Rib, Skirt Steak, Chuck, Aged NY Strip, Triple-Cooked Fries 😋 +stunning views on Central Park and Manhattan 🏙 👉 top of the rock 👉Rockefeller center

reviews.name: Simon W
reviews.text: This remains one of my favourite restaurants globally. The service and food is amazing, not to mention the views.

reviews.name: priyanka pria
reviews.text: Great place for indian food. Good service

reviews.name: Ted Throckmorton
reviews.text: While waiting in the foyer of Utsav, a very dark chamber our curiosity about the restaurant  where we'd made reservations aroused our curiosity almost as much as our appetites. We were not prepared for the view of the dining room with its large glass windows reflecting the lights in the trees outside. We ordered our appetizers and dinners and were once again happily surprised with the many flavors we were presented with but the professional waitstaff. We'd definitely return, my mouth waters with anticipation thinking about it.

reviews.name: Simranjeet Singh
reviews.text: Delicious appetizers, tandoori chicken is out of the park. One of the best in NYC for sure.

reviews.name: Esther Pena
reviews.text: Love this place so far, I've been here twice before. They have super good Indian food and a nice ambience. The decorations are pretty as well. Loved the califlower dish and the three lentil soap last time I was here. Also, the staff was very friendly. Only concern was my seabass which was slightly disappointing.I didn't particularly like the batter used since it made the fish taste cheap almost like fish sticks

reviews.name: Kurt Daisley
reviews.text: This is my go-to Indian restaurant! The ambiance is peaceful, the staff is wonderful, and the food is amazing! They have a wonderful space in that plaza between 47th and 46th street, just east of Times Square. Huge windows on the north and south sides of the restaurant results in the window seats always being reserved. The staff really does a good job at bring Indian hospitality and good, gracious manners to midtown Manhattan. I take all my friends there, and I often eat there alone. Here's to Utsav! In the volatility that is the restaurant business in New York City, I'm hoping that they remain in business for many years to come.

reviews.name: Rahul Joshi
reviews.text: Hosted a birthday party here and it was great. Nandita and her team helped us throughout the process, accommodating where possible. The food was incredible, both appetizers and main course. Lot of our guest complimented on it as well. The venue was perfect overall. Would definitely host another event in the future.

reviews.name: sarita shinde
reviews.text: It’s a nice restaurant, with a few hits and misses. The apps Veg Seekh Kebab and the Butter Chicken Kulcha though something new, was far from impressive. The portions were small plates sized and left is surprised. Also tried the Bhuna Mutton which was really well cooked was the best dish at the table. There was a paneer chilly gravy we tried which was nice and different. The bVeg Biryani though didn’t look the most interesting was really flavourful and a must try.

reviews.name: Subala J K
reviews.text: Great food ! Very friendly staff and amazing service. Very pleasant ambience onspitw of the crowd on Friday night. They have an eye for the little details and make it a point to go one step further than required to make it a pleasant dining experience. One plate of samosas consisted of 3 samosas but since we were two of us at the table, they made it 4 samosas on their own. Such small gestures go a long way !

title: Serafina Broadway
address: 210 W 55th St, New York, NY 10019, United States

reviews.name: Marsela Beshiri
reviews.text: Best black truffle ravioli you will ever have in your life. The wine list is great. I absolutely enjoyed dinner with my friends at this place. Will definitely return in the near future.

reviews.name: Lisa Lotus
reviews.text:
We stayed at the Dream hotel & they had a special with the NYC marathon runners for a free pasta the night before the race which was really thoughtful. However the restaurant was not prepared at all for the influx of these orders. All of the runners were all getting the same options so I'm not sure why it wasn't able to be ready to go or gave large batches (this could just be my ignorance).  We placed an order for pick up and I paid for my meal since my husband ran the marathon and I didn't.  I ordered the other free pasta option because I thought it would be easier that way. 

They told us to come back in thirty minutes for pickup so we went back around forty minutes later. When I got down there it wasn't ready and the bartender (who is over to go) wasn't able to give me an ETA of when the expect it.  

I left and had a drink somewhere else before coming back. We finally got our food and the serving size was not filling at all. My husband and I both agreed even if we had a voucher we wouldn't go back. We ended up getting food somewhere else after. I had better service and a better deal at the 99¢ pizza place across the street.

reviews.name: Zeynep Tinaz Redmont
reviews.text: This is a good price value restaurant in mid town. I would think it is better at lunch time in terms of the volume of music. It has this semi nightclub/ discotheque ambiance. Although the music is quite good, it is too loud to my taste. The food is fairly ok. I think they need to revisit their olive oil as it looks like it has the right color the acid level is so high you can choke on it. In any case , a high quality olive oil would never be served in such abundance with a fat big bottle. Service is fast.

reviews.name: Cerrill Meister
reviews.text: It was good enough I guess. Servers were pleasant.  Food was adequate. I thought over priced for what you get.

reviews.name: Vivian Ortiz
reviews.text: Amazing food!! Cane here for my birthday and this place was the right setting for the occasion. Service was great and prompt, drinks was on the money and the food!!! Omg!!! Totally recommend!

reviews.name: Eana Kim
reviews.text: The food was ok, but the service can improve more. I prefer other serafina branches more than this one.

reviews.name: Joe Kunkel
reviews.text: Gotta say. It's a great place for Italian and it has a very nice bar and wine list. Service is amazing / such nice people. Definitely recommend.

reviews.name: Cassy Ralat
reviews.text: This was our second visit during our short trip to NYC.  Both times the food was excellent,  and the service was very nice.  Highly recommended! Will definitely come back!

reviews.name: Laura Peruchi
reviews.text: The pasta tasting is just amazing. Fresh pasta, as we expect from an Italian restaurant. If you can, have the wine pairing as well. Great place for a date, anniversary or so on.

reviews.name: Jarrod Brown
reviews.text:
At Lupa they do a great job of bringing a genuine mix of Roman flavors to New York with a menu that highlights the freshest ingredients cooked in accordance to Roman standards. I stopped in one afternoon to try their lunch menu which at $25 is great value compared to other restaurants in NYC. 

I sat outside on the small terrace to enjoy the sunny and comfortably warm day, taking in the relaxing atmosphere while I drip my fluffy focaccia in some extra virgin olive oil. Before the food arrived I needed a drink and went with the Sassi Sour made with Four Roses Bourbon, mint, lemon and Lucano Amaro which really added the experience.

A plate of sardines, pork shoulder and beets was a very satisfying start to the lunch menu, as colourful as they were flavourful. For the main I just had to go with the  bavette Cacio e Pepe, one forkful and I was transported back to Rome, the pasta cooked to perfection. To go with this dish I chose the Fellini cocktail made with Giffard apricot liquer, Berta Amaro, lime and prosecco, a sweet balance to the peppery pasta.

For dessert, I was delighted to have the Lupa Tartufo with its rich chocolaty textures and cool ice cream center was the best ending to my Roman lunch, really look forward to going back!

reviews.name: Lee C
reviews.text: A wonderful dinning experience to include delicious food, great service by Lyndie and management attentiveness by Nancy who made right with our gift  card. The restaurant was packed by 6p over the holidays. I will return!

reviews.name: Darrell Rubens
reviews.text: Solid!!! Best pasta and wines every time.

reviews.name: Ehud Persitz
reviews.text: Delicious! Had a casual dinner on the bar with a friend. Both pastas were superb and perfectly cooked. Fine dining in a relatively affordable price.

reviews.name: Anastasia Shipilova
reviews.text: The best prosciutto in NYC! Highly recommend pasta with cheese and pepper and gnocchi with sausage. Didn’t really like broccoli and pasta with clams. Great wine selection!

reviews.name: Rico van de Pol
reviews.text:
Great food. Waiters know what they're talking about, and if not sure they're honest and check it for you. 
Portions are a little bit too big maybe.

reviews.name: Karen Ng
reviews.text: Amazing from start to finish! I find the pasta tasting menu a bit too overwhelming and repetitive but the very kind staff helped us design a selection of pasta and meat dishes to cater for our appetite, 100% recommend!

reviews.name: scott Laine
reviews.text: Having dined at The Fulton twice now (once inside, once outside) I can genuinely say it’s the best seafood restaurant in New York City today. The staff are thoughtful, energetic and a wonderful expression of how service can be super buttoned up while remaining casual and informal. The food is nothing short of exceptional with creative seasonal dishes that are both locally sourced but also exquisite. I cannot stress enough why you should be booking a table immediately. I was there last night and I am already making another reservation. I had the soft shell crab (tail end of the season but still fab) and the seafood stew. Also at our table was sea bass, crudo, tartar and of course wine. Previously I had the fish and chips which was awesome. Go go go..why are you still reading!? Make reservation and see for yourself.

reviews.name: Kathy D
reviews.text: Spectacular view.  Beautiful restaurant and great food.  If you can get it sit on the second floor. The view can’t be matched. The seafood is delicious. The sword fish is lightly crusted and moist. Shrimp are flavorful. Nothing but good things to say.

reviews.name: Casey Maher
reviews.text: One of the best meals I’ve had in a quite a while. I absolutely love seafood, and if you do to this place is for you. An absolutely spectacular room with views of both bridges and the water. Lovely and cozy warm lighting and a super friendly and cool waitstaff. The lobster dish, which comes with a hefty price tag, is so well worth it and delicious it blew my mind. Just go!

reviews.name: Thea Cripps
reviews.text: My husband took me here for birthday dinner, and we enjoyed the meal start to finish! Highly recommend ordering several plates to share. The best dishes of our meal were the octopus appetizer with mozzarella and lemon (an unexpected but totally yummy combination) and the Gruyere cheeseburger, which is rich and made to share. Wait staff was very attentive. There was a super loud group directly behind us and it was slightly annoying to be sat next to them in a mainly empty dining room (we got there very early). I wished for a view of the bridges but we didn't quite get it -- we did get a window seat over the river though. These are small quibbles; overall, we loved it and will be going back to try the Whole Black Sea Bass en Croute with a larger group!

reviews.name: Bryan Verona
reviews.text:
Found!
 The South Street Seaport has successfully brought big name restaurants in as tenants. The question is will it be sufficient to be a destination in a city full of options. This spot was (predictably) good and stylishly designed. The location and view of the East River and related bridges are amazing.
For more great reviews visit TheLoupe!

reviews.name: Erin Regit
reviews.text: Jean-Georges does it again! The seaport has been waiting for The Fulton.  Positioned at the end of pier 17 (complete with concert venue above, sponsored by Heineken) surrounded by the river and view of the Brooklyn bridge.  You cannot even see the boardwalk from the second floor, lending to lofty elegance.  The service is beyond friendly and completely detail oriented, to ensure the best experience.  The bar staff is poised at the ready and concocts the most beautiful cocktails! The food does not disappoint with an amazing raw bar,  including oysters, ceviches and tartars.   Obviously a seafood heavy menu,  there is a to die for burger (and fries!!!) or chicken — for those willing to miss out on these amazingly fresh dishes.  Not to mention a whole Black Sea bass!!  Can’t wait to come back and try the  “simply cooked” menu served with a bean vinaigrette.  The seaport needed a nice restaurant - and here it is with a view!   Save room for dessert xo

reviews.name: Frank Massaro
reviews.text:
The Fulton is a solid restaurant with great views. I have been here twice and had the fish tacos and the crab roll, both were prepared nicely.

The views are the real seller here. The Fulton is located at the back of the new seaport structure and it has wonderful views of the passing boats and Brooklyn bridge. I will say the menu is quite pricey but once you factor in the views it all evens out. A wonderful experience, that I will likely partake in again soon.

reviews.name: Christopher Arellanes
reviews.text: Decent restaurant with a beautiful view. Would recommend it. Food was tasty, service was okay.

title: The Counter - Temporarily Closed
address: Times Square Tower, New York, NY 10036

reviews.name: Andi Wer
reviews.text:
Create pieces of (very tasty) art! 

You’re missing out if you don’t eat here. High quality food, great concept, warm, professional and friendly staff. Located in the middle of everything (Times Square), at “The Counter” you create your meal in seven steps. 

I went for the Impossible Meat on lettuce, with Swiss cheese and roasted ananas. I kid you not, this ranks in my top ten of great meals I’ve ever eaten. 

Should you arrive when there’s some time to wait, then wait.

reviews.name: Benja Calviño
reviews.text: A lovely place, we had to wait but it was tolerable. Very yummy burger but the fries were toooo thin, i prefer the sweet potatoes that are thicker than the fries. Is the only thing I would change about the food. But the waitress were super nice with us. You have to go! It’s delicious!

reviews.name: Jonathan Cruz
reviews.text: Best beyond burger and fries in the city. If you know a better place let me know.

reviews.name: Alvin Viswas
reviews.text:
Highly customisable make your own burgers and a good selection of in-house burgers. Everything was fresh and well cooked. 

But from what my friends tell me the portion size has gone down considerably. On the plus side the staff was very friendly.

reviews.name: A Sandoval
reviews.text:
Burgers were delicious and savory. 
Love the build it yourself Burger list. Ranges from Beef to Veggie..
The Spiked Shakes are a Must!
Must go back for happy hour to try to drinks.

reviews.name: Dawn Ferguson
reviews.text:
It started with a warm welcome and ended badly. Katie our server was very friendly to my husband and I. Our order was simple, burgers, one with and one without cheese. Both arrived with cheese. They took my husband's away, Katie feigned ignorance and kept her distance. I finished my burger and sides had been eaten and still no sign of my husband's burger. He approached a server and asked her to cancel the burger. A reluctant apology was given, no discount, no complimentary drink.
Definitely would not go back or recommend. Other diners were complaining of lengthy wait. So many other super places to eat. Give The Counter a miss!

reviews.name: Rayan Gazlye
reviews.text: Hands down! I’m not a big fan of burgers but this place is definitely the best I’ve had in a while . Amazing staff and the place is really comfortable. Great job, I’m from Montreal so I’m  happy that I found this place here. Good job 💪🏻

reviews.name: jummy
reviews.text: They have such great staff here!! Everyone is so nice and helpful. Our waiter was Shannon and he was so nice! The food is great. I was surprised to learn they have a happy hour and it's a varied enough happy hour menu. A little bit of something for everyone and the do not skimp on the alcohol!! That Rum Punch will knock you out of you aren't a drinker.  Lay you on the floor. I recommend the mini cheeseburgers and they have a tasty veggie burger on their regular menu. Highly recommend it here. Only downer was the manager we encountered when we came in yesterday for lunch. Staff was extremely nice but she was only courteous to certain ppl. But all in all great place, atmosphere and bang for your buck.

reviews.name: Paul Ker
reviews.text:
Great food, quick service! 
Quick tips: This place gets crowded and runs out of seats quickly, call ahead and pick up OR eat your food and free up a table! (Please)
They serve beer if that’s your thing and also make great milkshakes. You get a ton of fries (enough for 2 to share)
Also, don’t forget to tip the staff, it’s crowded back there and they work as fast as possible.

reviews.name: Amy Brown
reviews.text: A fun place that not everyone knows about but yet everyone does know about. The burger and fries were good. The line went fast. But we had a group of 8 and it is not a place for large groups. We were lucky to get a spot.

reviews.name: DBorreliWHAT
reviews.text: Went on a Thursday around 6pm and the line moved really quickly. I live in NY but still like to do touristy things every now and then so when I read about Burger joint I thought, lets do it!. 2 cheeseburgers with 1 order of fries and a milkshake was about $35. The burger did not have any taste and a plain vanilla milkshake for 9.50 is not something I want to experience again. The place itself had a nice vibe with because it feels like your little secret after school burger joint but, I would not go again due to the lack of taste in everything we had.

reviews.name: Irazú ViCe
reviews.text: I love the concept of a clandestine place. Hamburger is delicious but I doesn't have chicken hamburger. Fries are well serve 😍 and there are different drinks so you can choose between soda, beer or shakes

reviews.name: Théo Tordjman
reviews.text: This place is amazing, we ate some amazing burgers and really apreciate the staff and the vibes ! We will be back !

reviews.name: Fady Kerko
reviews.text: A hidden spot in the Parker hotel. The burger was good but nothing different than any ordinary burger. Aside from the burger,  the staff was taking a very long time to expedite the line which made the experience not worth the wait or the price. They do have menus in different languages so while you wait in line you can decide your order. It's really meant for tourist more than anything. Although the joint is really tiny and the wait time is long, if you can find a seat, you might enjoy the set up.

reviews.name: nup nal
reviews.text:
Burgers lived up to their reputation. Reasonable price. Beers were good too! 
Can get a little too busy in the dining area, but that's a good thing if you like a little buzz.

Recommend this place 👍
I would visit again!

reviews.name: Francisco Tomás Franco
reviews.text: I waited 40 minutes and then I expected to eat the best burger in my whole life. And I did. Highly recommended, but due to the size of the restaurant you should be prepared to wait in long lines. The flavor of the burger is something different to any burger that I ever tasted before. If you are a burger fan like me you simply cannot miss the chance to eat in this place

reviews.name: Maria Park
reviews.text: We dined in JoJo for Christmas Eve. We had a lot of fun and we enjoyed the food very much. It’s the little things that made our dining experience superb. The service is attentive. Our glasses were always filled with water, our waiter checked on us all the time. Must try Wagyu beef - was tendered and perfectly cooked. The peach crumble dessert was delicious. So yummy! We will definitely go back.

reviews.name: Chris Cook
reviews.text: Jean-Georges' never fail to impress. This was a great meal, with attentive service. Bravo!

reviews.name: Joanna Sable
reviews.text:
What can you say about a JGV restaurant other than from the minute you walk in the door it is sheer perfection. The room is small but there is an upstairs. Service is perfect and everyone is accommodating. The food is so on point. So delightful and delicious. This is a must eat at, lovely to sit and unwind and without a doubt a great place. 
I did the best I could with photos in a dark room. Apologies. 
Please follow @joannasable on instagram for more food and travel fun.

reviews.name: Sandra Collins
reviews.text: When it comes to taste beyond perfection JoJo is the place to go!

reviews.name: A. K.
reviews.text: Loved the atmosphere, the service, interior, etc. However, our dishes were very salty. We had heard that the dishes are salty so we even asked for less salt when cooking, but it was still salty... I am going to go back for brunch and see if it was a one time happening.

reviews.name: Ruizhe Yang
reviews.text:
Been here several times. Small and cozy place. Was surprised to get a table for Friday dinner time without a reservation.

Tried scallop appetizer, absolutely delicious. Had duck and grilled seabass for main dishes, both are great.

Overall very good experience. Will come back.

reviews.name: Craig Jack
reviews.text: Loved this place food is great Manager Andrea and server Natasha were excellent this is a must go

reviews.name: Vye
reviews.text: Lovey time! For dinner I would recommend the Faroe Island Salmon, Chili-pumpkin Seed Broth roasted Delicate Squash. Although the portion seemed small. It filled me up.

title: Butcher and Banker NYC
locatedIn: The New Yorker, A Wyndham Hotel

reviews.name: Shajib Azad
reviews.text: A hidden gem in the mid town area. Its located inside the New Yorker hotel in the basement of what used to be a bank vault complete with the impressively large vault doors. Great cocktails in the mid to pricey range. No Happy Hour here. Had a friend do his birthday dinner here and the food was above average. It never gets super busy or noisy. A good spot to get after work drinks with friends or a date spot.

reviews.name: J V
reviews.text: The ambience is amazing it just feels good in there, the food is almost as good as the interior. However I go for the craft cocktails which are fantastic.

reviews.name: j. gill
reviews.text:
We ate ....  inside 👏 a 👏 bank 👏 vault 👌  it was awesome!  The service was excellent,  the food was great (I'm no foodie, but I love a good steak and this was one of them), and the whole thing really worked. It's in the subterranean vault of the art-deco New Yorker hotel, and you could totally miss it if you didn't know what you were looking for. The period theme is flawlessly carried on I to the restaurant.

 The prices are Manhattan steakhouse and the place is not huge.  Being right across the street from Penn Station means it's in a kind of no-man's land, but it's easy to get to.

Cool place for a business dinner, will definitely want to go back and check out some post-prohibition cocktails at the bar.

reviews.name: Tim
reviews.text:
I had high expectations but everything was uniformly mediocre.  For the price (nearly $400 for two with drinks), it’s not worth it.  If you find this recipe helpful, please give a thumbs-up :)

First the vibe - interesting mix of vault door and eclectic decorating.  Dim lighting for a more intimate mood pulls it off pretty well.  Note: you have to go into the hotel and take an elevator up to the restaurant.  

The service was ok, but not up to the standards of other similarly priced places - silverware dropped, reaching in front of diners faces, leaving crumbs all over the table, missed check-in after serving food.  Again, the service didn’t have any major problems, it just didn’t rise to the level of a $400 dinner for two.  

Same with the food.  ‘Not bad’ is the best I can come up with.  Little things the the calamari/shrimp/pepper app not having any shrimp in it (and the waiter insisting we just didn’t see them) to the apple crumble actually being a small apple pie.  The lobster bisque has a great flavor but is extremely salty, while the rest of the food (steak, mac n cheese, etc) was lacking seasoning in general.  The delmonico I had definitely had a smoked flavor but that’s where it stopped.  

Presentation was good and they aren’t being cheap with ingredients or anything ... it’s just that they need some (a lot) of polish for their desired clientele.

reviews.name: V T
reviews.text: Delicous steaks (with spices which is not always the case). Delicious sides. Big portions. Nice staff. Very quick service. Beautiful decor. Had a great time, 100% will come back

reviews.name: Stephen Serrao
reviews.text: A great dining experience from start to finish. Attentive waiters, even better food (try the thick cut bacon and ribsteak with Johnnie Walker butter) along with a one-of-a-kind ambiance. Gives any great NYC steakhouse establishment you have in mind a run for its money. Excellent!

reviews.name: Marvin Martian
reviews.text: The perfect steakeasy... Had dinner in the vault. Such an amazing experience!

reviews.name: Cameron Schettler
reviews.text: Fantastic service and delicious steak!

reviews.name: amelie provosty
reviews.text:
Over all not impressed. The cocktails didn't leave anyone wanting another one. The cheese board felt like someone went to Aldi, grabbed some lunch meats and cheeses and threw the on the cutting board - not curated or thoughtful. The mussels were pretty boring (where's my delicious broth yo!?) 
Overall very disappointed and I had SUCH high hopes from other reviews.

reviews.name: Nina Jovanovic
reviews.text: Food was amazing! I went to Boucherie West Willage but this one have totally different energy! One of my favourite places!

reviews.name: Boban Petrovic
reviews.text: Amazing place for social distancing and delicious food and drinks. Service is amazing and on time with everything!!

reviews.name: Alex Ivanov
reviews.text: First place I went to after outdoor dining opened in New York. They had great carriers up and the side street feel was very Paris. Would definitely recommend this place including their sister restaurants.

reviews.name: Mehera Berns
reviews.text: Went here for breakfast and thouroughly enjoyed the atmosphere, service, and food. Our waiter was exceptionally accommodating, and the food was good enough to earn clean plates all around. The breakfast menu only has a few options, but they all seem like good choices. (It is worth mentioning, however, that the vegetarian among you is pretty much limited to fruit and granola.)

reviews.name: Andreas Apostolopoulos
reviews.text: Cute and romantic ambiance and absolutely delicious food. I'm talking lick your plate good! Amazing service!! Must go!!!👌👌

reviews.name: Gavin Nardocchio-Jones
reviews.text: Our first dining out since mid March and worth every penny. Wind protected and enjoyable side street in eclectic neighbourhood. Food and wine well priced for quality, if a little under-seasoned. Friendly Franco and Latina staff (Diana and Yasmine) normalised the covid times and ensured great experience - á refaire! Merci

reviews.name: Oktay Atakan
reviews.text: Amazing  place, delicious food! Manager Alex was very kind and professional. I will definetly be back with more friends.

reviews.name: Cukie The Foodie
reviews.text: Came here a few times, its a Classy and spacious place, with friendly staff (Conner the bartender, Chelsey and Wendy the hostesses they were all nice and attentive). Large tv perfect for watching games. I had the “Chicken dinner”, grilled chicken and mashed potatoes, simple but very tasty

reviews.name: Danielle Maslin
reviews.text: Came here for lunch and the food was great! We had the brunch.

reviews.name: Brook Horton
reviews.text: Excellent food and service!

reviews.name: pascale guilliod
reviews.text: Superb ambiance. Great food selection. Great service. Casual chic. The prices are not crazy and it's a really nice place. The decor is modern. I would go again in a heartbeat. I opted for the grilled  shrimp and scallop in this Thai curry coconut Wonder sauce  over quinoa , with a mint cilantro medley. I also had a delicious jalapeno margarita. I'm still thinking about those lol. For dessert we opted for the mini chocolate fondue. Perfect for two people. My picture is a little dark but you get the idea :-)

reviews.name: Wally Anglesea
reviews.text:
Had a great breakfast here
 Eggs Benedict with smoked salmon.  This place is in a great location, reasonably priced,and a nice change from the crowded breakfast we were having. Generous servings, and a nice big pot of tea for two of us kept us going. Service was also quick and very good.

reviews.name: Peter Gold
reviews.text: Very solid food & drinks from a great staff of Irish barmen.

reviews.name: Julie Phillips
reviews.text: Lively bar to sit and watch sports or connect with friends.  It does get quite loud on occasions but that adds to the excitement of the place.  Food is good, and they have excellent servers!

reviews.name: Neha Sirohi
reviews.text: First, let me start off by saying this review is in no way a reflection of the food quality itself. My husband and 2 friends dined here approximately 115 minutes before a show at Madison Square Garden. We made it very clear to our waitstaff that we needed to be out by a certain time to receive our food. Our waiters were clearly very busy and worked hard however the restaurant seems understaffed and the service is unfortunately very slow. It took forever to get our entrees and we felt very rushed to finish before leaving for our show. Sadly, this takes away the entire experience particularly since our food and drink were all delicious.

reviews.name: Carmen Lucia Leite
reviews.text: The BEST‼ Everything is FABULOUS I know them since 1970's

reviews.name: priyanka pria
reviews.text: Great food. Good service

reviews.name: Tyisha Shaia
reviews.text: I’ve been living in the city for 8 yrs and I have yet to find better falafel, not only in the city but in the world... Idk why I love it so much but the flavor is just perfect. Smaller, crispy falafel balls and the hummus is incredible. Also the hot sauce is to die for!!! I would chug that stuff if it wouldn’t give me an ulcer. 😂

reviews.name: Hamid Gujjar
reviews.text: Amazing food. You must try it if you’re in town. The lime was out the freaking door and I was skeptical on how long it will take to get served. But to my surprise I was hardly in line for 15 minutes. I walked up to the counter placed my order and I was out the door with my order in less then 15 minutes. It’s a very small crowded place. Only 4-5 people can sit and eat inside. Overall it was a good experience and it was great food. I would definitely recommend this place.

reviews.name: Jesus Garcia
reviews.text: I qas starving so i ordered the platter.  COMPLETELY  satisfied. Service was excellent, food came out quick, flavor of the falafels are phenome

reviews.name: Agrita Dubey
reviews.text:
A small place for falafel or middle eastern food. I prefer 'take away' here. 
The food is pretty affordable and good.

reviews.name: Joe Jacob
reviews.text: Love this place. Prices (inflation) have gone up since I've started going here since '98, but no one does it better than Mamouns!

reviews.name: Jason Pastore
reviews.text: Delicious.  Get the shawarma and falafel mix sandwich for $8.50.

reviews.name: Brad Orme
reviews.text: Five stars is not enough for this place.  Absolutely amazing breakfast, friendly service and lively fun atmosphere.  The Freda breakfast sandwich is amazing and a must try.  Pro tip: get the hot sauce.  Fresh green jalapeno sauce that is not too hot but a great accompaniment

reviews.name: Nadav Krasner
reviews.text: The tasty menu at affordable prices is why you gotta try this place. We loved it.

reviews.name: Rachel Welsh
reviews.text: Lively breakfast/ brunch spot but you will definitely have to wait a bit as the place is small and they pack people in. The food dishes we all got were good and the matcha latte was the best I’ve ever had. Really nice servers, all around good experience.

reviews.name: meredith cha
reviews.text:
The food was fresh and tasted great. Very busy and limited seating.
A great place for a nice brunch, especially after you get married at city hall! Which is exactly what we did and they even gave us free Champagne to congratulate us! My husband and I had a wonderful first meal as a official couple!

reviews.name: Jack Welsh
reviews.text: Cute, cozy spot with beautiful brunch options and good coffee. The guy bringing out the dishes was the best! Funny a charming.

reviews.name: James Thomas
reviews.text: Great spot with great, healthy food and awesome drinks. Small and usually crowded but worth any wait. One of my go-to spots in SoHo.

reviews.name: Sharon Chang
reviews.text: We waited for 35 mins but it’s worthy! It’s a cozy brunch place and we love it! Jack’s breakfast was good, rose water waffle was just okay though.

reviews.name: Sara Morais
reviews.text: Food was great. Cute spot.

title: Joe's Pizza
address: 1435 Broadway, New York, NY 10018, United States

reviews.name: cactus jack
reviews.text: The slice is very thin and it's not oily the cheese must be reduced fat . The sauce was good tasted very Italiano. It was good try it my pizza rating 8.8

reviews.name: Chuck Mound
reviews.text: Scouted and Selected this Pizzeria based upon it showing up on numerous NYC Food blogs. It was highly recommended by many food reviews, so the expectations were very high to start. After finally finding a parking spot after 5 trips around the block, I went in for my usual plain slice. This slice was very disappointing to say the least. Nothing special about it, average at best. Maybe the hype is to get the tourist there, but nothing stood out. Usually 1 of the 3, cheese, sauce or crust would stand out, but average is all I can share about this slice. The service was fine here, but the search will continue for the best slice in NYC.

reviews.name: Ricky Baizas
reviews.text: This truly is the best pizza anyone can have in New York City. Understandably, there is a long line outside all the time but it goes by very quickly. I had to go line up again to order another slice once I tasted it. It's out of this world. Can't wait to go back and try it again.

reviews.name: Gerard Ferrara
reviews.text:
I have been a loyal customer for years.
After an incident involving a recent order I thought my loyalty had come to an end.
But thanks to the good customer service in rectifying my issue, I am happy to say myself and my office building will continue to enjoy Joe's wonderful Pizza.
To Joe's management staff, Thank you

reviews.name: Steve Lipofsky
reviews.text:
This is a very good New York Pizza.

I'm from Boston and my very favorite pizza in the world is Regina's in the North end of Boston which is why I'm very stingy with five Stars.

A bustling location great for people watching.

The people that work at shows we're very nice and friendly..

In order to judge Pizza I order the plain cheese which is what I got it at Joe's.

They had a great selection of toppings but I can't speak to how they tasted.

reviews.name: Phil Meadows
reviews.text:
Such great pizza. Reasonable prices. A real slice of NYC. I had more than this slice (the classic cheese was my favourite) and it’s the perfect place to people watch too. This place is popular with all types of people from New Yorkers and Celebrities to tourists wanting something authentic.

The dough is light, cooked with a slight crisp and not too much tomato, or cheese. Full of flavour.

reviews.name: andrew bowden
reviews.text: Great real New York City Pizza. Always fresh hot pizza here in New York City. Courteous friendly personnel who work hard to sell pizza. Be sure to check out Joe's Pizza.

reviews.name: Annabelle Moody
reviews.text: I have this pizza restaurant at least twice a week. I drive from my place to here just to come have it.The chicken bbq pizza is utterly delicious. I love it! The general manager is always nice and make you feel like you’re a guest and not jus a customer she goes beyond to make you feel welcome and you’re very satisfied before leaving.The staff is great as well. I will definitely recommend them to my friends and family.

reviews.name: Jane L
reviews.text:
Stopped by for a late night bite around 11pm and discovered it was happy hour as well! I was able to get an appetizer and saki for $13!!! Would love to go back to try the BBQ!

The spicy tuna volcano consists of a fried rectangular cubes of rice topped with marinated tuna. It's only lightly spicy.

reviews.name: Cannon Wilkins
reviews.text: This restaurant is my favored. I visit many restaurants but to this place I go the most. The crew is very warm and the cooking they serve is so yummy. I never miss an opportunity to have a decent dinner in this restaurant. Highly recommended.

reviews.name: Amanda Walker
reviews.text: Tried to book at weekend but was so busy we waited until Monday so if inclined book up early. The waiting staff were excellent taking time to chat and clearly explained how to get the most from the dining experience and what a great experience it was. Food quality and quantity was great as we opted for the $75 dollar combo meal which would easily feed 3 people. Beer prices also reasonable at $20 for a pitcher. Recommended

reviews.name: Shea Bowman
reviews.text: I've been to this location a few times and while it's in need of a refresh, the quality remains the same. Good food, a fun atmosphere, and pleasant staff from the host to the bus people. It's fun in groups, or just as a pair, but often really busy. Try to pick a time when it's not packed for your first experience. It'll give you something to keep in mind when you come back when it's really busy and you've got a wait in front of you.

reviews.name: Tiffany Le
reviews.text:
Can’t say much about the food. I tried to get a table but wasn’t willing to stick around for the 2 hour wait. What I did experience was a neck snapping tumble down their staircase.

A host/worker came to check on me crumbled on the floor but didn’t seem concerned enough to say anything.

I left and went to urgent care to care for my concussion. We noted that the restaurant has cameras, so I’m confident this was all recorded and can be confirmed and reviewed to ensure better safety precautions for future customers. Please be safe and watch your step when entering and leaving this establishment.

reviews.name: Chino Hara
reviews.text: I go here once a month, maybe more.  Love fiery meat lovers menu.  Also good here is their happy hour drink prices.  My children live to celebrate their birthday here as the waiters and waitresses come to sing birthday song with ice cream and candle.  They love that!

reviews.name: M Mills
reviews.text: This place never fails to deliver. They serve awesome dishes for convenient pricing, there no long wait even when the place is loaded.

reviews.name: Errol Eats
reviews.text: We went without a reservation and they accommodated us. They have private rooms for groups but mostly tables for 4-6 people. All parties must be present before seating. This location was on the end floor so you need to climb stairs. Quick service and extensive menu. Only 2 beer choices available. They change the grill often. Cool environment. Kids love it.

title: Urbanspace
address: 230 Park Ave, New York, NY 10169, United States

reviews.name: Everette Hamlette
reviews.text: This place is so dope! It was my first time there and I was overwhelmed by there food options but in a good way🙌🏿🙂. I was amazed by their vegetarian options! I ate from Two Tablespoons and Hai Street Kitchen Co. That vegetarian sushi burrito was everything!!!! I highly recommend getting that! And it's super cost effective! I will definitely be back for that mac and cheese spot and that donut spot! They smelled delicious!!!

reviews.name: Scarlett Taylor
reviews.text:
Places I love: Two Tablespoons, Ovenly, Mian Kitchen, Good Stock. Five stars can be found on all of their individual pages. Truly wonderful. 

If you're coming between 11 and 2, I would advise you not to plan to find a seat, and certainly not multiple seats. It's also so crowded as to be difficult to navigate/browse. You will be hard pressed to get lunch for under $12. The selection is great though! 

Just grab your food and go. Take it to Bryant Park. Take it to the steps of the library. Take it to your desk in winter. Go at 3 in the afternoon.

reviews.name: Rye M3
reviews.text: Interesting that food here is consistently disappointing. Things that should exotic, are not, the sushi burritos. The Korean combo platters gave me indigestion. And everything is pretty expensive. At the chicken place, I get a chicken sandwich with mac and cheese and don't get a spoon... these things irk me. The coffee place is not bad, but again, expensive.

reviews.name: Richard Strother
reviews.text: Asian street food stalls ...indoors. Viet, Thai,Japanese, Chinese, Burmese...plus New England Oyster & Lobster stand.  Excellent craft beers.   Energetic young crowd sharing tables and stools.  Perfect for take-away.   I usually pop  in when passing by.

reviews.name: Ingrid Jacqueline Araujo-Lechuga
reviews.text: Great atmosphere! You can find breakfast, lunch, dinner, coffee shop, tea shop, juice bar, and alcohol bars-a little flavor from different corners of the world! 😉 Did I mention the eclectic feel? It's like being in a giant, outdoor basement 🎉 party 😍🤗😜

reviews.name: Chloe Turner
reviews.text: Cool space. Good selection of food. I had noodles and my other half had a huge burger. It was just slightly restricted on somewhere to sit and eat it but we squeezed in on the benches and the people in/using the venue were approachable

reviews.name: Ailema Paguntalan
reviews.text: bi-level food market. space fills up during lunch hours and right after business day hours. great spot to meet up with friends to grab a quick bite and a drink. does get loud and crowded.

reviews.name: Nancy Lanai
reviews.text:
Wonderful food hall just like the other urban spaces. A little less seating than some of the others but the selection is great and all of it is on one level. 

If you need a disabled entrance, or for a stroller, go to the side area in the pedestrian walkway and go in that way -- there are signs you can follow.

reviews.name: Zoreaga Team Foch
reviews.text: The ambiance, the music, the staff all was perfect. My daughter celebrated her Sweet 16 here on Saturday and we had the best time of our life until the bill came. No but all jokes aside we had a blast!

reviews.name: Rafaela Mantelli
reviews.text:
Visited during restaurant week. The decoration alone is worth the visit.
The food was very well seasoned and pretty tasty. 
For desert my husband and I had the Giant Fortune Cookie and it’s HUGE. Can easily be shared amongst four people.
Loved it.

reviews.name: Gurjot Aulakh
reviews.text: Came here for dinner, the food was delicious and creatively prepared. Loved the upscale atmosphere and music! One of our favourite restaurants!

reviews.name: D A
reviews.text: The place is gorgeous. We did the prix fixe lunch special which filled us up because it was a 3 course meal, but the food was salty I wasn’t impressed. The dessert was the best dessert I’ve had in a while. Unfortunately, the service was not good at all. The girl up front was not friendly, the waiters were rushing us, one grabbed my plate and I wasn’t even done yet. Unfriendly staff. Not sure if I would ever go back to be honest.

reviews.name: A
reviews.text: One of my favorite places in NYC, amazing Food and service. Orange chicken is a must to try!

reviews.name: duggan124md
reviews.text:
This is easily my all-time favorite restaurant in the world. I could give Tao's five stars every time because the quality of the food is prepared at a consistently high quality, every time. 

The last time we went, December 24 (Christmas Eve) was our first time with our 15-month-old, and we were seated in a nice, comfortable and warm spot, overlooking the great Buddha.

The only issue we have ever had with Tao's is the wait time, but that is expected due to the high-quality experience, food, and atmosphere which will be awaiting.

reviews.name: Eli Brown
reviews.text:
First and foremost the Service is impeccable, attentive and caring, by multiple servers, and a wonderful waitress, the food is tasty, hot and wonderfully presented. 6 stars for atmosphere as it carries onto the bathroom and the bathroom attendant.  6 Stars!!! 
I love this restaurant because the whole experience, not just the food.

reviews.name: PR TechGuy
reviews.text: Love the look of the restaurant, good food, desert, and service. A little pricey, but it's midtown so expected.  Would definitely return.

reviews.name: Noel Kepler
reviews.text: LOVE this find of a hidden gem. If you have not had a meal here yet, make a point of putting it on your to-do list. A girlfriend of mine and I met her after work for drinks and a light meal and were so taken with how quiet and quaint it is that we have both been back now several times with other people. The wait staff was amazing EVERY TIME, and the food has been consistent good. The dinning room feels like you're a million miles from Manhattan, it's like being transported to a private, rural lodge, which feels perfect in the Fall and Winter. Don't miss this one!

reviews.name: Lorraine Jiang
reviews.text:
This place is super cute and the food is awesome. 
Unfortunately they gave me a broken champagne glass.. otherwise it’s a 5-star experience

reviews.name: Ria Cruz
reviews.text:
Liked the decor and the coziness of this restaurant. I came here on a weekend for brunch, coffee was great which came in these perfect cute cups. The chocolate croissant was also really good. They offer a decent variety of breakfast options and they also have cocktails to match. Service was also great, you can make reservations and be seated on time.

I didn't love the food though: they were good, but maybe I expected too much. Maybe they have better dinner options.

reviews.name: Fred Wiesinger
reviews.text: Wonderful scallops. Really enjoyed the Brussels sprouts side dish as well. Very attentive wait staff.

reviews.name: Cindy Swabsin
reviews.text: Outstanding food and service. We had an event there for work. Staff couldn't have been nicer. Awesome spot and the food is amazing. Creative cocktails as well

reviews.name: Conscious Living Market
reviews.text: Incredible dinner, with endless courses paired perfectly. Great spot for a date. The staff is extremely friendly as well. Highly recommend. We left very full and very happy.

reviews.name: Eliott Levy
reviews.text:
If you are looking for an intimate breakfast with an upscale but casual feel, this is the spot. 
You enter the hotel lobby and cosyness and warmth already surround you. The restaurant is hidden right below the hotel. Inside, the wood and leather theme, combined with greens and natural light, gives a home winter garden feeling. Within such a decor, the quietness of the place creates a privileged and intimate atmosphere. The service is fancy-ish and the food is classic but well executed. While I would not go back for the food alone, I very definitely would for the ambiance. Run there when the busy streets of nyc suddenly feel overwhelming, you’ll feel refreshed!

reviews.name: Casey Meraz
reviews.text:
Corkbuzz is the go to spot in NYC for those looking to learn about and taste wine from the top sommeliers in the world. 

If you’re looking to learn about the intricacies of what makes wine great this is your spot.  

My wife and I came here last night for a special event involving a wine tasting and food pairing. 
The event was a 5 star event with great wine, amazing food, and a personalized yet fun wine education experience. 

We will definitely be coming back next time we’re in NYC. This is the best wine bar we’ve been to in the city.

title: Antalia NYC Restaurant/Caterer
address: 17 W 45th St, New York, NY 10036, United States

reviews.name: Alexander Erchenkov
reviews.text:
Great place, authentic cuisine (gyro is my choice)
Nice helpful staff

reviews.name: J9 Steele
reviews.text: OMG, Soo delicious.  The food was plentiful and the service was awesome.  I would travel across the city to eat here, but you done have to.  Call directly for a discounted delivery at antalianyc.com and use coupon code 5 off.  Thank you Sergio.

reviews.name: Jamir Estes
reviews.text: I like to go with friends to this place with my warmest recommendations. I  go to this restaurant often. I get very good feedback from my friends. The meals are tasty and the stuff is efficient and cooperative. Whenever we visit this place we enjoy a delightful evening.  I recommend this place with pleasure.

reviews.name: Majdia Zaman
reviews.text: Had a lovely lunch at this cute place. High quality food with the best service in midtown. Highly recommend.

reviews.name: Albert V. Whaley
reviews.text: I was there on a Friday night with couple of my friends visiting from another country, Because we did not have a reservation we had to wait about 10 minutes for a table to open up which made my friends a bit impatient, but they handed couple of complimentary drinks to make up for the wait so it all worked out fine. The food was just top notch. They prepare salads just as you order so makes a alot of difference. We will return as long as we are in New York in our next business trip.

reviews.name: büşra barbaros
reviews.text:
I’ve been to many Turkish restaurant in the city but this has to be one of my favorite ones I’ve tried couple of their appetizers and their shepherd salad which was amazing and very well seasoned!  Being a native Turk I know how this food should taste like and it was no different then the food in Turkey. 

I was happy to meet couple of their servers which were very lovely people and like doing their job with enthusiasm.

The place isnt so loud either, i enjoyed my time listening to soft turkish music with a little mix of other Mediterranean music they played. Highly recommend making a reservation as i saw them pack up really quickly.

reviews.name: DGR
reviews.text:
Very good and I thought the servers were all very nice. The kebab platter was full and plenty. Very good flavors. 
Bread was sourdough, not pita which was a little weird. 
Grape leaves were kind of sweet? (I've have millions of grape leaves and these were not to my liking)
DEFINITELY GET THE TURKISH TEA!!  Such a great way to end the dinner.

reviews.name: Ümit Özhekim
reviews.text: EXCELLENT!! This was one of the best experiences I have had in New York City, the food was delicious and so was the service. Although there were many expensive restaurants that we have visited this was one of the most affordable ones. I definitely recommend visiting this spot.

title: VIV
address: 717 9th Ave, New York, NY 10019, United States

reviews.name: Diane Mueller
reviews.text: The service was very polite. The drinks were great and the food was just fantastic. I'd highly recommend this place. Their menu was varied enough but not overwhelming. We went for a late lunch/early dinner so I don't know how crowded it gets.

reviews.name: Katie Angelova
reviews.text: Very nice atmosphere, not too packed for a Friday night. The food came out quick and was quite good, with appropriate spice level as requested. Staff is very nice and attentive. Happy hour drinks are not watered down. Will definitely come back.

reviews.name: afaq ahmad
reviews.text:
First of all, I’ve lived in NYC for over 10 years now. So I know what good Thai food tastes like and this place is nowhere close to that. We ordered an app and two entrees and there was absolutely zero flavor or what so ever. For anyone that thinks otherwise, do yourself a favor and try Pam Real for starters. 
Very disappointed.

reviews.name: Kyara Ku
reviews.text: Really nice Thai restaurant. They have a wonderful, simple yet elegant ambiance. It was packed when I visited but still didn’t feel crowded. The layout is very well designed and thoughtful. The staff was gracious and didn’t make you feel rushed. Loved the food. It was really delicious. Not over cooked or over seasoned. The dishes had the right amount of spices for your enjoyment. I would definitely recommend going there for a date or dinner with friends and family.

reviews.name: M Shaffer
reviews.text: This restaurant offers extraordinary service as well as tasty meals. One of my favourite restaurants around here. The drinks and food arrived fast and the prices are affordable. Highly recommended.

reviews.name: Ana Patrícia Olenscki Kawamorita
reviews.text: Beautiful place, delicious food! Service was slow at first but got better as time went on. Recommended!

reviews.name: Ant Oine
reviews.text:
ABSOLUTEY love this place. It’s my second time and I still enjoy it.

The staff was extremely helpful and nice to us when we asked for separate check on peak hour. 
The food was gorgeous and delicious. The pork belly in peanut and ginger sauce is a killer. I would go back just for it. 

Price is reasonable and wait is not bad. We went on a weekend night and only waited 5 min. The decor is great and they serve delicious cocktail as well. 

I would recommend this place for good Thai food and ambiance.

reviews.name: utsavi jani
reviews.text: Very good ambience! Great service. All the food dishes which we ordered were delicious and big portions! Bon Appetite.

title: db Bistro Moderne
address: 55 W 44th St, New York, NY 10036, United States

reviews.name: Danny Chong
reviews.text:
I had a fantastic dinner here. My server was phenomenal and attentive. He answered all our questions with a smile. The interior is beautiful and I enjoyed the atmosphere. It is on the loud side...obviously will also depend on other people there because there’s an open room with a bar. 

Now the food....fantastic here as well. I came here for the first time during restaurant week.
