The fluke crudo (raw fish) was delicious and not fishy at all. The zucchini and farro was refreshing and substantial. 

The Coq Au Riesling was one of the best chicken dishes I’ve had in my life. We’re all familiar with dry chicken meat and the kind of rib meat that falls right off the bone. Well, this chicken meat was moist and tender. I normally wouldn’t order chicken as an entree at an establishment like this, but it exceeded all expectations!

The db Burger...there’s a $5 supplement for restaurant week. This burger is substantial..the meat was thicker than the bun. It was perfectly cooked and flavorful. The fries are also good!

Both the Black Forrest Blombe and Raspberry Gateau were delicious. But I did enjoy the Raspberry Gateau more due to the crunch..the tart..the fresh fruit.

Oh! And I forgot to mention...wine pairing for $18!

reviews.name: Marcos Pimentel
reviews.text:
Good service, good food and ambiance.
We were 4 and everyone choose the Burger, 2 asked for extra truffle. As an appetizer I had the escargot and it was fantastic .

reviews.name: Marek Schwedt
reviews.text:
I took my wife there to celebrate (for 10th time) her recent birthday. I was lucky enough to secure one of the Travelzoo vouchers and we were very happy about it.
Bottom line, we were very pleased with a establishment itself.. Was very simply yet pleasantly designed.. Additionally the food was generally good to very good (not salty enough for me but it's my subjective opinion) along with the service.. We actually will come back because we truly liked the experience.
Thank you

reviews.name: Rodney Smiley
reviews.text: Dinner at db prior to seeing Jersey Boys. Was NYC restaurant week and the prices were fantastic for three courses! The cucumber gazpacho was my favorite dish - I could have drank a gallon of it with a straw 😳😳😳😳

reviews.name: Chiung-Yin Chung
reviews.text: Delicious Restaurant Week lunch. The grilled octopus salad was fantastic featuring charred octopus with a vinaigrette that really balanced the smokiness. Perfect frites with the db Burger.

reviews.name: August Mcbride
reviews.text: This place is doubtless one of the most pleasant restaurants in the region. Every time I come to this place I am truly pleased. They hold their high  level service and the highest level of food  they serve. You are always happy with this restaurant. Warmly  recommended.

reviews.name: Liz M
reviews.text: Delicious food and AMAZING staff. We went for Restaurant Week so it was a great deal and a real treat. They had a varied menu and all of our dishes were beautifully prepared and presented. Highly recommended for a special occasion or if you can get a table during Restaurant Week!

reviews.name: Steve Llano
reviews.text: Great bar, great cocktails, try the tarte flambeau as a great bar snack!

title: Cowgirl
address: 519 Hudson St, New York, NY 10014, United States

reviews.name: Rocky Thompson
reviews.text: John at the bar is a friend of mine, as the saying goes. Maybe Billy J confused his Italian restaurant with this classic W Village spot? One of my favorite places to visit over the years. I come here for a quiet lunch at the bar at least once a month and have never been disappointed. Legit south Texas food, good beer on tap, fantastic music, and good service from, yes, John at the bar.

reviews.name: Pranav Tripathi
reviews.text: Amazing food and service.  Friendly staff and kid friendly. Able to accommodate 10 people in busy Friday evening. Reserve though.  Get some wibes of southern comfort.

reviews.name: Bestar Mujaj
reviews.text:
I've been coming here for years. 
I come for the cornbread and the Cole slaw. 
And the rest of the food is great here, too. 

The margaritas...
Yum!

reviews.name: Roi Zylberberg
reviews.text:
Its magic... Everything is offside till you drink their specialty margaritas.... Than suddenly you discover that the world is indeed a better place.
A place of its own unique nature... I loved it!!!

reviews.name: T Powis
reviews.text: These are some of the best biscuits in the CITY! Go early!! The later, the longer the wait.. Below: The Texas 2 Step with cheesy grits and The Northerner Omelette (added jalapeño)with potatoes, Frozen Margarita, Frozen Blood Orange Margarita..

reviews.name: Christopher James
reviews.text: Great frozen margaritas. This place is kitschy and has a varied menu. Go for the baked potato dessert. It's amazing! Happy hour at the bar is always a good time. Check out the wall for some fun autographs too.

reviews.name: Shuki R H
reviews.text:
Our favorite place in the neighborhood, were we have our best memories. Cowgirl is not just a restaurant/bar - it's a home!
Best frozen margaritas and nachos... and tator tots are perfect!
If you want a nice hearty breakfast - huevos rancheros are seriously amazing and the biscuits are so buttery.
Love the food and love the staff

reviews.name: MAURICE RODRIGUEZ
reviews.text: Excellent as always! A staple of the Village!

title: Tony's Di Napoli
address: 1081 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10065, United States

reviews.name: Jason Linden
reviews.text: It is what it is.  The quality of their food is not GREAT.  They do the best with what they have and their budget.  Overall, its not a culinary masterpiece.   Its an easy place to eat with kids or a family.   If you are looking at top notch authentic food, you can go to one of the 5-10 GREAT Italian restaurants within a stone's throw.

reviews.name: Franky Poor
reviews.text: The worst hostests ever. Had to wait over 1 hour to be seated despite making a reservation one day before because we were two persons and they would not have us occupy a table with 4 chairs, while they accomodated 3 persons groups.

reviews.name: Chris Rush
reviews.text: Generous portions. Authentic red sauce with fresh pasta. Great Italian atmosphere with fantastic service. Prices are reasonable especially considering the portions. Great for family style dining. Canolis were perfectly prepared. This place meets the hype.

reviews.name: Cynthia Cherry
reviews.text: This was my first time at Tony's and it was a great experience. The service was good and the food was good I will definitely visit again

reviews.name: fernando babilonia
reviews.text: We come here every few years for some a reminder of a special day for us. The entrees are in half and full portions. This time my wife got a half portion of the squid ink pasta and I got the half portion of the double steak (in other words just one steak). We always forget just how big the portions are, pictured was the half portion my wife ordered and had left overs for a few days of. My steak was surprisingly very flavorful.  The wait staff was a little off this time,  but the food was good.

reviews.name: Kirsten
reviews.text: The mixed seafood with lobster is delicious and so huge that the two of us had to take it home for another meal! Definitely worth your money. We also ordered the tiramisu based on a raving review but found it disappointing. The watery rum mixture soaked through the bottom layer and overpowered the rest of the cake, so I scrapped off the soaked mush and only ate the upper part. I peg it to an off day. They gave us prosciutto and bread on the house, a very nice touch. The service was up to par and the place is quiet, allowed you to stay and sit, and not as crowded (we did go at 2). This is indeed a special place in NYC that seem to give customers a excellent portion at a understandable price :)

reviews.name: Robert McDermott
reviews.text:
I made reservations and let them
Know it was for my husbands birthday. When I checked in with the hostess I told her I had a reservation and for some reason instead of asking me who’s birthday we were celebrating she asked my husband and blew the surprise. The food was good by our waiter had the personality of a wet sponge and the speed of a turtle. It took forever to get our food. So after a 2+ hour dining experience we were going to order dessert. Except it took over 20 minutes for the waiter to get around to take our order. At that point we decided to skip dessert and get the check. I got up to use the restroom and to my surprise, while I was gone, the waiter brought over a plate with a couple of cookies and sang happy birthday. He could not wait to do it until I was back at the table??? Just look and see if everyone is there. Now he was in a rush. So I missed out being there with my husband and kids. Not the way I wanted to celebrate his birthday. Was just looking to do something a little special and it blew up. Will not go back again, next time carmines. This is his wife writing the review

reviews.name: Alex Lototskyy
reviews.text: Great homemade Italian food . Probably the best we had in a while . Order half portion as they are huge. Great staff !

title: ILILI
address: 236 5th Ave, New York, NY 10001, United States

reviews.name: Natallia A.
reviews.text: Do you like ambient places with deemed light and  ethnic food? Do you like passion fruit drink that is sparkly or maybe some other exotic flavors? Well, you should then visit this place. We regularly come back there.

reviews.name: Amanda Walker
reviews.text: Dropped in for an unexpected Brunch on a busy Saturday in December without reservations. Everyone was charming and friendly and could not have been more accommodating! Such a delightful surprise in an often hostile city. The food was excellent as was the service. The decor was glittery and Christmas-y but super tasteful and elegant. What a lovely experience!

reviews.name: Hugo Sparks
reviews.text: We have the opportunity to dine at Ilili restaurant. It is a beautiful place with several rooms and a bar in the flatiron district of Manhattan. We enjoyed appetizers of hummus, baba ghannouj, and moussaka. We shared entrees of falafel, beef shawarma, lamb chops, stuffed grape leafs and the mixed grill. Everything dish was authentic and delicious. The service was attentive and great. The restaurant was crowded and was noisy. The drinks were good and very pricey. Bottom line: This is a fantastic high priced Lebanese restaurant.

reviews.name: Mohamed Ayman
reviews.text: A highly elegant place to dine and enjoy time spent with a spouse or friends. General atmosphere and every detail are both calming and satisfying to body and soul. The Lebanese food was quite spectacular and service was superb. Chicken liver and duck shawarma were really good. I highly recommend this restaurant.

reviews.name: Daniel Millan
reviews.text:
Ilili -  A well curated Lebanese-inspired menu, with the Mediterranean essentials with a twist by Chef Philippe Massoud. Perfectly marinated and grilled chicken, cooked through but not dry. Try the pink yogurt sauce with it over a warm home-made pita. 

Suggests definitely getting the hummus and other menu items such as the black iron shrimp with a spicy kick of jalapeños. 

Excellent service despite COVID restrictions.

reviews.name: Salvatore Caroprese
reviews.text: Fantastic atmosphere, - cozy and warm woodworking in a concrete jungle. Great staff and service - knowledgeable. Delicious, unique and brilliantly selected wine offerings. Scrumptious Lebo food. I'm no expert on Lebanese cuisine but overall very I'm satisfied with my dining experience. Five Stars.

reviews.name: Mona Mitri
reviews.text: Best Lebanese place in NYC. Incredible food. Awesome atmosphere. Great wine list. You might want to make a reservation because it is always packed. Worth the wait. Make sure to try desserts. WOW!

reviews.name: Huzefa Zariwala
reviews.text: Fantastic food. Excellent service. The lamb with rice as main course is an excellent choice and always prepared well. The brussel sprouts are a great small course. One of our favorite places for Mediterranean food in New York city

title: Malatesta Trattoria
address: 649 Washington St, New York, NY 10014, United States

reviews.name: Alexander Burmistrov
reviews.text: One of my favourite restaurants in West Village. Food here is amazing especially desserts. Love the free bread, italian food, atmosphere, everything. Great place for a date. Cash only.

reviews.name: Dennis Voulopos
reviews.text: What a gem in NYC, always excellent.  You must get the spinach gnocchi and lamb dish, absolutely the best dishes.  The food is always consistently excellent and service quick and friendly.  Please remember it is cash only

reviews.name: Saba Khan
reviews.text: Many simple home made pastas at this local joint. They don't take reservations or cards, so be prepared to wait during busy times and bring cash or you can use the ATM inside. Great atmosphere.

reviews.name: Mark Eckert
reviews.text: Great food, non-pretentious staff, good location

reviews.name: Beda Warrick
reviews.text:
I quite enjoyed visiting this restaurant. The food is good, especially considering the most reasonable prices. I had spaghetti and it was delicious!  And less than $10 I think! Can’t beat that in NYC. 

The place is small and has a neighborhood feel, which is contributed to by the staff, who treat everyone like you are eating in their home. Would definitely go back.

reviews.name: Olivier Manhattan
reviews.text: Nice terrace on a quiet street, perfect for a romantic summer dinner. Can be pretty loud inside though. The pasta plates are simple and comforting. Their appetizers are good and cheap. I liked their assortment of bruschetta. Their burrata was  yummy! Service is busy but friendly. Their (free) table bread was too salty and one slice was soggy.

reviews.name: Robert Mui
reviews.text:
The food here is fantastic. I'm by no means an expert on Italian food, but the food here reminds me my experience with Italian food in Italy. If you come here, it may spoil your experience with any other Italian restaurant in NYC. 

Service is fast and items on menu are moderately priced. This place is a must try again, and again, and again.

reviews.name: Michael Nguyen
reviews.text: Had the spinach gnocchi. The gorgonzola sauce was really heavy and creamy but so delicious. Portion for that dish was decent. In general, the portions for the pasta dishes tend to be on the smaller size. The ambience and service was good. Prices weren't bad either!

reviews.name: Tom-Sebastian Wolffers
reviews.text:
Overall underwhelming. Expensive wannabe-Austrian food. 
We went there 3 years ago and it was way more impressive especially since they offer only pre fix menu ($75+) which is very strange for this kind of restaurant. Too bad that the quality and especially the service went down since last time.

reviews.name: Keith Tanyc
reviews.text: Love this place. The wine list and the food are excellent. Love the look as well. But, what is the deal with the 60’s rock?  When I was last here I assumed it was a rogue bartender playing it. But here I am again and it appears to be someone’s idea of an appropriate playlist for a refined Austrian restaurant

reviews.name: Stefanie McKerley
reviews.text: Just ok. Dessert was tasteless and dry.

reviews.name: Laszlo Farsang
reviews.text: My friends took me out to Wallsé last week since I’m from Hungary, and they wanted to surprise me with a familiar taste. The best Goulash and Schnitzel I’ve had in the States so far! Exzellent!

reviews.name: Daniel Greenberg
reviews.text: Great light ambiance and decor, and a wonderful place for a tasty winter lunch. Highly recommend the chestnut soup and beef cheek, but did find the schnitzel a little too breaded vs the size of the cutlet for my taste.

reviews.name: Mar R
reviews.text: We stopped by for dinner at Wallse. We had a reservation and still had to wait for 35 minutes for the table to be ready. There was no room at the bar so we had no choice but to wait by the door being pushed around by people entering and leaving the restaurant. We had the prix fixed menu and wine pairing for dinner. The food was mediocre at best. The only acceptable (but not actually rememberable) dish was the schnitzel. The cocktail we had prior to dinner was also mediocre and wine pairing was extremely disappointing. They forgot to pour the desert wine so they gave us a shot while we were having our coffee. The shot was so strong and horrible we could not drink it. Unfortunately, the service was also lacking. The few times we tried to ask for water refills and were repeatedly ignored by the waiters when doing so. The whole dinner was almost $600. I have tried a large number of Michelin starred restaurants and was very excited to try Wallse, after this experience I am wondering who decided to give them their star. I have had better dinners and service at way less expensive places. Try something else, this place is not worth it.

reviews.name: Simon Markowski
reviews.text: Exceptional Austrian food. The Wiener Schnitzel was perfectly prepared and all the dessert was exquisite. Highly recommend.

reviews.name: Matt Monarch
reviews.text: The restaurant itself is very nice and the food was ok. However, the price for ok food was insane, so I can't recommend it. A three course dinner for two plus dessert, with one of the cheapest bottles of wine (around $80) came out to $380 before the tip. To be fair, it was on NYE but I believe the normal price is somewhat close.

title: FIG & OLIVE
address: 10 E 52nd St, New York, NY 10022, United States

reviews.name: Natasha Chan
reviews.text: Always love it here! We had the truffle croquettes for the appetizer and I got the short ribs for my main. Super delicious and always comes with tasty bread with various olive oils!

reviews.name: Shelby Granger
reviews.text: My wife and I visited while on our anniversary trip. My wife ordered a pear sangria and I got a rossellini both were very good. The mushroom croquettes were amazing! The service was the best we've ever had, our waitress was very attentive. We'll definitely be back next time we visit.

reviews.name: Dankmar Garcia
reviews.text: The paella is very good. Also the bread they serve as an entrance has a unique flavor with... fig and olive.

reviews.name: Linh Profe [Ta]
reviews.text: Wonderful service and wonderful food! We we're celebrating for my bachelorette and everything was great. I usually frequent the location in the meatpacking district so this was my 1st time at the midtown one. We got an order of the crostinis to start with and every single one was better than the next. Our entrees were the kind of y that your eyes roll to the back of your head and our desserts were beautiful, rich and decadent. I can't wait to go back!

reviews.name: Visan S.
reviews.text: Lovely ambience. Good food and service.

reviews.name: Alan Cronin
reviews.text: Great little spot. Last orders on a Sunday was at 9pm so just made it. Seemed to be busy with locals which is always a good sign. Didn't disappoint. Food was excellent as was service. There is a first floor so plenty of space. Nice atmosphe and ambience. Would recommend.

reviews.name: Alex Koronec
reviews.text: I had the lamb burger and salad.  The experience of this area has been great. The staff always came by to check out how the meal was.  The manager came to check out how food was.

reviews.name: Daniel Castellani
reviews.text:
The truffle croquettes were the best I ever had!
The atmosphere is very Italian/modern yet cozy.

title: Pio Pio 8
address: 604 10th Ave, New York, NY 10036, United States

reviews.name: Subhash Krishnamoorthy
reviews.text: Delicious chicken and green sauce as always. This location has a great dining area and ambience. Very cool atmosphere. The service is friendly and quick. Best Pio Pio I've been to.

reviews.name: Matt Schaffnit
reviews.text: Incredibly large portions - order accordingly. Mostly family style. Service could really use improvement. If that were to improve I would feel completely comfortable recommending.

reviews.name: Geo Avila
reviews.text: Excellent food and drinks at a reasonable price.  Very understated from the outside, and rather large on the inside.. regardless, make sure to pay a visit and try their selection of mixed Pisco drinks. Geo sent you..

reviews.name: Ivette Davila-Richards
reviews.text: The restaurant's ambience and decor was FAB! Food was delicious and there was so much food for our group to indulge in. First time here. 🤗👏🏾

reviews.name: Walter van Dusen
reviews.text: A group of us dined at Pio Pio 8 last night. No cell service so I couldn’t leave my review last night. We really enjoyed our chicken. The rice and beans a seemed little overpriced for $7 for what why were expecting real saffron tasting and not a lot of beans. Atmosphere is wonderful and staff were friendly. We give the the chicken a five star.

reviews.name: Emily Young
reviews.text: Very tasty food, cozy local restaurant. The service was very friendly and efficient. I would definitely come back for this dish again.

reviews.name: Maritza Figueroa
reviews.text: This used to be one of my favorite restaurants until today. I asked for my meat well done, can anyone tell me if this looks well done?? I guess whoever the cook was on duty tonight was terrible!!! Even the service wasn’t great today. I am so disappointed!!!

reviews.name: leah palasis
reviews.text: I can not tell u how much I love this establishment! The food portions are big prices are just perfect! U have to have the Leche de Tigre and Pisco Sour which is to die for! Just magnificent!

title: RedFarm
address: 529 Hudson St, New York, NY 10014, United States

reviews.name: Beatrice Miranda
reviews.text: Originally we were 4 people for dinner at Decoy, but then a local friend wanted to join us; however no space in Decoy so they accommodated us regardless and moved us up to their sister restaurant Red Farm, and still honored our wanting the duck. We all have the suck menu special which is a lot of food. The cocktails are very good here, and the service was stellar. I love the small New York restaurants that are privately owned.  Pictures of everything except the steak are featured below.

reviews.name: Sanjana Malothra
reviews.text: Ok, I came for the XLB which were excellent, the savoury soy milk with chinese donut and the RedFarm sticky rice roll.  There was a line out the door at opening on a Saturday morning and now I know why.  The food is excellent and so are the prices!

reviews.name: Wade Guenther
reviews.text:
If I could give Red Farm more stars I would. The service was really good. All the food we had was amazing: The bbq beef fried rice, shrimp dumplings, and pastrami egg roll.

Just ask the server for some of the popular options. Either way, you won't be disappointed.

reviews.name: Kelly Michalak
reviews.text: Was really tasty and deff different! I recommend everyone come here at least one while living in NYC. The only thing is that it gets really really loud and almost uncomfortable. But I still give it the 5 stars because the GM was really nice!

reviews.name: Victoria Munoz
reviews.text: RedFarm held the #1 spot on my go-to list of slightly-expensive-yet-casual-enough-for-a-weeknight restaurants in NYC during fiscal year 2018. This is my first time back almost a year and the food is as tasty as ever. I suggest sharing everything so as to maximize how much you get to try. The soup dumplings are delicious, as is the five spice chicken. There’s always something fun on the daily specials menu as well. Pro tip: sometimes they have pecking duck from downstairs available off-menu to be served upstairs.

reviews.name: Brian Ratajczak
reviews.text:
Elevated Chinese fare. 
Like it's sister restaurant, the exceptional Decoy, it's a communal seating vibe. I've tried many dishes, all have been good, but nothing is quite like the Katz's pastrami egg roll, which is one of my favorite dishes in the city

reviews.name: Kelly Wylie
reviews.text:
Absolutely unbelievably delicious!! A beautiful twist on Chinese cuisine with sharing size portions. Known for dumplings must try!!
The ambience is perfectly cozy and the staff is very friendly. 
Must try their craft spicy margaritas!!

reviews.name: SS1824
reviews.text: Great food and service. Everything ordered was delicious. And of course the pacman dumblings are so cool.

reviews.name: Jody Thrash
reviews.text: The service was impeccable. The food was fresh and delicious. Atmosphere was conducive to conversation and relaxing and enjoying our meal. 10/10 would go again.

reviews.name: K. M
reviews.text: Really enjoyed our meal here. Always helpful to have a reservation. Nice atmosphere. The speciality rolls are worth the extra $. Flavors are awesome and basic rolls are reasonably priced and delicious. Food came quickly and staff were friendly.

reviews.name: Marco DeBortoli
reviews.text: The sushi here was amazing! Very trendy and popular place, so reservations are recommended. Some of the best sushi I've had!

reviews.name: Mark Rasmussen
reviews.text: A great sushi restaurant in the heart of Manhattan,  views of bryant park. Decent sake menu,  great sashimi and dishes.  Trendy interior,  in a trendy hotel(the bryant park), while there,  try some house specialty cocktails in the Moroccan style bar on the lower level.

reviews.name: Rebecca DeShan
reviews.text: Very good! Super trendy and popular. If you are looking for somewhere quiet, this is not the place. Sushi was fresh and tasted great. Very tight seating.

reviews.name: Christopher valkovsky
reviews.text: The menu and service were beyond our expectations. I really enjoyed the environment of this spot. First-rate spot to take my family out for lunch.

reviews.name: Susan Chen
reviews.text: Love the food. Everything was delicious. Our waiter was humorous and attentive!

reviews.name: Tom MacNabb
reviews.text: The chirashi sushi showcased a lot of beautiful fish, which I loved, it was served in a non-traditional wide bowl which I find allows the rice to dry out a bit more than I prefer. Overall a good dining experience in an interesting setting.

reviews.name: baanie chandok
reviews.text: Good food, great ambience, and good service. Tried the restaurant week menu and had a good experience. Food was tasty and had decent portion sizes. The restaurant was packed even on a weeknight and my only gripe is that the table we were seated at was so close to the other tables that it offered close to no privacy for conversation. For the price of food here I expected an exceptional experience and it just fell a little short.

reviews.name: Lee Patrick
reviews.text: How can you not love this place? Even during covid they still find a way to make a great outside atmosphere.

reviews.name: LoveAnna
reviews.text: Very well designed restaurant with a basement disc, a ground floor bar and seating and a level up is resonating.  Fantastic atmosphere, delicious food, great service! Even prices seemed reasonable considering NYC.

reviews.name: Paul McCann
reviews.text: The food was amazing. Rib Eye was phenomenal. And the sauce that came with it was delicious. The snapper was soooooo good. Sushi was so fresh especially the spicy yellow tail. Lobster won ton amaze. And Bianca was the best server. On point and attentive. Loved her and Tao.

reviews.name: Aurora Vintilescu
reviews.text: Loved the food and the drinks. Ambiance was amazing too - their design and decor certainly help. Our server was super friendly and helpful, which we appreciated. What we didn’t  appreciate were the prices - super high and not worth it in my opinion. Still recommend trying out this place though, just prepare to pay big bucks for a good dinner.

reviews.name: Nicholas Amore
reviews.text: Excellent service, the food was great, the ambiance was quite exquisite.... You have to make a reservation and pay $100 to hold it; but the money goes towards your meal. I went on a busy night so the place was packed. They had us waiting for our table even though we reserved from days before but everything else made up for the wait.... 5⭐'s I would definitely go back there.

reviews.name: Sraboni Paul
reviews.text: The atmosphere, service and food were great. I went during restaurant week, so it was a good deal. However, normally the prices are pretty up there.

reviews.name: Arvinder Moore
reviews.text: The food was really good and our server was also great. However, we weren’t happy with the overall experience because we made reservations for 11:00 PM and showed up at 10:50 but weren’t seated at our table until 11:35. I understand that sometimes it can  be busier than expected, but the staff kept telling us  that “they’re just waiting for the table to be prepared” rather than giving us a realistic time frame of how long we should be waiting. We could’ve waited in the bar and would’ve been way happier

title: Havana Central Times Square
address: 151 W 46th St, New York, NY 10036, United States

reviews.name: Dustin DiTallo
reviews.text: We were sat and the busser brought us water. After that we were completely ignored. It wasnt busy and there couldn't have been more than 4 or 5 tables sat. Two parties that were sat after us recieved food and drinks while we were never looked at. We ended up walking across the street and had a great meal.

reviews.name: Evelyn Perez
reviews.text: What a rip off when it comes to the take out drinks. They charge you double the price for a drink paid $45.00 for  2 take out mojito’s definitely not worth it.

reviews.name: emkobg
reviews.text: This place is less than a minute walk away from Times Square. We got there and were told there is going to be a 25 min wait. Great, we can grab a drink at the bar while we wait. The hostess was not really interested in taking our name or anything. She was just chewing her gum and scrolling on her phone. Soon as we got our drinks at the bar she rushed us to go and claim our table. I guess she was rather annoyed she has to talk to us.  Food is phenomenal and they are famous for their Mojitos. Prices are also very reasonable for the location.  It is nicely decorated and very cozy.

reviews.name: Brian Watson
reviews.text: Food  and drinks were fantastic. The service was surprisingly fast even tho it was very busy. The space is very tight and hard to get around. Very hard to find a seat even in the bar area.  It was however worth dealing with our cramped seats to enjoy the deliciousness

reviews.name: Damian Pratt
reviews.text: Finest food, very kind employees, always excellent atmosphere. They charge convenient rates and the food quality is great. Kudos.

reviews.name: Nellie Phillips
reviews.text: The service at this place to was terrific. I so enjoyed the food, it was flavorful and well prepared. There was live music and although it was crowded, you still felt you were able to hear each other. The rum punch was everything! There are two floors and it was a pleasure watching the different dishes pass back and forth. Made me stay longer They also have a party curtain which is a mag idea. Just loved it!

reviews.name: 4deepwater8
reviews.text:
Loved it! The black beans and rice has a unique flavor that was a perfect combination with my roast pork. 
Went back for the Cuban sandwich and was delighted.

reviews.name: Rajapillai Pillai
reviews.text: Delicious good with great service in a good location. Street corn is excellent. The two vegetarian entrees are very good, though the plantain dish is way too small for the price. Delicious though! Waiter was super awesome.

reviews.name: Peter Salem
reviews.text: Absolutely incredible vegan brunch spot. If you need to bring any non-vegans to brunch to convince them that switching is possible, you should bring them here. The dishes are definitely NYC brunch prices, but they are worth it. The Vegan breakfast pizza was so so good, and very very filling. I will definitely be checking out the other Blossom locations when I come back to NYC.

reviews.name: Francisco Mendoza
reviews.text:
Blossom on Columbus is amazing! 
The food my wife and I ordered was extremely satisfying. We ordered a burger and the wild mushroom pizza. We did not regret doing so. The burger was very tasty and the pizza was just as great. On top of the food being good, the service Alexandra provided was excellent. She was very attentive and made sure we were happy with our meal. Will definitely be returning to this place soon. Highly recommend to anyone looking for a vegan spot to eat, staff is friendly and welcoming.

reviews.name: Jeremy
reviews.text: This is some of the best vegan food available in the world. The atmosphere is very nice and the service is perfect. The dishes are plated nicely and of course everything tastes awesome. I definitely want to come back here for a special occasion

reviews.name: Gina Mckeown
reviews.text: Service is amazing, and food even better. Outside seating is nice of a sunny day. The proportions are very generous, I could barely make it through my vegan burger.

reviews.name: Kenneth Shapiro
reviews.text: Had an excellent meal, first meal out since March, with my adult daughter and staff was friendly even during covid times, will be back

reviews.name: Zack Zbar
reviews.text: Best beyond burger I’ve ever had, hands down.

reviews.name: M Collette
reviews.text:
Love the ambiance of this location. Their brunch French toast with a scramble is super yum and not something (the fried french toast) I can make at home, so it’s a fun meal every now and again. 
The staff is always really nice and the bartender Stephanie makes THE best Manhattan you will ever have in Manhattan with organic ingredients, the price is still comparable to other places in the city. 
10/10 recommend you go sit at the bar and have her drinks. 
Also, their dinner specials are always very good here! 
Oh, if you like nachos, GET THEM HERE. 
They’re yum!! 

The location in Chelsea is also very nice and lovely, different vibes though, and their tiramisu there is (oddly) different and much better than uptown! 

Otherwise, I find the food on par at both locations.

reviews.name: Yehuda Eh
reviews.text: Really nice wait staff. Awesome vegan restaurant with gluten free options. Outdoor and indoor seating. Take your time and enjoy your meal. Food was AMAZING!

reviews.name: Laura Z. Cummings
reviews.text: The most delicious wonderful fantastic pizza restaurant in all of New York. I love their pizza options as well as their versatile appetizers and pasta dish offerings. Delicious food and great service. Disappointed that they don’t take reservations but aside from that, not a single complaint. You pay for culinary excellence and the polite service staff. I’ve been coming here for years. Used to go with my parents, now I go with my husband. Love love love vezzo.

reviews.name: Peyman H
reviews.text: You have to come here for best pizza in town. It is absolutely out of this world....so thin and crispy.

reviews.name: Kitkat Bermuda
reviews.text:
If you are looking for a cozy and quiet dinner and sit inside not the place for you. Very lively atmosphere and diverse crowd. Lots of regulars.

The waitstaff had to shout and then they couldn't hear our reply. 

I ordered a rootbeer never received it. My son ordered main course salad and we were all eating our meals and we had to ask where his food was.

However the pizza is the best thin crust I have ever eaten! Very scrumptious! I would return just to get it ... but would opt for take out.

reviews.name: Christian Cuevas
reviews.text: Really nice thin crust pizza! I recommend: Tres Fuegos!

reviews.name: Norhan Bassiouny
reviews.text: One of the best thin crust pizzas I’ve had. You’re able to split the pizza in half to get two different kinds. I split and got the chickpotle, which was amazing. I couldn’t stop eating it even when I got very full. The staff is also really nice. Highly recommend.

reviews.name: Mahmood Usmani
reviews.text: Unbelievable thin crust pizza. As good as it gets. Haven’t ventured past the plain cheese yet but will probably try some more variety next time. Probably. Also service is pretty inattentive, you have to flag your server down if you’re in a rush. I knew that before coming in and wasn’t put off by it.

reviews.name: Divyang Riziya
reviews.text:
The best Pizza in NYC.
If you are someone like me who loves to have hot food this is THE place.
Beautiful thin crust and crispy pizzas. You can either go for custom one or go with the ones on menu. Don't forget to ask for the home made Jalapeno Sauce.
Must go if u like thin crust, cheesy, flavoured and hot  yummy pizzas

reviews.name: RAM IMAGERY
reviews.text: Please start keto dough. The cauliflower crust is amazing and you will completely sale out ! I'm a pizza lover and this is the pizza to he had! Wow NY best pizza hands down!

reviews.name: David Packer
reviews.text: I went here with my mom when she was in town. It’s a must stop every time. Why might you ask? Because it is amazing! Russ & Daughters is a CLASSIC! The food is great with a great selection. Always friendly and great service. Reasonably priced for what it is. Immaculate as well. I’d recommend specific food items but they are all good! Definitely try the lox though. Highly recommend checking this place out!

reviews.name: Micheal Bugeja
reviews.text: This was my first caviar experience and I'd go back for more. Food hasn't stopped on this trip so we kept it to apps only and some dessert. The croquettes were like fluffy crab cake balls..... delicious. The caviar wasn't too fishy and didn't leave a gross taste in your mouth. Very refreshing. The best part was the French toast which was similar to a cinnamon bun topped with apple sauce. It's a great spot with a long tradition.

reviews.name: pilotdane
reviews.text: Absolutely incredible.  Simple but really delicious and I'm not a fan of smoked fish.  My wife is a huge smoked fish fan and she would probably rate it six stars if she could.  And the beer was good as well so two thumbs up.

reviews.name: seelia chung
reviews.text:
It's a small shop and there's a line. You have to take a ticket and wait for your number. It took around 1 hour for our number to be called and we came on the weekend. Staff doesn't seem to be too friendly and they'll put a number up on the counter that they didn't call which is confusing.

The interior is really nice and makes you feel like a child because there's so much to look at and potentially buy. We bought tuna salad, herring salad, and a garlic bagel with caviar cream cheese with salmon. The tuna salad has the tuna flavor and is decent. Herring salad tastes pickled and slightly sour and sweet. The caviar cream cheese is just salty cream cheese. The bagel is good, but wasn't breathtaking and I've had better in Toronto. If you're interested, I would recommend it for the experience, but I probably would not come back again.

reviews.name: Farouk Nouri
reviews.text:
A selection of liquor and beer includes many top-shelf brands!

Recommend highly

reviews.name: Elsa C
reviews.text:
Always love bagel.
classic board- bagel, smoke salmon, cream cheese, onion, tomato, and capers.
You can make your own bagel!
Their smoke salmon is not too salty, so you taste of more salmon flavor more than salt. 
Everything balance so well together! 

I came here on weekday lunch so no wait needed. I heard  weekend is aLways packed.

reviews.name: Neroshan Thevakumaran
reviews.text: Great bagels, lox and Eastern European Jewish foods. The service is spectacular, and the whole place has a 50s diner vibe. The wait to be seated is long, but worth it. It's a spot that would be a regular restaurant for me

reviews.name: edouard g
reviews.text: Been there several times, always good times. The focus us on fish and bagels, in different variations. Good products, nice venue and service. They have platters for groups which are working very well with friends or family. Did not try the caviar...

reviews.name: Nicole Dansby
reviews.text: Omg! The falafel pita with a harrisa and a mint combo falafel was out of this world! So delicious!

reviews.name: Katriel
reviews.text:
The falafel sandwich is worth every penny.
I had a really bad day at work before stopping here for dinner one day, I ordered the sandwich and headed to my usual spot to eat it (the outdoor seating area by the Flatiron Building).
I was happy.
Go for either the spicy (it’s not too spicy) or regular falafel sandwich, both are equally satisfying, just depends on whether you’re in the mood for a little kick or not.

reviews.name: Craig Stover
reviews.text: Easily the best middle eastern food in the area, and they're really nice. Recently I went in to pick up an online order, I waited a while and eventually asked the woman at the counter how long it would take. She was super nice and made sure I got my order quick despite the huge crowd of people who were also waiting. Thank you!

reviews.name: Dan rozier
reviews.text: Cauliflower shawarma was tasty but nothing special and a little too expensive vs similar competitors (e.g. Cava).

reviews.name: Yoni Ryabinski
reviews.text: Love the harissa falafel

reviews.name: S.D RO
reviews.text: Food was amazing!!! How falafel should taste

reviews.name: Saul Kaiserman
reviews.text: Worth the wait and stands up to the hype. Fresh, tasty, creative counter service, probably best for take out.

reviews.name: Anjali Mittu
reviews.text: Really great food with a good size portion

reviews.name: Sylvia Lamar Colon
reviews.text: The food was delicious , I  felt safe there .Freeman's is in an alley  so it's off the  street

reviews.name: burt conley
reviews.text: It wasn't a bad experience, but it wasn't a very extremely good experience. Kind of pricey but if you're into the kind of light snack then this is the place for you, not much on the menu to choose from. The alley to get to the restaurant? if you wanting some great photography. That is their best catch, the aesthetic of the restaurant was on point for its character . love the atmosphere but not a fan of the food, You have to have the acquired taste. But they are very popular with the locals.. the staff was extremely friendly.

reviews.name: Noah Cynkar
reviews.text: The food here was amazing as well as the atmosphere. The place is quite large with many different rooms which helps the tables feel a little more private. All of the food looked great and I will definitely be back next time I'm in the area!

reviews.name: Memphis Estes
reviews.text: I always arrive grabbing some food here. I love the fast service and well made food. I recommend this place.

reviews.name: Stephanie Neveu
reviews.text: Stopped in for brunch. Staff was amazing- friendly and accommodating. Can’t rate them highly enough. However, food was okay. I got the cheeseburger- meat was overcooked (I requested medium rare), and not seasoned- beef was pretty bland. Bun was nothing special, just a simple sesame seed bun. “Special sauce” did not wow me, either. Fries were good, as well as the drinks. The spot itself is cute- I would return for drinks. Quality and price of food is questionable.

reviews.name: Georgios Roumeliotis
reviews.text: One of my favorite get away places in NY! Love the Sunday brunch and also their veggie burger. Charming and super friendly team

reviews.name: Foodlover Girl
reviews.text:
This restaurant used to be a hidden, kind of a secret spot that wasn’t really known to many people. The words have gotten out since then, and it is now a super popular spot. 

We didn’t have a reservation, so we decided to get there early. We didn’t have any issue getting a table with just a handful of people at that time. The inside was very cozy. Feeling of an old tavern or a log cabin, filled with animals and antlers on the walls.  

They had brunch menu and lunch menu, and you can order from both menu during brunch. We ordered Five Cheese Macaroni and Skillet Eggs.  They both came in a small iron skillet. It was smaller than expected, but I always say quality over quantity. They were packed with flavor, comforting, and made really well. 

We had a nice, relaxing, tasty brunch here. The service was polite and nice, we were well taken care of. The menu is a bit on pricey side, but the quality is super high. I have been wanting to try Freemans for quite a long time, I am glad we finally got to dine here! I would like to go back for more, and try some of their cocktails as well in a near future!

reviews.name: Dominique Ochoa
reviews.text: I admire this place! They provide high quality food, their menu is decent, The chief cook in that restaurant is very trained, I enjoy a lot trying all their dishes. The food is always tasty, the service towards the clients  is very good too. I frequently visit this place and I not even once was unhappy. I recommend it with no hesitation.

title: Toro NYC
address: 85 10th Avenue Entrance on 15th St and, 11th Ave, New York, NY 10011

reviews.name: Kenny Altman
reviews.text: Would give 10 stars if I could! One of the best dining experiences I've had in NYC. Incredible food with good portions and beautiful presentation. Wait staff was super friendly and informative, loved our server Ava and the excellent attention she paid to us. Will definitely be recommending to friends and absolutely will be returning here next time I'm in NY.

reviews.name: joshua gardner
reviews.text: Good tapas, small portions, patatas bravas is a good add to your meal.

reviews.name: Jing Sha
reviews.text: Delicious tapas and paella. A bit expensive thought. I guess it's for special occasions.

reviews.name: Ben Field
reviews.text: We had our holiday party here and it did not disappoint. Huge menu and everything was delicious. The bottle list was very well done but the glass list was lacking. We went on a Thursday night after 8pm and we were all surprised at how quiet it was.

reviews.name: Marc Tolchin
reviews.text: What a fantastic meal!  Great space accompanied by very good tapas.  The staff was exceptional at handling my gluten allergy.  I found many options to eat and they worked to make it the best experience possible.  The octopus was very good and the trotter was a definite must order.

reviews.name: Tom Bresnahan
reviews.text: Amazing every time we go. Brought my girlfriend and her cousins here the first time I met them, one of her cousins was so impressed she had her next birthday here. That speaks volumes about this place, if you come by Toro everyone will walk away with a wonderful feeling.

reviews.name: Guglielmo Didelot
reviews.text: Our server was very helpful and the sommelier was extremely knowledgable. Fantastic evening. The food was terrific and the whole evening wonderful. The music is very loud which made conversation difficult at times but did not adversely affect the evening for us. We were there as a couple but a larger group would also be good here. Recommend this restaurant.

reviews.name: Olivier Manhattan
reviews.text: Get some modern tapas and cocktails in a revamped warehouse with whole cured hams hanging from the ceiling. Great atmosphere and friendly service. Although the food was OK, and their "fileté" is a very good deal, if you're looking for genuine Spanish tapas there are better places in Chelsea. Cocktails were surprisingly good.

title: The Landmark Tavern
address: 626 11th Ave, New York, NY 10036, United States

reviews.name: Alistair Stewart
reviews.text: I go to this marvelous  place often because I enjoy the good air that is characterizes this place. The crew is extremely attentive and qualified. The service is extraordinarily quick. Needless to say, the food you eat is good. I came many times and I was always joyful. The pay is decent. I suggest this place to all my friends.

reviews.name: Utkarsh Wadiar
reviews.text: Was expecting better from the place! The food served was not so good, sandwich was cold and steak was slight burned. Had to wait over 30 mins for food to come, but guess it was because of huge crowd of Memorial Day weekend. Waiting for food wasn’t an issue but food was so let down.

reviews.name: Houston Cohen
reviews.text: The food is consistently well prepared and yummy, employees provides good customer service. I really like how neat it is and mood. Will visit here again.

reviews.name: Caleb Dixon
reviews.text: Absolutely amazing food. Not much else to say: atmosphere was friendly and energetic, but not overly loud. They've got a good selection on tap, and on Mondays they even have "Irish Jam Sessions" that I wish I could attend but am only here until Monday at noon. A little pricey if you were just looking for a quick bite, but amazing quality for the price. Check it out, tourist or local alike!

reviews.name: carla greenwood
reviews.text: Great hidden little gem.  The service was attentive.   The food was delicious!!  Shepherd's pie was a nice portion and tasted fantastic.   My husband had the corn beef and cabbage.   That was delicious as well.  The tavern has been in business since 1868.  Definitely is a nice and cozy oasis from the hustle and bustle of NYC.  Loved it!!

reviews.name: Dave Benham
reviews.text: I walked past this bar a few times and each time i felt pulled so we all came back sat up at the bar and the polite on que bartender took care of us like long lost family. Amazing food top shelf drinks and true New York hospitality.  Must go especially if ya want to have a stylish date night.  Be polite dress dapper and tip well this place gets 4 starts

reviews.name: Wil Perez
reviews.text: The food was simply amazing and the staff were very attentive. This place has a nice old school feel and would recommend it to anyone looking for a relaxing experience.

reviews.name: Gilbert Smith
reviews.text:
My crew loved this place.   We had just finished seeing my dad's old ship USS Intrepid CVS-11

 An old New York Irish pub in every sense of the word.   My Aunt and Uncle really enjoyed the fish and chips.  Fries were perfect fresh cut style.  Great offering of whiskey wine and beer.  My burger was a nice medium rare, but the cheese was maybe a half step up from Kraft singles.

title: ABC Kitchen
address: 35 E 18th St, New York, NY 10003, United States

reviews.name: Andy F
reviews.text: My wife and I ordered the fried chicken and it was absolutely raw in the middle!  First off, not OK.  Secondly, the waiter asked if we want them to throw it in the frying pan real quick.  Not sure about you, but I'm not a fan of paying $135 for a meal for quick pan fried chicken, especially since we both feel super nauseous right now.  :(

reviews.name: Melissa Panczner
reviews.text: Really yummy food and absolutely beautiful decor in restaurant and bar. The whole layout is really well done. The perfect brunch and dinner spot. Love this place ☺️

reviews.name: Sue. P
reviews.text: Hands down My favorite! I really love this place. I went with my mom and my mom also really loved every dish. Pizza was on point and I really loves the ravioli as well. If you are a mushroom lover, try the pizza with mushrooms!! The service was amazing and especially I love the vibes here. Anyone would fall in love with this place! ABC Kitchen is a perfect place for hanging out and bdays - any special occasions! Their prix fixe is awesome. Make reservations for your special day!! Also it’s not a super formal place but with casual outfit you can have a great time! you’ll never regret! Give it a try! Highly recommend!!

reviews.name: Lee C
reviews.text: Fun, lively, w/ delicious food. A bit pricey for the small portions. Enjoyed our bartender/server Mike. Will go back.

reviews.name: Michele Hart
reviews.text: The ambiance is the best thing about this place. Our server refused to take our order until we were completely ready. After having gone about 8 hours since our last meal trekking around the city, we wanted to start with an appetizer and take our time to peruse the menu considering it was our first time here. When our food finally did come it wasn’t bad but nothing particularly stood out as great either. The bread to start was cold, as if it has just come out of the refrigerator cold. The meatballs were just okay. The squash pasta was a bit cold and chalky and not much flavor. And the burger was tiny, almost a slider size. For the price we were expecting something more than the decor to stand out.

reviews.name: Antonio Serrano
reviews.text:
ABC Kitchen is a one of my go to restaurant options for special occasions.

The service is always above average to amazing. The food is very good and well prepared. The only downside is the meals can get very pricey, but otherwise I recommend this place to anyone looking for a great dinning experience in Manhattan.

reviews.name: Wesley Yu
reviews.text:
This is my second visit and it did not disappoint. 

Top three dishes: the crab toast, scrambled eggs with crispy oysters and the mushroom pizza. 

The pizza is neopolitan style so it's not filling. 

The salted caramel ice cream dessert is also quite good.

reviews.name: Brett Thorson
reviews.text: Fantastic food, drink and service. We went here for a corporate event (dinner) and they did a fantastic job. Will certainly be going back soon. And if you need to host a work dinner, this is an easy win.

title: The National Bar & Dining Rooms
address: 557 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10022, United States

reviews.name: S West
reviews.text: I come here every time I come to New York. One of my favorite restaurants. The food is always great.

reviews.name: Cheryl Gross
reviews.text:
We came to 
The National Bar & Dining Rooms for a late lunch on a Saturday and we were surprised there was no line! I ordered the steak biscuit and my friend ordered the chicken biscuit, which were both delicious! The steak was a bit on the drier end, so I preferred the chicken instead. Otherwise the biscuit and gravy were delicious! The staff was very friendly and attentive!

reviews.name: Bryan Watt
reviews.text: This was not the Geoffrey Zakarian dining experience I expected. The hostesses were cold and rude. All three of them couldn’t have cared less if we dined at National or somewhere else. The service was very odd and sporadic. The whole flow of the meal was made awkward by our server forgetting to bring plates for the appetizer and then directing us to hold up our appetizer plates while he placed our main course. When we asked for an additional condiment, we were told it wasn’t available, though the server backtracked when we pointed out that this condiment was a menu item.  While the food was good, I was really disappointed by this meal. Upon first entering the restaurant, we were treated as if we were a burden. I recommend going elsewhere to spend your hard earned dollars. The National isn’t interested in earning them.

reviews.name: Felicia Dhanie
reviews.text: It was Christmas and we wanted to celebrate and nice dinner for my daughter and family. This   Experience and dining deserve half star, opposed to one star. The service was poor and slow. My daughter has a hair in her food, and the service couldn’t understand what a hair looks like or seem to understand simple knowledge. Geoffrey Zakarian’s failed me.

reviews.name: Christina Wang
reviews.text: The burger itself was delicious but the service could have been better. I was meeting with friends from out of town so were chatting a bit and before taking a look at the menu. At a certain point I think our waiter forgot about us? In any case, the food was on point.

reviews.name: Robyn Randell
reviews.text: Excellent lunch in a quality restaurant. Loved the ambiance, service and the salmon.  Wonderful ingredients. Will be back.

reviews.name: Erica Chan
reviews.text: Wait staff are eager to please.  Food is hit or miss during brunch.   Colombo coffee a plus- nice and strong; no choice of nut milk though.  Do not order the oatmeal-  very watery, even the great toppings selection that comes with it cannot make up for the lack of substance.  Egg dishes come in big portion; good size plate of chicken sausage (tasty too). Seat near door to bathroom /hotel lobby is very drafty, avoid.w

reviews.name: Brett Bar
reviews.text:
Wow , service was great!! Everyone tried hard to keep things going but yet never too fast

The some was something else pride is really something when it comes to picking wine, and he nailed it every time

Food was great, get the tuna tar tar worth every cent

Wine like I said what a worker

Beer didn't have any yet the menu was on point

And I had a cocktail, good stuff

Go for the travel zoo deal if its still there 

Over all just a great job

title: BLT Steak
address: 106 E 57th St, New York, NY 10022, United States

reviews.name: JN Five
reviews.text: Amazing service. Great food and alcohol. Can't complain.

reviews.name: Jonathan Vernon
reviews.text: I most say a well all around establishment, food is just what you expected it to be, delivered in class and a touch of  finesse not seen to often when it comes to dining out.

reviews.name: Emmett Towey
reviews.text: Excellent ... Dana the bartender is great ... Enjoy the popover..the steaks and Dover sole are excellent

reviews.name: Mary Beth Driscoll
reviews.text: My friend came here a few months ago and suggested we bring our other friends.  Also, the concierges at the Four Seasons recommended it.  The service and attention we got were excellent.  It's not a huge place and it was crowded, but you still felt comfortable.  The food was excellent, especially the popovers!!

reviews.name: Alex Torbert
reviews.text: Great food and the best service I’ve ever had!

reviews.name: Gal Sivan
reviews.text: Really nice place. I like most of the food too, but not so much the steak. The bar is fantastic and very romantic. Once I even sat next to Jaff Bridges at the bar. Truly nice place!

reviews.name: Kristen Kalish
reviews.text: Fantastic service, great family atmosphere with both the staff and the restaurant. Had a wonderful BLT Steak here and will definitely be back. I also don't even eat steak but loved everything else on the menu! My family RAVED about. The steaks For the rest of their trip so overall a GREAT experience

reviews.name: Aranza Portugal
reviews.text: Amazing steak but be ready to spend at least $52 per steak in addition to drinks and sides. I ordered a 10 oz filet mignon medium well, anything medium well or higher will be butterflied (cut in half) so it cooks evenly. I would suggest ordering the Kansas City 20 oz ($59), unless you’re looking to split the Porterhouse 36 oz ($106) with someone else, also the bacon, the Baked Ora King Salmon, the grilled asparagus, and the mashed potatoes (super smooth and creamy).

title: Sushi Yasaka
address: 251 W 72nd St, New York, NY 10023, United States

reviews.name: Crew Maldonado
reviews.text: This place is my favored. I visit a lot of restaurants but to this place I keep coming back again and again. The team is very attentive and the food they cook is so tasty. I am always happy to have a decent meal in this place. Highly recommended.

reviews.name: Mina Ko
reviews.text: This was great! The fish was super high quality and the dessert tasted amazing. The waiters were very accommodating!

reviews.name: Carmen Chan
reviews.text: This is by far one of my favorite sushi places to go to in NYC! Very decently priced and high quality sashimi. I usually get the deluxe cause it comes with the oyster - that raw, juicy, just-so-darn-good oyster taste oyster (just thinking about it makes me want some!) Their fried oyster is very good too! Great sushi restaurant on the upper west side!

reviews.name: Sarah Hale
reviews.text: The sushi here is very high quality! Everything is the finest quality. They even have great dessert!

reviews.name: Lolita Wong
reviews.text: Best sashimi and sushi. The fish is very fresh! Our server was also very attentive. I am also impressed it has lunch special daily.

reviews.name: Kristel Rodriguez
reviews.text: Man this place makes me feel like Im living in Tokyo again! So authentic. Long wait. Worth it.

reviews.name: Nhung Nguyen
reviews.text: I had the mini Omakase and it was superb! Each piece has that "melt in the mouth" texture and very fresh. The waitresses were very friendly too! Sitting at the counter was a great experience since I get to see the ingredients. But since i had the mini omakase I didn't really get to communicate much with the chef tho (well, they were super busy too).

reviews.name: Melissa Roberts
reviews.text: Great place, the sushi here is amazing and the staff is very attentive and friendly. They also have a great selection of sake at a fair price.

reviews.name: Bryan Verona
reviews.text:
Found! Again!
It seems like Pastis never left. This new location looks and feels like the old one. Every detail has either been replicated or recreated to resemble the old. If it ain't broke, don't fix it. Even the menu is exactly the same as the old (from memory). And of course, everything coming from the kitchen is very good. Perfect stop for a boozy lunch or light dinner with a friend(s).
For more great reviews visit TheLoupe!

reviews.name: Olivier Manhattan
reviews.text: Great vibe and delicious food. The herrings were incredible - a tour-de-force when you think that it's basically pickled fish with potatoes. I don't know what they add in their baked eggs with asparagus but I finished it all. I loved the "fricassés" or Tunisian tuna sandwiches, a rarity on this side of the Atlantic. Service was fast and friendly.

reviews.name: Saara Stephen
reviews.text:
Fabulous lobster salad.

Food and service is always great.

I wish there was a baby changing table in the women's bathroom though!

reviews.name: Laurie Quinn
reviews.text: This place is just as awesome as the first place. I think they salvaged everything and reused it here! It’s absolutely beautiful!

reviews.name: Naz Malekan
reviews.text: As great as always. Nice to have you back, old friend. Great vibe, so French, so classic NY. Food was wonderful. One of the few places in NYC where one should order chicken and enjoy it with a extra chilled vodka martini with a twist. Just fabulous.

reviews.name: Bruce Powell
reviews.text: Tasty food and incredible ambiance!! Loved the minimalist yet cozy interior and also the small plates were all really thoughtfully plated and yummy. We came in a large group for an event and ate in the basement space - would recommend this for groups planning out large dinners! The service was great and having our own space with lots of tables was awesome.

reviews.name: Alexandra P
reviews.text:
Really enjoyed our time here. It is a cute space that truly looks like a French diner. We had the mussels and frites (which were true skinny fries, and absolutely amazing) and the French onion soup. Everything was delicious, especially on a winter day. Almost returned the same week to try the burger (I’ve heard good things!) 

I’m giving it a 4 instead of a 5 as the menu is pretty old school and I couldn’t see myself ordering a lot of items on it. It also is on the pricier end.

reviews.name: Gloria Lopez
reviews.text:
First time here
And huge plates
We ordered
Plain rice
Orange chicken
Walnut shrimp
House special chow mein
We came from my son's soccer game so we were starving!
It's good! Shrimp and chicken is crunchy it did not get soggy!
It's good i enjoyed it but again 5 stars for customer service it's Sunday and it's not packed, plenty of parking on the lot.
This picture was taken halfway through our meal so we had leftovers!!!

reviews.name: Brenden H
reviews.text: This spot is first-rate and broad, the menu was enchanting and the rates were very reasonable. quick, effective service and very friendly waiters. I recommend this place.

reviews.name: J Z
reviews.text: Food and service was excellent! They were very busy and we did not have a reservation, but they were very eager to accommodate us (party of 8). All 8 enjoyed their meal from start to finish.We will definitely be back.

reviews.name: Tina Sargent
reviews.text: Very disappointing.  The two young waiters worked hard.  Their supervisor/owner(?) Was not very nice to his help. We had a party of 20 (reservations), table took a bit to prepare. We wasn't even ask if we wanted drinks.  If you were drinking wine you had a drink. Food was cold with a few warm spots.  No consistency on plating. Not worth $70 a person.

reviews.name: Sol Arabehety
reviews.text: Cozy and quiet, and super nice people. Best dinner I had in New York

reviews.name: Joseph Blondin
reviews.text: So we booked this place based on the reviews and we were not disappointed.  Made a reservation, got right in.  A bottle of wine was waiting for us at the table along with fresh apps.  We had the Antipasto, salad, pasta and fish, absolutely fanatic.  We left the table to open up the table for people waiting and the owner bought us a dessert drink on the way out to say thanks.  Would definitely recommend it and come back!

reviews.name: James McKiernan
reviews.text:
Engaging and entertaining staff, attentive to every dining need.

Generous portions of indescribably delectable food. [With an occasional free/extra glass of wine]

reviews.name: Lisa Frasco
reviews.text: Went here for dinner tonight while here 2 days for work. Our experience was just amazing! The best Chicken Parmesan I have ever had! The staff was grade “A” classy and the complimentary tastings when you are seated were also amazing. I will recommend this place to everyone who goes to NYC. Thank You Allora staff for being amazing!:)

reviews.name: Nicole O'Brien
reviews.text: One of the best meals I have ever had in NYC. Get the antipasta with octopus and scallops and you will not be sorry.

reviews.name: Iona Wooten
reviews.text: The burgers here are freaking amazing here. And they have a pretty good menu selection with prices that are very reasonable too.

reviews.name: Stephanie M
reviews.text: I order 3 medium well original burgers from burgers and lobster on 06/09/2020. When we got home we notice after taking a bite  from the burgers . That all 3 burgers were  completely raw I'm the middle . I called the Resturant and spoke to  who I believe his name is Mike , for him to tell me that the store does not offer refunds, but he can make me 3 new burgers . I explained to him that I am in a different borough now and can not make my way back there . He then Again replied saying there nothing he can do . Please look at these images to see how completely raw these burgers were.

reviews.name: Sandra A
reviews.text: Everything here is always great! Add the lemon garlic butter to your order for an extra treat on your lobster roll.

reviews.name: Vlad Bogdanov
reviews.text: Burger and lobster is one of my favorite things to have. I tried this amazing combination for the first time in London and from than I'm trying the find the best spot.

reviews.name: Melissa Camacho-Diaz
reviews.text: My friend raves about this place so much I had to try it out. We made reservations and thankfully didn’t seem like we needed them as  there was no wait and we were seated earlier than the reservation time. The waiter Brandon was delightful. He was energetic, friendly and made the perfect recommendations. For drinks we tried the peach Moscow mule nice and strong and we tried a chocolate pretzel drink which sounded weird and gross but when we tried it it was delicious. The drinks were not weak at all.  We got calamari as an appetizer the calamari were small but the three sauces that came with it were tasty. They were all spicy which was a plus for me but not for my wife who can’t have spicy foods. I wanted the famous burger lobster combo but Brandon told me that specialized menu would not last and I can always come back for the burger and the lobster. I went with his advice and ordered the shrimp and lobster ravioli which he said took the chef 6 month to prepare - it was delicious. I was worried the portion size would be skimpy but it was perfect and there was plenty of lobster in and out of the ravioli. Thankfully my wife ordered the burger and lobster and I got to try it OMGEEEE the French fries were perfect and that butter garlic sauce was so good I wanted to put it on everything.  I have not one complaint about this place. The food, the ambience and the service were all top notch!  Will definitely be coming here again.

reviews.name: Luke Meyer
reviews.text: We walked in and were seated immediately and wouldn't have needed the reservation, but I'm glad we did to be safe. We were greeted immediately by the waiter and he did a good job of taking care of us throughout the meal. I went with the beast burger so I could get some lobster and a burger. I've never had lobster on a burger, but I actually was very impressed with it. It gave it an interesting flavor and the beef was very juicy. The fries were good as well as the salad. I would happily eat here again if I was in the area.

reviews.name: Andrea Oakes
reviews.text: It's a nice experience. Simple menu and the food is pretty good. I would recommend this to anything who enjoys burger and lobsters lol. You can even pick your own massive lobster from the tank. It ain't cheap but if your willing to splurge a little it's a nice experience.

reviews.name: J G-Christopher
reviews.text: Food was good. Atmosphere was nice.  Service was enjoyable. Price is a little high ($18 per crab leg 👀)  but great experience.

reviews.name: Chris
reviews.text: The food is amazing! Even the chicken soup and calamari seemed better than most. Food is on the pricier end, and the restaurant can be a bit drafty though. The music and vibes make up for it, and I'm sure even more so if you get to stay for the live band! Also note that happy hour is only at the bar.

reviews.name: Arlene Toto
reviews.text: The best Cuban food I have had outside of Miami! All my favorites. Great ambiance. Would definitely return.

reviews.name: Paula Andrea Rodriguez
reviews.text: I love the place. They have live music every night. Food and cocktails are excellent. Just one thing. If you are and old fashion lover (like me) you wont get it there because in despite they have a full bar, they don´t have bitters. I have asked several times for it but apparently they wont buy them. Besides that, the ambience is great and the staff is friendly.

reviews.name: Isaias Vazquez
reviews.text: The best cuban food and the best mojitos ,

reviews.name: Malvis Consuelo
reviews.text: My family and I visited for the first time Guantanamera Rest in NYC, we have visited many so called Cuban restaurant being Cuban, ourselves we know our cuisine. We ordered three Cuban sandwiches, didn't come close to the real deal. First it was more a pork sandwich it had to much pork and just one slice of ham and one slice of cheese the three sandwiches was the same preparation. Over priced one beer, two sodas over $100. dollars I asked the waiter if the Chef was Cuban, not at all he was Mexican, the owner Jewish. I don't understand why is so difficult to find true Cuban, food prepared by their own people that knows the secret of an original plate preparation. First and last visit.

reviews.name: J Kim
reviews.text:
Wow... awesome place!
Most delicious meal in my NY travel.
I love Guantanamera!♡

reviews.name: Vlasti K
reviews.text: Great food, drinks and music.. but most of all, we LOVE the owner - Mario 👌

reviews.name: Susana Alvarado
reviews.text: Authentic Cuban food went with a party of 14, restaurant was very accommodating. Staff was friendly and service was very speedy. The mojitos are a must try.

reviews.name: Lucais Horsley
reviews.text: I have been a patron of the Palm 2 on second avenue for many years and I adore this place. The steaks, chicken parmigiana, Cesar salad and creamed spinach are incredibly delicious. The waitstaff is perfect and the ambiance is the epitome of old school NYC charm. The restaurant walls are covered in caricatures and a pleasure to look through from your table. The noise level is fairly low at this location and I’ve had many long happy conversations here with friends.

reviews.name: A A
reviews.text: What a restaurant! Such warm and hospitable, from the Maitre d, to the wait staff to even the staff from the kitchen. This is a true landmark and a gem, sure to not be missed. Calamari was crispy to perfection and not oily, 9oz filet mignon-medium rare, amazing,3lb lobster, perfection. If you are looking for a place to have fresh lobster from Nova Scotia, the palm too is the spot. And we finished off with a trio of desert, Key Lime pie, NY cheesecake and Chocolate layer cake. "The place to see and to be seen"

reviews.name: Samuel Pryor
reviews.text:
My father loved the Palm.  But it's gone way down hill  Service is great. Good martinis. Crazy expensive wine list  

Most important, it's not dry aged beef. If you're looking for great steak, there are much better places.  Meh.

reviews.name: Latavia Shores
reviews.text: The lobster will change your life. A much try.

reviews.name: Mesut Demirbilek
reviews.text: Extraordinary place with it's all original delicious tastes...every thing is perfect , but do not miss their NY cheesecake 🙂

reviews.name: Brayden Mora
reviews.text: I have been a patron of the Palm 2 on second avenue for many years and I adore this place. The steaks, chicken parmigiana, Cesar salad and creamed spinach are incredibly delicious. The waitstaff is perfect and the ambiance is the epitome of old school NYC charm. The restaurant walls are covered in caricatures and a pleasure to look through from your table. The noise level is fairly low at this location and I’ve had many long happy conversations here with friends.

reviews.name: Lucinda Breinla
reviews.text: I had not been here for some time but was not disappointed. The waiter was excellent and very happy to help in making portion size for one. I had the lobster which was 89$ for 3 pounds. It was delicious and worth every penny. The salad was good but the tomato was a bit soggy. The garlic bread was yummy. With wine and tip dinner was $160. Highly recommended

reviews.name: Edna Banks
reviews.text: I had not been here for some time but was not disappointed. The waiter was excellent and very happy to help in making portion size for one. I had the lobster which was 89$ for 3 pounds. It was delicious and worth every penny. The salad was good but the tomato was a bit soggy. The garlic bread was yummy. With wine and tip dinner was $160. Highly recommended

title: Franchia Vegan Café
address: 12 Park Ave, New York, NY 10016, United States

reviews.name: Chintan Desai
reviews.text: Love this place for the good selection of Korean Vegan choices. The Stone Bowl varieties are really good. Topped with Plum and Lychee wines both delicious. Also has a wide array of teas. Very friendly staff. Good service never disappoints. Have taken friends and family here and they all love the evening.

reviews.name: Luke Warm
reviews.text: What appears to be a very well positioned establishment on the east side of Manhattan,  the food leaves much to be desired. From the two plates of food consumed on my visit, seasoning was absent from the ingredients. The lettuce was wilted. The service was subpar at best. Restrooms are labeled by gender, with one toilet present in each. This bilevel venue is accessible.

reviews.name: Danny Rowland
reviews.text: Asian, Vegan food. Great tofu and a good selection. The chop sticks at the table were metal and kind of flat which made them look cool, but they were hard to use. The service was good and the atmosphere is very authentic. It can get crowded and the tables are close together, but it didn’t interfere with our meal at all.

reviews.name: Jennifer Betit Yen
reviews.text: A favorite gem for everything from business lunch to date night, the service is always wonderful, the menu is inspired and the food is delicious.  This is my go-to for vegan sushi.

reviews.name: Sukru Murat Cebeci
reviews.text: Definitely must-try for any vegan. We loved every single dish we have tried. Prefer a stone bowl when you have the option. Nice to see and smell the food while it is still boiling on your table. I have preserved Jackfruit & Eggplant Curry Stew and absolutely loved it. The spices tastes so good. The fusion of Korean and other Asian kitchens is amazingly well done.

reviews.name: BJ Bartels
reviews.text: As someone who's traveled all over the country and has been to countless restaurants specializing in Asian cuisine, I can say with complete confidence that Franchia easily takes the spot for #1. It is one of the stops I look forward to the most when visiting NY, and my top recommendation out of all the restaurants in the city! The rainbow roll is my personal favorite, though you can't go wrong with anything on the menu. The environment is relaxing, and the staff is friendly and quick! Do yourself a favor and stop by if you get the opportunity. It is one you can't pass up!

reviews.name: Snigdha Agarwal
reviews.text:
Very happy to see a completely vegan place in east Asian cuisine - first of that kind I've seen.
The roll combination was worth the money. However the dragon noodles were less iñ quantity. Watercress rolls were soft outside and crunchy inside - perfect combination. Everything was lip smackingly delicious. Though the compulsory 15$ per person order amount can be uncomfortable for some.

reviews.name: Laurence OfNYC
reviews.text:
Choices and presentation of teas are great. Good choices in regard to wines as well. Staff are attentive, and helpful with menu questions.

Perhaps the dumplings aren't the best. Noodles were great. I personally enjoyed the sushi most.

That being said, I chose not to order any dishes with tofu, or setan; personal choice. When eating vegan, I don't see the point of things being flavored to taste like meat...

Overall, the prices were fair. The decor is tasteful, and their ceiling is nice. The terraced seating is different in a good way.

title: The Smith
address: 1900 Broadway, New York, NY 10023, United States

reviews.name: Lawrence Patterson
reviews.text: OMG, this  review is LONG OVERDUE as I've been eating their great food for some time now. I recently came here for a pick up order and FYI they are only doing phone/take out orders ONLY. You have to call to place an order as my picture I uploaded.

reviews.name: Nico Mayordo
reviews.text: Great food excellent service! Good outdoor dining at this time of pandemic situation.

reviews.name: ian d
reviews.text: Wow. Just loved this place on a recent trip. Lively atmosphere, friendly and attentive staff. Prompt service. Generous sized portions. Succulent steaks. Great fries and other veggies too. A decent wine list and some killer cocktails. Lighter options for lunch time. Very popular so reservations would be a good idea but they always seated us even when we did a walk in. V good value for money.

reviews.name: MM Mee
reviews.text: It was good as ever. Only thing is my fork was dirty and had left over  crumbs on it. If it was not COVID-19 I will be fine with it. I thought  they will be more  thorough  with sanitizing and cleaning  to protect  customers.

reviews.name: Erma Stevens
reviews.text: So glad that finally we got a sullungtang place on Foothill. The broth is milkey and so tasty. My go to food for winter!!

reviews.name: Mack Mercia
reviews.text:
Coming from the beautiful Descanso Gardens, we needed some fuel.  Korean fried chicken to the rescue!

Got confused at the beginning with seats but Mark helped us out.  Food came out promptly and it tasted delicious.

reviews.name: Cline Woodward
reviews.text: This is one of our favorite Mediterranean places to order from. Everything is very fresh. Haven't had a bad experience so we'll definitely keep coming back

reviews.name: gimi mimi
reviews.text: Had dinner here with a friend last year, food was amazing, would love to return. The atmosphere was a little noisy but it didn’t ruin the taste of the food.

title: Morimoto
address: 88 10th Ave, New York, NY 10011, United States

reviews.name: Justin Godwin
