reviews.text: At the moment  you enter this restaurant  team give you a nice feeling. Very comfortable waiters, it is a good place to  pass time with buddies or with your date. Great  cuisine, experienced  chef de cuisine, competitive  cost and generous  service. Warmly recommended.

reviews.name: Jennifer
reviews.text: I was here for the restaurant's week. I ordered sashimi for my entree and it was really good. However, my husband found small pieces of egg shells in his egg custard and the waiter apologized and offered us the complimentary dessert which later found to be charged. We had to ask the waiter to take the charge off.  Food was good but overall experience with the waiter was not pleasant.

reviews.name: Marietta Hatzipanayotidou
reviews.text:
Next to Chelsie market, great service. Not the best sushi ever, very small quantity of meat. 
I would prefer a smaller space.

reviews.name: Chelsea Gillespie
reviews.text: The food and service is what you expect from a fine dining place. We did the 8 course tasting menu which was so fun. If you are looking for a unique experience outside of good sushi  and played entrees I highly recommend it. The restaurant is very modern. There were people dressed in business casual to jeans and a t-shirt. Sometimes famously owned restaurants can not live up to the hype, but this place was quality through-and-through.

reviews.name: Peter Chang
reviews.text: Lackluster food.  Sushi was less fresh than neighborhood joints.  A poor excuse for Nobu.  Learned our lesson and never went again after the first time.  For that price I will go down the street to Del Posto and have constant best meals of my life any day.

reviews.name: Max Finch
reviews.text: I definitely suggest this restaurant, because of their Japanese foods, specially Shushi impressed me a lot. There are yummy Japanese foods, light items are mostly seen. Fresh foods are cooked and delivered, food hygiene is maintained. Good place for kids.

reviews.name: Huzefa Zariwala
reviews.text: Excellent food. Good service. Reservation recommend. The restaurant week menu had a good selection. Enjoyed our dinner.

reviews.name: Jackie Tong
reviews.text: Lovely atmosphere. Came for restaurant week. Loved all the dishes. Tuna tartar was delicious. Sea bass was cooked perfectly. Panacotta was delicious.

title: The Blue Dog Cookhouse and Bar
address: 308 W 50th St, New York, NY 10019, United States

reviews.name: Patricia Sicinski
reviews.text: What a gem!! The staff was super friendly and informative. The drinks were delicious as well as the food. I will definitely be coming back every time I'm in the city.

reviews.name: Michael Podevyn
reviews.text: Unexpected discovery! Nice brunch place with outdoor seating in a southern European style gallery. Particularly recommended: the Crab Cake Eggs Benedict. Very friendly and efficient service as well.

reviews.name: Lauren Denysek
reviews.text: Came across this place when doing a quick search in time square. We were more than pleasantly surprised when we walked in. A very small, quaint restaurant, with a great atmosphere and massive menu. The cocktails we order were fantastic and the mussels we had to start, were great. The wings were hearty and done nicely, and the salads were perfect size with fresh ingredients. Would highly recommend this place.

reviews.name: Dina
reviews.text: Let me just say, WOW! To the stuffed pumpkin French toast, and orange juice.yummy!! Robert was a great server,being in the business service is huge for me. We had a warm welcome too..Thank you wonderful breakfast moment with my daughter.

reviews.name: Rodrigo Lopez
reviews.text: This hidden little gem is well worth looking for. Look for the rug mat to find it. The menu is extensive and what we tried was very delicious, highly recommend the omelette.

reviews.name: Miranda Mencias
reviews.text: This cute restaurant has a safe shaded outdoor patio for dining good for social distancing❤

reviews.name: Emily Landrum
reviews.text:
Our one breakfast in NYC we chose Blue Dog Kitchen Bar and we don’t regret it! We arrived just as they opened which was perfect as we wanted a place open at 6am! It’s a very small place and has a much more interesting vibe than I expected. Staff was friendly and attentive. 

I ordered the grilled avocado Benedict and my husband had a tailored omelette. The Benedict came with a lot of food. The potatoes were the best part! Super flavorful. The hollandaise sauce on top of the Benedict was too thick for my taste. The small bunch of greens on the side was nice to break the meal up. My husband had no complaints with his omelette. Service was fairly quick considering we were the first people there. 

A small one stall bathroom is available which was nice.

reviews.name: elisabeth oh
reviews.text:
Friendly service! Know that most tables are communal. It's a small space and the kitchen took a little longer than hoped to conjure up our food but friendly service made up for it. 
Just know the menu doesn't offer basics; it gets a little creative -- for example: the waffle is deep fried and comes with ice cream.  Good list of drinks including smoothies!

title: Patzeria Family & Friends
address: 311 W 48th St, New York, NY 10036, United States

reviews.name: Anja Haefliger
reviews.text:
Delicious gluten free pasta. I had the pasta with seafood. It is the most expensive pasta on their menu but when I got the plate I knew why. I never had seafood pasta with such a big amount of seafood. I wasn't even able to see the pasta at first since it comes covered with all the deliciousness from under the sea.
I love the atmosphere of the place as well. Its a very small and cozy an feels so friendly.

reviews.name: Angie Carducci
reviews.text: Really good, unpretentious spot for pizza, pasta, heroes and more. I stopped in the other night for an individual pie after the theater and it was fairly priced and very generously sized; could be shared if you were having an appetizer or salad (total with one topping and only water to drink was around $15). Today I tried a pasta dish - cheese ravioli - and very much enjoyed it. I also had a salad and a very tasty house-made sangria and was offered a basket of garlic bread (total around $38). This will definitely be on our short list in the theater district ahead of some other places that may have bigger reputations but have proved underwhelming.

reviews.name: לטייל IL
reviews.text:
Everything was just perfect. I am speachless. 
The food & service & atmosphere were great. 
We ordered a few "simple" dishes.. and the mexican chef made them so delicious!
We will go to get some more for sure!

reviews.name: Kevin Hohnstein
reviews.text: This place is fantastic! They have many returning local customers as well as plenty of tourists. Went for dinner around 6pm and was seated right away. Waiter came quickly and took our drink and food order. I ordered the special of shrimp stuffed with crab (pictured). My partner ordered the chicken marsala. Both meals were fantastic and very satisfying. Didn't order dessert but the cheesecake looked amazing.

reviews.name: Jenna North
reviews.text: Some of the beat pasta I have ever ate. Worth the trip if you are in Midtown. Ravioli and pizza were fantastic! Very nice atmosphere and servers were awesome!!

reviews.name: Scott Schada
reviews.text: It's been a couple of years since I've been here; dropping in several times while staying at the Belvedere Hotel, (which also lends a bit of hominess with its kitchinette rooms.)  I absolutely love this place.  I have sat at the bar and chatted with folks while enjoying a great NY thin pizza (I''m from Chicago, but crave good thin crust cheese) and also sat down at a table and enjoyed a friendly vibe, even after being gone for a year. This place makes you feel like you're a regular.  See if you can get a good rate at the Belvedere, and you will have a very nice and almost private stay on a quiet street just a few yards away from crazy Times Square and the theater district (which is what I went for)  It makes a perfect getaway for one or two theater lovers who also love Italian food and don't want to go to the chain places.

reviews.name: Kayla Dykema
reviews.text: Awesome customer service!!!! Our server Walter was excellent! Called in for reservations talked to the owner he made sure to stop by and see how we were doing! Make sure and have the cheesecake! Definitely a must stop!

reviews.name: Ian Sinclair
reviews.text: Great food. Amazing pizza and went back a few days later for mains we say others having. Excellent quality and quantity. Pricey but the food is second to no where. Wish I could go again before I travel home.

title: Palma
address: 28 Cornelia St, New York, NY 10014, United States

reviews.name: Klim Kavall
reviews.text: Great food and amazing ambience! You would never think that the restaurant was this large as the entrance looks tiny but this place keeps going and going. Awesome outdoor-style area in the back. Each dish was properly done and the service was top notch. Only issue we had was that the bar wasn’t open for lunch so we were not able to order cocktails.

reviews.name: marianna me
reviews.text: Wonderful cuisine. The service was great. Nice environment. Reasonable price for a new York high class restaurant.

reviews.name: Lenur Yusupov
reviews.text: Perfect cozy and cute spot. Stayed for brunch, and enjoyed spinach ravioli and mushroom pasta, both were excellent. Also excellent warm cocktail with bourbon for winter!

reviews.name: Amy Kennedy
reviews.text: I thought Palma was really beautiful inside. I loved the gnocchi pesto & the funghi pasta. However my whole experience was ruined by the fact that the plates we received were so dirty, as were the utensils. When we got new plates, they were just as dirty- if not worse! There were hairs on the plates, there was old food stuck on it, and dust. It was a really big turn off and made me not even want to eat.

reviews.name: ed @ netlojic
reviews.text: Great Authentic Italian Food. Excellent gluten free pastas.!

reviews.name: Carolyn Chappelle
reviews.text: I love Palma Italian restaurant. . Beautiful ambience,  weather you sit in the garden or hide away with a date in the private dining space, the food will taste the same- delicious!!! Good service and great food.

reviews.name: Sarah Shin
reviews.text:
Came for the second time on Friday dinner. It was around 5:30 and the place was not packed. The food was good as always but the service is getting worse. They were constantly asking if we wanted water or what kind of water even if we told them. Feel like all the waiters were asking us and didn't even care to communicate with each other. Our pastas came out first.  They did not give us the bread and vegies that were suppose to come out before. so I had to ask for them. 
I didn't have good service last time and taught that it was from the busy hours but now I know that it was not. hope they improve on this

reviews.name: Kate McKeon
reviews.text: Hands down one of the most gorgeous restaurants in NY! The garden is very special in both winter and summer and is the most romantic place to enjoy an evening out. The food and drinks are consistently good and well prepared with seemingly fresh ingredients. My favorite is the pasta!

title: The Capital Grille
address: 155 E 42nd St, New York, NY 10017, United States

reviews.name: Danielle Bonamo
reviews.text: The Kona steak was absolutely delicious! Ambiance is so nice, especially downstairs with an actual bank vault door! Great wine list as well.

reviews.name: Utpal Chakraborty
reviews.text: Great steaks. The 22 oz medium rare rib-eye is one of the best there is. Goes nicely with mashed potatoes.

reviews.name: Latasha P Lessington
reviews.text: Never disappoints. Great food, spirits and service. Worth every penny. The Chrysler building location remains my most favorite location.

reviews.name: Christopher King
reviews.text: Excellent service!   I’m from the Midwest and have often heard that New Yorkers are rude.  Not true!  Friendly staff and fabulous food.  The best and most interesting coconut cream pie I’ve ever had!

reviews.name: Jason Yang
reviews.text: The 15-year ribeye was extremely tender. It was a huge portion. My fiance got the lamb chops and she loved it. It was an amazing meal and out first time in the Chrysler Building location. Amazing service.

reviews.name: Dianne Pogoda
reviews.text: Outstanding food and wine.  Not  inexpensive, but worth every penny. True fine dining.

reviews.name: PeterJ Romano
reviews.text: Very Attentive service from our waiter Oscar. Everyone in my small group (4) enjoyed their entrees as well and the relaxed and unrushed lunch. Its my 3rd visit this year to this restaurant and I'll definitely be looking forward to going back. Reservations highly recommended if going during lunch or dinner hours and certainly around the holidays.

reviews.name: Bilal Moustapha
reviews.text:
Came for dessert and very glad we did. 
Calorie loaded, sin inducing, absolutely delicious way to end the night. 
The brulee cheesecake alone would be worth the trip.

reviews.name: Kristi Stanley
reviews.text: We loved this place!! Went 4 times while we were here for our honeymoon! The bartenders (Michael, Marco, and Elyssa) were the best!! They made us feel like instant regulars! The food was amazing and every drink was made with craft and excellence! This place was the perfect hole in the wall to check out! Thank you guys for being a part of our honeymoon trip! 🙏🙏😍

reviews.name: Angel Adams
reviews.text: Excelent food! I had the Lamb chops with mash and asparagus, the beet salad, pork dumplings. Service was quick and friendly. Cozy place, great for date night or small group gatherings!

reviews.name: Denise Talarico Charlier Bissacot
reviews.text: Loved the music, the atmosphere and the food. I had the baby scallops with tomatoes and asparagus and it was delicious. A friend had the lava cake and love it as well.

reviews.name: Cathy Lewis
reviews.text: Shared a pear salad, loved my chicken, be sure to save room for dessert. Highly recommend the brownie with salted caramel icecream, whipped cream, pecans, and hot fudge. Yum!!!

reviews.name: Casey Zilionis
reviews.text: We were here for drinks and bites at the bar before a show. Get there right when they open at 5pm if you want a seat at the bar.....place fills up fast. Cozy atmosphere, excellent crafted cocktails, food was OK (we had the charcuterie/cheese board...$28).

reviews.name: Emmy Varner
reviews.text: Steak was good. Waiter was so fun! And allowed me to sample some wine before I commited to a glass. Also very fairly priced and nice atmosphere.

reviews.name: Teri Weefur
reviews.text: Romantic vibe. Stopped in for a drink and apps before a show and loved the ambience. The cheese and meat board was delish!

reviews.name: J.C., M.D. of Divinity
reviews.text: This a great, fun place with excellent food, attentive staff, reasonably priced fare. and entertainment (classic films screened on the walls) to boot.  Been there a few times and have yet to get something I didn't like.  You must try the brussel sprouts!

title: Thai Villa
address: 5 E 19th St, New York, NY 10003, United States

reviews.name: Brian Coyne
reviews.text: Wonderful food. Great vegan options (mock duck and curries)

reviews.name: Nandini Mazumdar
reviews.text: Amazing spot for delicious Thai food and amazing service - highly recommend the calamari appetizer, the basil fried rice, the pad see ew and the wok basil curry (I had these with tofu/veggies/shrimp but great with any protein). The dishes are flavorful and the right amount of spicy. The lycheetinis are delicious and the service is really great.

reviews.name: Grace Ok
reviews.text:
BEST THAI FOOD IN NYC.

I would suggest coming here with friends or family or even a date.
The whole crew here is always working hard! Beware that there may be a wait unless you reserve a table ASAP. It's always busy here right after lunch time so I suggest reserving. The atmosphere is so soothing.  I love the decor. However, the best part is the FOOD. Everything is seasoned well and cooked very well whenever I visit. They always refill my water as soon as possible which I love and always ask if I need anything else. I always get the chicken or pork curry and it's really good!! I always think about this place whenever I'm on fifth ave. It's definitely a great place to eat. Beware of the place closing at 3:15pm and reopening at 5pm! 
Go eat and enjoy enjoy enjoy~

reviews.name: Marc A
reviews.text: Totally outstanding! Everything was perfect, from the great service team, tasty and great food, the ambience is stunning. We had a bunch of things, we wanted to sample everything on their menu frankly. The portions are really generous and such creative options. The waiters are really nice and make great suggestions. You should definitely make a reservation, there seemed to be a long wait for walk-ins.

reviews.name: Keyla Calderas
reviews.text:
This place was amazing!!!
First time trying Thai and didn’t know what to expect but the environment was really cool.
The design of the place is beautiful.
The place was full and there were long waiting lines( worth it)  and even like that, the food came super fast not even 30 minutes!!!
Our host Kyle was amazing and really sweet boy, thanks Kyle for great service.

Definitely recommend and will be going back.

reviews.name: Emely Melendez
reviews.text:
Beautiful. Managed in the best manner possible. Most desired restaurant in the city. Underrated!! One of the best Thai spots across the nation & yes... I have tried many across the nation! Flavors are authentic, quality out of this world!!! By far one of my favorite restaurants. I doubt anyone could ever be disappointed here. 
Recommend dishes for anyone new to Thai
Grilled prawn pad Thai 
Crab fried rice 
Coconut curry with seafood 
Papaya salad

Also the Compote desert is like never before 
A must try! Won't find such a desert in any other Thai spot, rare and delicious but very different for newbies! 
Hope you can love it as much as I did! 

5 stars aren't enough!!

reviews.name: Sajev Lucksman
reviews.text: Excellent restaurant. They don’t take reservations which really sucks and you might have to wait a very long time to be seated but it’s all well worth it. we're so glad you love so many of our dishes. We're looking forward to having you back for some more Compote dessert!

reviews.name: Espen Pattaelsker
reviews.text: For a genuine Thai eating experience- try Thai Villa.  They don't take reservations but you can do advanced "waitlist". Once there, if you do the waitlist the wait isn't more than 20 to 30 min.  It's an entertaining wait because you see how many people order take out or delivery from this place.  Sitting there waiting, thinking -it's got to be good if this many people want it to go too!   If you peek around the corner and there are seats at the bar, you can sit there without the wait.  I can't even tell you the name of anything that the 3 of us ordered but we were all so so happy with what we ordered.  They even brought us a sample shot of yellow squash soup - loved that!  Portions were large and truly great.  I don't recommend huge party size here but up to 6 people would not be a challenge.   This is a must go to place!

title: I Sodi
address: 105 Christopher St, New York, NY 10014, United States

reviews.name: Claire Divas
reviews.text:
Place was busy on a weekend, really loud!! And tight tables
Bees butt- okay, boyfriend liked it
Spring rose- really good
Jasmine- too bitter/ the Campari
Old fashion - boyfriend likes it
Bread pudding with Jameson ice cream- great but so pricy at $14

reviews.name: yochay doutsh
reviews.text:
The fried Artichokes were not great, but the steak tartar was one of the best we had in a while.
And the Lasagna, oh, that was just a master-piece.
We also had the pork-chop in milk which was very interesting and delicious, it's always a treat to taste something like nothing you've tasted before.

reviews.name: E K
reviews.text: If you are lucky enough to find yourself here, there are no bad orders. Best lasagna that ever existed, staff is impeccable. Attainable but yet out of easy reach. Best consistent meal you can have in NYC. Get here an hour before you want to eat and put a name in. You will not be disappointed.

reviews.name: Albert Moore
reviews.text:
I go Cheesecake Factory a lots for always fresh salads and homemade dressings, always outstanding
Last night  something wrong was going in restaurant:
We order 2 salads they came from kitchen with poor quality and presentation, we send it back!
Order BBQ ranch salad, in e few minutes manager arrived and asked us how we doing:
We told him about our unusual experience
He took everything Very Seriously, went to kitchen and even made special salmon for my friend
Superb customer service!!!
His name is Sergio!
If you have any misunderstandings during you experience in Cheesecake Factory- just ask for Sergio- you don't need to worry about anything else
Lucky You if he is working that day!!

reviews.name: Alexandria Bocco
reviews.text: Really fantastic place. I loved how small and intimate it was, we had to sit at the bar because we didn’t have reservations but the bartender was so helpful and nice. Food was superb, the best ravioli I’ve ever had.

reviews.name: Heidi Bailey
reviews.text: Hands down, the best lasagna I’ve ever had. And I don’t even like lasagna. Yummy!

reviews.name: Sara Sopher
reviews.text: Food is good, but portions are small and pricey. And the restaurant doesn’t play any music which I found a little odd

reviews.name: Eli Showalter
reviews.text:
Finally got here on a night where there happened to be a couple free seats at the bar upon arrival — around 6pm on a Thursday. 

We were very well taken care of by our waiter. The tartar and the lasagna were terrific. My highlight was the Negroni Terra. So perfectly balanced. 

Given the chance I would definitely come back.

title: Empire Steak House
address: 151 E 50th St, New York, NY 10022, United States

reviews.name: Luke R
reviews.text: I adore this place! They provide first-rate food, their menu is large, The cook in that restaurant is very experienced, I like a lot tasting all their dishes. The food is always fresh, the service towards the clients  is good. I frequently visit this restaurant and I not even once was unhappy. I recommend it with no hesitation.

reviews.name: Marietta Hatzipanayotidou
reviews.text: Typical stake house with excellent service and good food. Stakes are great,  burgers too. The deserts are totally tasteless and need improvement (but they were on the house, so thank you anyway)

reviews.name: Mehetabel reyes
reviews.text: This was the best restaurant we went to while in NYC by far!! I called the night of xmas eve to make reservations and they took us right away which was shocking because everyone was already overbooked. The food was incredible and the service was amazing!! They had a special menu for Christmas and it was delicious! Steaks were cooked perfectly. This was a very pricey dinner but it was worth every penny

reviews.name: Karis George
reviews.text:
Stayed at the bar - fantastic whiskey selection and an amazing offer on a Wagyu burger (only 14 bucks at the bar)

Staff were amazing and even the owner made me feel like a part of the family. Excellent decor and a really well kept and super clean place.

Top place in NYC to go!

reviews.name: Gotham Cosmopolite
reviews.text: Nice steakhouse in midtown, old style steak house and nice interior with chandeliers and booths.

reviews.name: Jimmy Wright
reviews.text: This is a great steak restaurant with wonderful service. It is located at the Hotel Kimberly which is a recommended place as well.  The manager is friendly and inviting.  We believe this is one of the best steakhouses in NYC.  We love Peter Luger's and Keen's.  But this place ranks up there with these best of places.

reviews.name: Chinh Chinh
reviews.text: Came here for restaurant week for a friend's birthday. It was one of the few steak restaurants that actually had steak on their restaurant week prix fixe menu. Everything on that menu was actually really good too compared to bare bones of other places. And the portions are still large regardless of prix fixe. Everything was absolutely delicious! And the servers were all so nice and super friendly. You know how some restaurants come off pretentious?  Well this one is not. Everyone was fabulous. Would def love to dine here again.

reviews.name: Lana Seidman
reviews.text: Loved our Holiday Party at Empire Steak House. Atmosphere was cool and swanky. The service was impeccable and the food was as good as it gets. Our steak for 3 was delicious. Can't wait to go back with family and friends.

title: La Contenta
address: 102 Norfolk St, New York, NY 10002, United States

reviews.name: Eddie Jimenez
reviews.text: Food was surprisingly good. Service is fast and staff friendly.

reviews.name: Juana Mateo
reviews.text: Looking for a place to eat,  found this small,charming and family style restaurant.  Ambient great,  food delicious,  serving excellent.

reviews.name: ben l
reviews.text: Steak and a ton of drinks.  Go for happy hour... Otherwise the drinks are Way too expensive.  We use love this place but less so now because of $$.

reviews.name: Indiiana
reviews.text: Great service, amazing tacos (I had the carne asada), good prices during happy hour. It was very hot inside during summer.

reviews.name: Stephanie J
reviews.text: Came for brunch on a Friday morning with my husband and another couple. It was great! Very quaint place. Good service and delicious food! Highly recommend it.

reviews.name: michael rabiner
reviews.text: This is a small Mexican restaurant on the LES. It is small , seats maybe 15 - 20 people but you can make reservations. Has a very large selection of tequilas and a pretty good bar. My steak was excellent, but my wife's salmon was a bit over cooked. The nachos were also very good. Would eat there again

reviews.name: Omar Rivera
reviews.text: Great drinks, mezcal and refreshing margaritas, tasty food, fine service and fair price.

reviews.name: Danny Elisha
reviews.text: Authentic Mexican cuisine! Awesome drink menu as well. This place is really small, so reservations are strongly recommended.
